If the worker makes this request after the fitness assessment, they have 7 calendar days after receiving the occupational health doctor's decision to make the request. They must justify their request and send it by registered mail to: the occupational health doctor; and to their employer. The occupational health doctor may: invite the worker for a medical examination; examine their workstation; discuss with the treating physician, the medical advisor, etc., if the worker agrees. The occupational health doctor has 30 calendar days after receiving the request to: make their decision; send their decision to the worker and the employer; determine the conditions that the adapted work or other job must meet. For more information, see: the SPF Employment, Work and Social Concertation website; the explanatory diagram in the standard documents of this sheet.

legal article: § 1er. Sans préjudice de l'article 50, les parties peuvent convenir de la révision du loyer entre le neuvième et le sixième mois précédant l'expiration de chaque triennat.A défaut d'accord des parties, le juge peut accorder la révision du loyer s'il est établi que par le fait de circonstances nouvelles, la valeur locative normale du bien loué est supérieure ou inférieure de vingt pour cent au moins au loyer exigible au moment de l'introduction de la demande.Il peut de même accorder une augmentation de loyer au bailleur qui établit que la valeur locative normale du bien loué a augmenté de dix pour cent au moins du loyer exigible au moment de l'introduction de la demande, en raison de travaux effectués à ses frais dans le bien loué à l'exception des travaux nécessaires en vue de mettre le bien loué en conformité avec les conditions de l'article 9, alinéa 1er.Si cette révision a pour effet d'augmenter le montant du loyer, elle n'est due que si le bail a été conclu par écrit et, pour un bail portant sur un bien immeuble, que si le bail écrit a été enregistré.Le juge statue en équité.L'action ne peut être intentée qu'entre le sixième et le troisième mois précédant l'expiration du triennat en cours.Le loyer révisé produit ses effets à compter du premier jour du triennat suivant, l'ancien loyer demeurant provisoirement exigible jusqu'à la décision définitive.Dans le cas de l'article 55, § 8, les parties peuvent cependant renoncer à la faculté de demander la révision du loyer.§ 2. Si un bien fait l'objet de baux successifs, conclus avec des preneurs différents pour une durée inférieure ou égale à trois ans, auxquels il est mis fin moyennant un congé donné par le bailleur, le loyer de base ne peut, pendant neuf années successives, pas être supérieur au loyer exigible au début de cette période, proportionnellement adapté au coût de la vie, sauf si la valeur locative normale du bien loué a augmenté de vingt pour cent au moins par le fait de circonstances nouvelles ou de dix pour cent au moins en raison de travaux effectués dans le bien loué.Nonobstant toute clause ou toute convention contraire, le juge réduit le loyer au loyer exigible en vertu du précédent bail, proportionnellement adapté au coût de la vie, si le bailleur ne prouve pas que le loyer a été fixé conformément aux dispositions de l'alinéa 1er.Le loyer proportionnellement adapté est calculé comme suit : loyer de base au début de la période de neuf années, multiplié par l'indice du mois précédant le mois de la conclusion du nouveau bail et divisé par l'indice du mois précédant le mois de la conclusion du bail au début de la période de neuf années.§ 3. A tout moment, chacune des parties peut demander au juge de paix la révision des frais et charges forfaitaires ou leur conversion en frais et charges réels.Le juge statue notamment sur la base de l'évolution des dépenses réelles.Il décide la conversion si elle est possible.
articleEN: Article 1: Without prejudice to article 50, the parties may agree to a revision of the rent between the ninth and the sixth month preceding the expiration of each three-year period. In the absence of agreement between the parties, the judge may order a revision of the rent if it is established that, due to new circumstances, the normal value of the leased property is at least twenty percent higher or lower than the due rent at the time of filing the application. The judge may also grant an increase in rent to the landlord who establishes that the normal value of the leased property has increased by at least ten percent due to works carried out at his expense, with the exception of works necessary to bring the leased property into compliance with the conditions of article 9, paragraph 1. If this revision results in an increase in the rent, it is only due if the lease was concluded in writing and, for a lease of real estate, if the written lease has been registered. The judge rules in fairness. The action may only be brought between the sixth and the third month preceding the expiration of the current three-year period. The revised rent takes effect from the first day of the following three-year period, with the provisional continued applicability of the old rent until the final decision. However, in the case of article 55, § 8, the parties may waive the right to request a revision of the rent.
question: Puis-je demander une diminution du loyer en cours de bail en Wallonie ?
questionEN: Can I request a reduction in rent during a lease in Wallonia?
answerLLM:
Based on the provided legal article in Wallonia, a request for a reduction in rent during an ongoing lease may be possible under certain circumstances. However, it is not explicitly stated that a tenant can request a reduction at any time during the lease.

The article mentions that the parties may agree to a revision of the rent between the ninth and sixth month preceding the expiration of each three-year period. In the absence of agreement, the judge may order a revision of the rent if there are new circumstances that cause the normal value of the leased property to increase or decrease by at least 20% or 10% (due to works carried out by the landlord), respectively.

If a revision results in an increase in the rent, it is only due if the lease was concluded in writing and registered (for real estate leases). The judge rules in fairness, and the action may only be brought between the sixth and third month preceding the expiration of the current three-year period. The revised rent takes effect from the first day of the following three-year period.

Therefore, while a reduction in rent might be possible due to new circumstances causing a decrease in the normal value of the leased property, it appears that such a reduction would follow the same rules and timeframes as a rent increase. It is not explicitly stated that a tenant can request a reduction at any time during the lease, and it would likely require the agreement of the landlord or a ruling by a judge.
goldy: This sheet has been updated more than a year ago. In principle, no. However, you can request a reduction in rent in certain cases (review). You can only request the review of the rent between the 9th and the 6th month that precedes the end of a current triennium. For example: If the end of a current triennium is December 31, the rent review can be requested between April 1 and June 30. If the end of a current triennium is January 31, the rent review can be requested between May 1 and July 31 and so on. If your landlord agrees on the amount of review, the new rent will be due from the 1st day of the following triennium. If your landlord does not agree, you can contact the justice of the peace between the 6th and 3rd month preceding the expiration of the current triennium. For example: If the end of a triennium is December 31, the request to the justice of the peace must be between July 1 and September 30. If the end of a triennium is January 31, the request to the justice of the peace must be between August 1 and October 31. The competent justice of the peace is the one located where the housing is located. To obtain the contact details of the relevant justice of the peace, see the website of the territorial competence. The review can be granted by the justice of the peace if you prove that the normal rental value of the housing is at least 20% lower than the rent at the time of the introduction of the request, due to new circumstances. New circumstances are circumstances that could not have been foreseen at the time of signing the lease, for example: the degradation of the neighborhood, the persistence of important and disturbing public works, the deterioration of the building, etc. If the judge finds that the conditions are met, he may grant the review. In this case, he sets the new rent, taking into account the interests of each party. The revised rent is due from the 1st day of the following triennium. If the legal action is not yet complete at the end of the triennium, the revised rent will be applied, retroactively, from the first day of the triennium.

legal article: voir NOTE sous TITRE  Avant de décider d'une action en recouvrement, le centre public effectue une enquête sociale sur la situation financière du débiteur d'aliments et les implications familiales de l'affaire.Cette enquête n'est pas obligatoire s'il ressort du dossier social de l'intéressé lui-même que des motifs d'équité peuvent être invoqués en vue du non-recouvrement ou que les coûts et démarches inhérents à cette récupération dépassent le résultat escompté.
articleEN: Prior to deciding on a debt recovery action, the public center conducts a social investigation into the debtor's financial situation and the familial implications of the case. This investigation is not required if it is clear from the debtor's own social file that there are grounds for equity that could lead to non-recovery or if the costs and procedures associated with this recovery exceed the expected outcome.
question: Dans quels cas peut-on demander au CPAS de renoncer à récupérer l'aide sociale ?
questionEN: In what cases can one request the CPAS to waive the recovery of social assistance?
answerLLM: Based on the provided legal article, one can request the CPAS (Public Center for Social Welfare) to waive the recovery of social assistance in cases where there are grounds for equity that could lead to non-recovery. The CPAS will conduct a social investigation into the debtor's financial situation and the familial implications of the case before deciding on a debt recovery action. However, this investigation is not required if it is already clear from the debtor's own social file that there are equity grounds for non-recovery. Additionally, the CPAS may consider waiving recovery if the costs and procedures associated with the recovery exceed the expected outcome. Therefore, a debtor may present evidence of financial hardship, family circumstances, or excessive recovery costs to request the CPAS to waive the recovery of social assistance.
goldy: The Public Center for Social Welfare (CPAS) can decide to waive recovery (or apply lower amounts than those provided by the scale) for "reasons of equity," that is, by taking into account the particular situation of the family. This is why it must conduct a social investigation before recovering the aid. The CPAS can freely decide if there are reasons of equity. For example, the CPAS could waive recovery if: a family is heavily indebted or has to bear important charges; family relationships risk being seriously disrupted; there already exists a conflict between you and your maintenance creditors; etc.

legal article: L'administration est une charge personnelle qui ne passe point aux héritiers de l'administrateur.L'administration vise à défendre les intérêts de la personne protégée. Elle accroît, dans la mesure du possible, l'autonomie de la personne protégée.
articleEN: The administration is a personal charge which does not pass on to the heirs of the administrator. The administration aims to defend the interests of the protected person. It increases, to the extent possible, the autonomy of the protected person.
question: Combien me coûte mon administrateur de biens ou de la personne ?
questionEN: How much does my property manager or guardian cost?
answerLLM: Based on the provided legal article, the cost of a property manager or guardian, also referred to as an "administrator," is not specified. The administration is considered a personal charge, which means that the administrator is personally responsible for the costs associated with managing the property or person. These costs are not passed on to the heirs of the administrator. The purpose of the administration is to defend the interests of the protected person and increase their autonomy to the extent possible. Therefore, the cost of the administrator may vary depending on the specific services required for the management of the property or person. It is recommended to consult with a legal professional for more detailed information regarding the potential costs of a property manager or guardian.
goldy: 1. If your administrator is a non-professional, for instance if they are a member of your family, they are not compensated. They can only request reimbursement of their expenses (travel, photocopies, stamps, etc.). The justice of the peace must give their approval.

legal article: § 1er. Toute personne intéressée peut adresser au Gouvernement ou son délégué, à l'Administration, à l'organisme public ou au bourgmestre une plainte relative au fonctionnement d'un service ou d'une institution en matière d'action sociale ou de santé.Toute plainte fait l'objet d'un accusé de réception envoyé dans les huit jours.§ 2. Le bourgmestre, l'Administration ou l'organisme public à qui une plainte a été adressée en informe sans délai :1° le Gouvernement ou son délégué;2° le service ou l'institution concerné par la plainte.§ 3. Lorsqu'une médiation s'avère possible, le bourgmestre ou son déléguépeut agir en conciliation et formuler des recommandations qui lui semblent de nature à apporter une solution aux difficultés de fonctionnement.§ 4. Le bourgmestre, l'Administration ou l'organisme public adressent au Gouvernement ou son déléguéun rapport sur les informations qu'ils ont pu recueillir.Le service ou l'institution concerné informe sans délai le bourgmestre, l'Administration ou l'organisme public des suites réservées à la plainte.Le Gouvernement ou son délégué, l'Administration ou l'organisme public informe le plaignant et le service ou l'institution concerné de la suite réservée à la plainte.§ 5. Une fois par an, pour le 30 avril, le Gouvernement ou son déléguétransmet , pour les compétences qui le concernent, au Conseil de stratégie et de prospective visé aux articles 5 et suivantsles dossiers relatifs aux plaintes de l'année civile précédente selon les modalités qu'il détermine.
articleEN: Section 1. Any interested person may submit a complaint to the Government or its delegate, the Administration, a public body, or the mayor regarding the functioning of a service or institution in matters of social action or health. Any complaint shall be the subject of an acknowledgment of receipt sent within eight days.
question: Peut-on me demander de rembourser l’allocation pour l'aide aux personnages âgées en Wallonie ?
questionEN: Can I be asked to repay the allowance for aid to the elderly in Wallonia?
answerLLM: Based on the provided legal article, it does not seem to address the issue of repayment of allowance for aid to the elderly in Wallonia. The article only mentions the process of submitting a complaint regarding the functioning of a service or institution in matters of social action or health. Therefore, I would need additional information or legal articles to provide an accurate answer to your question. However, in general, the requirement to repay allowances or benefits granted by social welfare agencies is typically determined by the specific laws and regulations governing those programs, and would not be a matter of general administrative complaint procedures.
goldy: Yes, if you have received an allocation for the aid to elderly persons (APA) to which you were not entitled. This is called the repayment of overpayment (or what you received in excess). The APA service of your health insurance fund can recover what it has paid to you in excess. The APA service of your health insurance fund can go back: 2 years prior (we count two years from the payment of the overpayment); 5 years prior if you have committed fraud or made false declarations (for example, you did not declare income, or you did not mention that you lived with another person, etc.). After this period, the overpayment is prescribed. This means that the APA service of your health insurance fund can no longer recover the overpayment. The APA service of your health insurance fund must send you a registered letter to inform you that you must repay the overpayment. The APA service of your health insurance fund proposes a repayment plan to repay the overpayment. Be careful, in some cases the prescription is interrupted (the 3-year or 5-year period starts over): if the APA service of your health insurance fund sends you a registered letter to ask you to repay the overpayment; if the APA service of your health insurance fund recovers the overpayment by withholding your future APA; if you repay the overpayment; through a legal procedure; by the "classic" causes of interruption of prescription. For more information, see the sheet "Can I invoke prescription to not pay my debt?". For more information, see the FAQ on the AVIQ website.

legal article: Le bourgmestre propose une offre de relogement à l'occupant expulsé en vertu de l'article 7, alinéa 3 ou alinéa 7, si un des logements suivants est disponible :1. logements de transit;2. logements donnés en location au C.P.A.S. ou à un organisme à finalité sociale en application de l'article 132;3. logements pris en gestion par une agence immobilière sociale en application de l'article 193;4. structures d'hébergement assurées par des organismes agréés en vertu du décret du 12 février 2004 relatif à l'accueil, l'hébergement et l'accompagnement des personnes en difficultés sociales, ou du décret du 9 mai 1994 de la Communauté germanophone portant agréation d'institutions accueillant et encadrant provisoirement des personnes en détresse et portant octroi de subsides en vue de l'achat, la construction, la location, la remise en état et l'équipement d'habitations destinées à l'accueil d'urgence;5. logements issus du secteur locatif privé sur le territoire de la commune sur base de l'inventaire visé à l'alinéa 6.Si le bourgmestre ne dispose d'aucun logement, issu de ces catégories, disponible sur son territoire, il en informe la Société wallonne du Logement et lui transmet le dossier de consultation des gestionnaires de ces catégories de logement.Après avoir vérifié que les démarches requises en vertu de l'alinéa 1er ont été effectuées par le bourgmestre, la Société wallonne du Logement procède à la recherche d'un logement disponible sur le territoire de la province, dans un délai d'un mois, en recourant aux logements suivants :1. logements de transit;2. logements donnés en location à un C.P.A.S. ou à un organisme à finalité sociale en application de l'article 132;3. logements pris en gestion par une agence immobilière sociale en application de l'article 193;4. logements issus du secteur locatif privé;5. structures d'hébergement assurées par des organismes agréés en vertu du décret du 12 février 2004 relatif à l'accueil, l'hébergement et l'accompagnement des personnes en difficultés sociales, ou du décret du 9 mai 1994 de la Communauté germanophone portant agréation d'institutions accueillant et encadrant provisoirement des personnes en détresse et portant octroi de subsides en vue de l'achat, la construction, la location, la remise en état et l'équipement d'habitations destinées à l'accueil d'urgence.Si la Société wallonne du Logement ne trouve aucun logement sur le territoire de la province ou si le ménage expulsé n'accepte pas la proposition effectuée par le bourgmestre ou par la Société wallonne du Logement, plus aucune obligation de relogement n'incombe au bourgmestre et à la Société wallonne du Logement.Tout propriétaire privé peut manifester sa volonté de louer ou de mettre à disposition un bien dans le cadre d'une procédure de relogement auprès de la commune, sur le territoire de laquelle se situe le logement, ou de la Société wallonne du Logement.La commune et la Société wallonne du Logement tiennent un inventaire à jour de ces logements.Le recours à un logement du secteur locatif privé n'est permis que si le Fonds régional pour le relogement visé à la section 4 permet d'en financer partiellement la location.Le Gouvernement détermine la durée ainsi que le financement du relogement en fonction des ressources et des besoins de l'occupant expulsé.L'obligation de relogement visé au présent article ne s'applique pas lorsque l'habitation doit être évacuéepour cause de surpeuplement.
articleEN: Article: The mayor shall propose a resettlement offer to the evicted occupant in accordance with article 7, paragraph 3 or 7, if one of the following dwellings is available: 1. transit dwellings; 2. dwellings rented out by the Public Centre for Social Welfare (CPAS) or a social purpose organization in application of article 132;
question: Mon logement est reconnu inhabitable à cause de l'insalubrité. Mon logement fait l'objet d'un arrêté d'inhabitabilité à cause de l'insalubrité. Doit-on me reloger en Wallonie ?
questionEN: My housing has been declared uninhabitable due to insalubrity. My housing is subject to an uninhabitability order due to insalubrity. Am I entitled to relocation in Wallonia?
answerLLM: Based on the information provided in the legal article, in Wallonia, if your housing has been declared uninhabitable due to insalubrity and is subject to an uninhabitability order, you may be entitled to relocation. The article states that the mayor is required to propose a resettlement offer to the evicted occupant if a transit dwelling or a dwelling rented out by the Public Centre for Social Welfare (CPAS) or a social purpose organization is available. Therefore, if such housing options are available, you may have a right to relocation. However, it is important to note that this answer is based on the provided legal article and there may be additional factors or laws that could affect your entitlement to relocation. It is recommended to consult with a legal professional for further advice.
goldy: When a mayor pronounces an uninhabitability decree based on a health inspection, they must verify if there is a solution for rehousing in "public" housing within the territory of the commune. However, the mayor must look for rehousing only if the following three conditions are met: The mayor (or the Government) has pronounced an occupation ban on the housing (uninhabitability decree); The occupation ban is not caused by overcrowding of the housing; The delay between the decision of occupation ban and the planned date of eviction does not allow the occupants to find new housing. The third condition has been introduced since July 28, 2018. Furthermore, the mayor does not actually have the obligation to find new housing for the occupant. They must offer rehousing to the evicted occupant, if any of the following housing is available in the commune: 1. Transit housing; 2. Housing rented by the Public Centre for Social Welfare (CPAS) or a social purpose organization; 3. Housing managed by a social housing agency (AIS); 4. Housing facilities ensured by approved organizations that accommodate people in social difficulties or distress. 5. Housing of a private landlord within the territory of the commune. The conditions are: the landlord has expressed their willingness to make it available in the context of a rehousing procedure with the commune; the Regional Housing Fund partially finances the rent. The commune must keep an inventory of housing made available by a private landlord. This possibility of resorting to private housing if the landlord is willing is applicable since July 28, 2018. The offer of rehousing must be made at the latest at the time of eviction. In conclusion: the mayor must look for new housing in limited cases, and they do not have the obligation to find one. If no housing is available on the territory of their commune, the mayor transmits the file to the Walloon Housing Society (SWL). The SWL: controls the steps taken by the mayor; looks for a rehousing solution on the wider territory of the province; looks for a rehousing solution among the same categories of housing as the mayor. There is no guarantee that they will find available housing.

legal article: Le précompte immobilier afférent à l'habitation louée ne peut être mis à charge du preneur.
articleEN: The property tax related to the rented dwelling cannot be charged to the tenant.
question: Mon propriétaire me réclame le précompte immobilier. Dois-je payer en Wallonie ?
questionEN: My landlord is claiming reimbursement for the property tax. Do I have to pay it in Wallonia?
answerLLM: Based on the relevant law article you provided, it is clear that in Wallonia, a tenant cannot be charged or required to pay the property tax related to their rented dwelling. This means that if your landlord is claiming reimbursement for the property tax, you are not obligated to pay it. It is the landlord's responsibility to cover this cost, as it is considered part of their obligations and expenses related to the property ownership.
goldy: No, the property tax cannot ever be demanded from you, even if the contract stipulates it. This is an imperative rule. However, this does not prevent you from benefiting from the reduction of property tax that you are entitled to when you meet certain conditions related to your family situation. For example, this is the case if you have a disabled person in your care, or at least two children, one of whom is dependent on you. For more information, see the question "How can I benefit from the reduction of property tax?"

legal article: § 1er. La periode de maternité constitue une période de repos de douze semaines, ou de treize semainesen cas de naissance multiple, au cours de laquelle la titulaire ne peut exercer son activité professionnelle habituelle ni aucune autre activité professionnelle.§ 2. La période de repos de maternité comprend une période obligatoire et une période facultative.a La période obligatoire se compose d'un total de trois semaines : une semaine de repos prénatal obligatoire et deux semaines de repos postnatal obligatoire.La semaine obligatoire de repos prénatal débute à partir du septième jour qui précede la date présumée de l'accouchement.Les semaines obligatoires de repos postnatal prennent cours le jour de l'accouchement et s'étendent à une période egale à deux semaines.b La période facultative comprend le repos prénatal facultatif et le repos postnatal facultatif.Le repos prénatal facultatif s'étend au plus tôt à partir de la troisième semaine qui précède la date présumée de l'accouchement, jusqu'au septième jour qui précède la date présumée de l'accouchement.Le repos postnatal facultatif s'étend à une période qui correspond aux douze ou treize semainesen cas de naissance multiple, dont sont déduites l'éventuelle période de repos prénatal facultatif et la période obligatoire.Le repos postnatal facultatif prend cours au plus tôt à partir du premier jour qui suit les deux semaines de repos postnatal obligatoire.Par dérogation au § 1er, la titulaire peut, durant la période facultative, exercer son activité professionnelle habituelle à mi-temps, par période de sept jours calendrier. Dans ce cas, la période facultative comprend au maximum dix-huit semaines de repos de maternité à mi-temps ou vingt semaines de repos de maternité à mi-temps quand une naissance multiple est prévue.La période de repos postnatal facultatif, qu'il s'agisse d'un repos complet ou à mi-temps, doit être prise par période de sept jours calendrier et avant la fin d'une période maximum de trente-six semaines. Cette période de trente-six semaines prend cours le premier jour suivant les deux semaines de repos postnatal obligatoire.§ 3. A la demande de la titulaire, la période de repos de maternité visée au § 2 peut être prolongée lorsque l'enfant nouveau-né doit rester hospitalisé plus de sept jours à compter de sa naissance.Dans le cas visé à l'alinéa précédent, la période de repos de maternité est prolongée d'une durée égale au nombre de semaines complètes d'hospitalisation de l'enfant qui excède ces sept premiers jours. La durée de cette prolongation ne peut toutefois dépasser vingt-quatre semaines.La période maximale de repos de maternité facultatif de vingt-quatre semaines qui découle de la prolongation en cas d'hospitalisation de l'enfant, visée dans l'alinéa précédent, peut être prise à mi-temps, par période de sept jours calendrier, durant laquelle la titulaire reprend son activité professionnelle habituelle. Dans ce cas, la durée de la prolongation comprend au maximum quarante-huit semaines de repos de maternité mi-temps.La prolongation de la période de repos de maternité d'une durée de vingt-quatre semaines ou quarante-huit semaines en cas de repos de maternité à mi-temps,au maximum prend cours à partir du premier jour qui suit les deux semaines de repos postnatal obligatoire visées au § 2, a, du présent article.Par dérogation au § 2, b, du présent article, la période de repos postnatal facultatif prend cours, en cas de prolongation pour hospitalisation du nouveau-né, le premier jour qui suit la fin de la période de prolongation.
articleEN: Section 1. The maternity leave period consists of a twelve-week rest period, or a thirteen-week period in the case of multiple births, during which the holder cannot exercise her usual professional activity or any other professional activity.
question: Je suis travailleur indépendant(e). J'accouche plus plus tôt ou plus tard que prévu. Quelles sont les conséquences sur mon congé de maternité si je suis travailleuse indépendante ?
questionEN: I am a self-employed worker. I give birth earlier or later than expected. What are the consequences on my maternity leave if I am a self-employed worker?
answerLLM: Based on the provided legal article, if you are a self-employed worker who gives birth earlier or later than expected, the consequences on your maternity leave are that you are entitled to a minimum maternity leave period of twelve weeks for a single birth, or thirteen weeks in the case of multiple births. This period starts from the date of the birth of your child, regardless of whether you gave birth earlier or later than expected. During this period, you are not allowed to exercise your usual professional activity or any other professional activity. Therefore, you should plan your self-employment activities accordingly, ensuring that you take the necessary time off for your maternity leave.
goldy: Before going further, it's important to note that maternity leave rules and conditions are not exactly the same for salaried workers as they are for self-employed workers. The regime for the self-employed applies to: self-employed women, assistants to self-employed workers, and spouses of self-employed workers. For the sake of simplicity, we will use the term "self-employed woman" here to refer to all three categories of women who are eligible for maternity leave under the self-employed regime. You must have a continuous rest period of at least 3 weeks in total. If you give birth earlier than expected, the postnatal rest period (which is mandatory for 2 weeks after giving birth) will be extended by the remaining duration of the mandatory prenatal rest period that you did not take. This means that you can still recover the days from the mandatory prenatal rest period. They are not lost. If you give birth later than expected, you must still rest for the 2 weeks following the birth, even if you have already taken more than 1 week of rest before the birth. This means that you will have more than 3 weeks of mandatory rest in total, but your optional leave will be reduced. If you give birth in the middle of a week, any lost days from the prenatal period will be carried over to the postnatal period and therefore recovered. In any case, any remaining balance of an incomplete rest period before the birth must be taken immediately after the 2 weeks of mandatory postnatal rest. For more information, please visit the INASTI website.

legal article: § 1er. Les allocations familiales sont accordées jusqu'à l'âge de 21 ans en faveur de l'enfant qui est né au plus tard le 31 décembre 1992 et qui est atteint d'une incapacité physique ou mentale de 66 p.c. au moins et ce à titre de mesure transitoire.  Le Roi détermine par qui, selon quels critères et de quelle manière l'incapacité physique et mentale de l'enfant est constatée, ainsi que les conditions auxquelles l'enfant doit satisfaire.La constatation de l'incapacité physique ou mentale peut faire l'objet d'une révision dans les conditions déterminées par le Roi.§ 2. Les allocations familiales sont accordées jusqu'à l'âge de 21 ans en faveur de l'enfant  qui est atteint d'une affection qui a des conséquences pour lui sur le plan de l'incapacité physique ou mentale ou sur le plan de l'activité et de la participation, ou pour son entourage familial.  Le Roi détermine par qui, selon quels critères et de quelle manière les conséquences de l'affection visées à l'alinéa 1er sont constatées ainsi que les conditions auxquelles l'enfant doit satisfaire.La constatation des conséquences de l'affection peut faire l'objet d'une révision dans les conditions déterminées par le Roi.§ 3. Le Roi peut par arrêté délibéré en Conseil des Ministres, déterminer sous quelles conditions et pour quelle période l'enfant, qui est né après le 1er janvier 1996, bénéficie des allocations familiales par application du § 1er. § 4. Le Roi peut, par arrêté délibéré en Conseil des Ministres, déterminer sous quelles conditions et pour quelle période l'enfant, qui est né après le 31 décembre 1992 et au plus tard le 1er janvier 1996, bénéficie des allocations familiales par application du § 1er.
articleEN: Section 1. Family allowances are granted up to the age of 21 in favor of the child who was born at the latest on December 31, 1992 and who is suffering from a physical or mental disability with a degree of incapacity of at least 66% as a transitional measure. The King determines by whom, according to what criteria, and in what manner the physical and mental incapacity of the child is established, as well as the conditions that the child must meet. The determination of the child's physical or mental incapacity may be reviewed under the conditions determined by the King.
question: Mon enfant est handicapé et touche un supplément d'allocations familiales, jusqu'à quand y a-t-il droit en Wallonie ?
questionEN: What is the duration of my disabled child's entitlement to the family allowance supplement in Wallonia?
answerLLM:
Based on the information provided in the legal article, a disabled child in Wallonia is entitled to the family allowance supplement up to the age of 21, provided that they were born on or before December 31, 1992, and have a physical or mental disability with a degree of incapacity of at least 66%. The specifics regarding how the child's physical and mental incapacity is determined, as well as any conditions that the child must meet, are determined by the King. The determination of the child's physical or mental incapacity may also be reviewed under the conditions determined by the King.

It is important to note that the age limit of 21 may be subject to change, as it is specified as a transitional measure. Therefore, it is recommended to consult the most up-to-date legislation or seek legal advice for the most accurate information.

legal article: § 1er. Sur la proposition ou après avis de la Société, le Gouvernement fixe, s'il échet par dérogation aux dispositions du Décret relatif au bail d'habitation, les conditions d'accès,de location ou d'occupation d'un logement géré ou construit par la Société ou par une société de logement de service public. Ces conditions concernent :1° l'admission des candidats et les priorités d'accès;°bis. Le formulaire unique de candidature qui indique notamment la procédure, les voies de recours et l'adresse de la chambre visée à l'article 171bis du Code;2° la procédure d'admission;3° les clauses des conventions de bail conclues pour une durée déterminée ou indéterminée ou des conventions d'occupationrelatives :a. à leur durée fixéeen tenant compte, notamment, de l'âge ou du handicap des ménages locataires, ainsi qu'aux conditions de résiliation étant entendu que, sans préjudice de l'article 7, aucune décision d'expulsion ne peut être exécutée du 1er novembre au 15 mars de l'année suivante. L'expulsion trouve à s'appliquer si le ménage n'accepte pas de suivre une guidance auprès du centre public d'action sociale; b. à la nature et au mode de calcul des charges;c. au mode de constitution, de versement et de libération de la garantie;d. à la procédure d'entrée et de sortie des lieux;e. aux obligations respectives des parties;f. aux sanctions;g. au mode de calcul des loyers ou des indemnités, en tenant compte des ressources des ménages locataires, du nombre d'enfants à charge ainsi que du degré de confort et d'équipement du logement;4° la procédure de recours.§ 1erbis. Le Gouvernement établit, sur la proposition de la Société wallonne du Logement, une Charte des sociétés et des locataires rappelant les droits et obligations de ceux-ci.§ 2. Sur la proposition ou après avis de la Société, le Gouvernement fixe les conditions d'acquisition ou de vente d'un logement géré, construit ou vendu par la Société ou par une société de logement de service public.Ces conditions concernent notamment :1° les revenus du ménage;2° le patrimoine immobilier du ménage.§ 3. Le présent article n'est pas applicable aux logements d'utilité publique gérés par la Société wallonne du Logement ou par les sociétés, sur lesquels elles ont un droit réel et n'ayant pas fait l'objet :1° d'une aide publique accordée en vertu du présent Code sauf autorisation du Gouvernement ou de son délégué s'agissant d'aide à l'équipement, au rééquipement, à l'aménagement et au réaménagement des équipements;2° pour l'acquisition ou la construction d'un financement public indirect via des recettes locatives perçues pour des logements ayant fait l'objet d'une aide publique.
articleEN: Section 1. Upon proposal by the Society or on its own initiative, and subject to derogation from the provisions of the Decree relating to housing leases, the Government shall set the conditions for access, lease, or occupation of housing managed or built by the Society or by a public utility housing company. These conditions shall cover:
question: Comment la société peut-elle mettre fin au bail de logement social en Wallonie ?
questionEN: How can a company terminate a social housing lease in Wallonia?
answerLLM:
Based on the provided legal article, it appears that the termination of a social housing lease in Wallonia, Belgium, would be governed by the conditions set by the Government for the access, lease, or occupation of social housing. These conditions can be proposed by the housing society or initiated by the government and can include provisions for terminating a lease. However, the legal article also states that these conditions are subject to derogation from the provisions of the Decree relating to housing leases. Therefore, it is possible that there may be additional rules or regulations that apply to the termination of a social housing lease in Wallonia.

It is important to note that the legal article does not provide specific guidance on how a social housing lease can be terminated. The exact procedure and grounds for termination may depend on the specific conditions set by the government and any applicable derogations from the Decree relating to housing leases.

To obtain more detailed and specific guidance on how to terminate a social housing lease in Wallonia, it would be advisable to consult the relevant Decree or seek legal advice from a qualified professional who is familiar with Belgian housing law.
goldy: This sheet has been updated more than a year ago. For contracts signed as of 01 January 2008, the social housing company (SLSP) can terminate the lease agreement in several situations: Notice at the 1st of January following the expiration of a triennium (period of 3 years) or at the expiration of the lease, with a notice period of 6 months Only if: The tenant is an owner or usufructuary (usufruit) of a dwelling, except if it is a dwelling recognized as unhealthy or unadapted or if a social real estate operator manages the lease of the dwelling; The dwelling has at least 4 bedrooms and is no longer proportionate, except for households with a member over 70 years old or disabled or when the SLSP has accepted a prior exemption to the housing rules. The dwelling specifically designed for people over 65 years old / students / disabled people, has been rented to a person not belonging to these categories (neither him nor a member of his household) and that a person meeting the specificity of the dwelling has introduced his application to the company, meets all the conditions to obtain the dwelling and that no other social housing adapted to this person or specifically designed for these people is vacant. In the last two cases, another social housing will be offered to the tenant. Notice at any time with a notice period of 3 months Only if: the tenant provides inaccurate or incomplete declarations relating to the composition of the household or information necessary for the calculation of the rent; the household does not respect the lease or the internal rules; in the case of a dwelling integrated into a cell A.V.J. (daily life assistance): when the services agreement concluded between the tenant and the association managing the cell A.V.J. is terminated. Notice at the expiration of the 9-year lease with a notice period of 6 months Only if: The tenant is no longer eligible for social housing. That is to say, if the tenant's income exceeds the income ceilings provided for tenants "with medium revenues". To know these ceilings, see the summary table in the standard documents. CAUTION: The SLSP must justify all its decisions and must hear the tenant if he so requests. The SLSP must always send the notice by registered mail. For contracts concluded before 01 January 2008, refer to the lease. The possibilities of termination are more limited.

legal article: § 1er. Les droits d'une personne majeure 2inscrits dans la présente loi sont exercés par la personne même, pour autant qu'elle soit capable d'exprimer sa volonté pour ce faire.Ces droits sont cependant exercés par une personne que le patient a préalablement désignée pour se substituer à lui, pour autant et aussi longtemps qu'il n'est pas en mesure d'exercer ses droits lui-même.La désignation de la personne visée à l'alinéa 2 s'effectue par un mandat écrit spécifique, daté et signé par cette personne ainsi que par le patient, mandat par lequel cette personne marque son consentement. Ce mandat peut être révoqué par le patient ou par le mandataire désigné par lui par un écrit daté et signé.§ 2. Si le patient n'a pas désigné de mandataire ou si le mandataire désigné par le patient n'intervient pas, les droits établis par la présente loi sont exercés par l'administrateur de la personne, désigné par le juge de paix pour le faire, conformément à l'article 492/1, § 1er, alinéa 4,du Code civil, pour autant et aussi longtemps que la personne protégée n'est pas en mesure d'exercer ses droits elle-même.§ 3. Si aucun administrateur n'est habilité à représenter le patient en vertu du § 2, les droits établis par la présente loi sont exercés par l'époux cohabitant, le partenaire cohabitant légal ou le partenaire cohabitant de fait.Si la personne qui peut intervenir en vertu de l'alinéa 1er ne souhaite pas intervenir ou si elle fait défaut, les droits sont exercés, en ordre successif, par un enfant majeur, un parent, un frère ou une soeur majeurs du patient.Si la personne qui peut intervenir en vertu de l'alinéa 2 ne souhaite pas intervenir ou si elle fait défaut, c'est le praticien professionnel concerné, le cas échéant dans le cadre d'une concertation pluridisciplinaire, qui veille aux intérêts du patient. Il en va de même en cas de conflit entre deux ou plusieurs personnes pouvant intervenir en vertu du § 2 ou des alinéas 1er et 2.§ 4. Le patient est associé à l'exercice de ses droits autant qu'il est possible et compte tenu de sa capacité de compréhension.§ 5. Le droit de plainte visé à l'article 11 peut, par dérogation aux §§ 1er, 2 et 3, être exercé par les personnes visées à ces paragraphes, désignées par le Roi, par arrêté délibéré en Conseil des ministres, sans devoir respecter l'ordre prévu.
articleEN: Section 1. The rights of a mature person provided for in the present law are exercised by the person themselves, as long as they are capable of expressing their will to do so. However, these rights are exercised by a person previously designated by the patient to substitute them, for as long as the patient is unable to exercise their rights themselves. The designation of the person referred to in subsection 2 is made by a specific written mandate, dated and signed by this person and the patient, by which this person indicates their consent. This mandate can be revoked by the patient or by the designated mandatary by a dated and signed written document.
question: Qui exerce mes droits du patient si je ne suis plus capable ?
questionEN: Who exercises my patient rights if I am no longer able?
answerLLM: If you are no longer able to exercise your patient rights due to incapacity, the person who will exercise these rights for you is the individual you previously designated in a specific written mandate. This mandate must be dated, signed by both you and the designated person, and it is through this document that the designated person indicates their consent to substitute you. It's important to note that you, as the patient, reserve the right to revoke this mandate at any time by providing a written document signed and dated by you and the mandatary.
goldy: If you are unable to exercise your patient rights, different individuals can exercise them for you, in the following order of priority: Your patient representative (or proxy), if you had designated one while you were still capable of expressing your will. Your legal guardian if you have one, and if the court order specifies that the guardian can exercise the patient's rights. Consult the protection order issued by the justice of the peace. A legal guardian can never consent to or request certain acts on your behalf, such as sterilization, euthanasia, or interrupting a pregnancy. Certain family members: The spouse, legal cohabitant, or partner; If not, an adult child; If not, a parent; If not, an adult brother or sister. The caregiver. If the first person does not exist or does not intervene, it is the next one who intervenes, and so on. Discover our summary chart under the "documents-types" tab of this sheet.

legal article: L'allocation mensuelle de base visée à l'article 9 est majorée d'un supplément mensuel pour famille monoparentale de :1° 20 euros par enfant lorsque les revenus sont inférieurs à 30.386,48 euros bruts annuels;2° 10 euros par enfant lorsque les revenus se situent entre le plafond visé au 1° et 50.000 euros bruts annuels.Le Gouvernement détermine les personnes et les revenus à prendre en considération pour la détermination des plafonds visés à l'alinéa 1er.Ce supplément est accordé si l'allocataire désigné conformément à l'article 22 ne forme pas un ménage de fait avec une personne autre qu'un parent ou allié jusqu'au troisième degré inclusivement, ni n'est marié, sauf si le mariage est suivi d'une séparation de fait. La séparation de fait doit apparaître de la résidence principale séparée des personnes en cause, au sens de l'article 32, 3°, du Code judiciaire, exception faite des cas dans lesquels il ressort d'autres documents officiels produits à cet effet, que la séparation de fait est effective bien qu'elle ne corresponde pas ou plus avec l'information obtenue auprès du Registre national des personnes physiques.N'est pas considérée comme une séparation de fait, la situation des époux qui, alors qu'aucune rupture entre eux n'est avérée, font volontairement le choix de ne pas se domicilier à la même adresse ou qui, pour des raisons administratives, ne sont pas en mesure de le faire.
articleEN: The monthly basic allowance referred to in Article 9 is increased by a monthly supplement for single-parent families of: 1° 20 euros per child when revenues are less than 30,386.48 euros gross annually; 2° 10 euros per child when revenues are between the ceiling specified in 1° and 50,000 euros gross annually. The Government determines the persons and revenues to be taken into account for the determination of the ceilings referred to in the first subparagraph. This supplement is granted if the designated beneficiary, as referred to in Article 22, does not form a de facto household with any person other than a parent or relative up to the third degree inclusive, nor is married, except if the marriage is followed by a separation of fact. The separation of fact must appear from the main residence being separate from the persons concerned, within the meaning of Article 32, 3°, of the Judicial Code, with the exception of cases in which it appears from other official documents produced for this purpose, that the separation of fact is effective even if it does not correspond or no longer corresponds to the information obtained from the National Register of Natural Persons. The situation of spouses who, although no break between them has been established, voluntarily choose not to reside at the same address or who, for administrative reasons, are not able to do so, is not considered a separation of fact.
question: Je vis seul avec les enfants, ai-je droit à un supplément d'allocations familiales en Wallonie ?
questionEN: I am living alone with the children, am I entitled to a family allowance supplement in Wallonia?
answerLLM:
Based on the provided legal article, you may be entitled to a family allowance supplement in Wallonia if you are a single parent living alone with the children. The supplement is 20 euros per child if your annual gross revenues are less than 30,386.48 euros, and 10 euros per child if your annual gross revenues are between 30,386.48 euros and 50,000 euros.

However, to be eligible for the Family Allowance supplement, you must not form a de facto household with any person other than a parent or relative up to the third degree inclusive, and you cannot be married, except if the marriage is followed by a separation of fact. A separation of fact is established if your main residence is separate from your spouse or partner, as determined by the National Register of Natural Persons.

Therefore, if you are living alone with your children and are not married or in a de facto household with another person, you may be entitled to the family allowance supplement in Wallonia. It is recommended that you consult with the relevant authorities or a legal professional to confirm your eligibility based on your specific circumstances.

legal article: Biens antérieurs au mariage, successions et libéralitésSont propres, les biens et créances appartenant à chacun des époux au jour du mariage et ceux que chacun acquiert au cours du régime, par succession ou libéralité.
articleEN: Assets anterior to marriage, successions and liberality:
question: Je suis marié(e). Mon conjoint touche un héritage. Est-ce que j'en profite aussi ?
questionEN: I am married. My spouse receives an inheritance. Do I benefit from it as well?
answerLLM: Based on the legal article title "Assets anterior to marriage, successions and liberality," the answer to your question depends on whether the inheritance was received before or during the marriage. If your spouse received the inheritance before the marriage, then it is considered a premarital asset and typically would not be shared with you, the spouse. However, if your spouse received the inheritance during the marriage, then it may be considered part of the marital assets, depending on the specific laws of your jurisdiction and how the inheritance has been treated or managed. In some cases, inheritance money may be commingled with marital assets, making it difficult to distinguish as separate property. It is important to consult with a legal professional in your area to fully understand how inheritance is treated in your specific situation.
goldy: No. Regardless of your matrimonial regime, if one of you inherits, the inheritance belongs to him/her alone. He/She has no obligation to share it with you. Likewise, if one of you is in debt, the assets received through inheritance by the other cannot be seized to pay those debts. If the asset inherited generates income (for example, if it's an apartment that is rented out), the fate of these revenues depends on your matrimonial regime: If you are married under the regime of community of property, the rental income falls into the common estate. It belongs to both of you. These revenues can be used for the household expenses. They can also be used for the one of you who did not inherit, if he/she has debts, for example. If you are married under the regime of separation of property, the rental income belongs to the one who inherited. But he/she may be required to use it for the common expenses, since he/she must contribute in proportion to his/her abilities. The collection of rent increases his/her income, and therefore his/her ability to contribute to the common expenses. These revenues could therefore be used to buy a car for the family or to pay the mortgage on the family home.

legal article: § 1er. Sont Belges:1° l'enfant né en Belgique d'un auteur belge;2° l'enfant né à l'étranger:a d'un auteur belge né en Belgique ou dans des territoires soumis à la souveraineté belge ou confiés à l'administration de la Belgique;b d'un auteur belge ayant fait dans un délai de cinq ans à dater de la naissance une déclaration réclamant, pour son enfant, l'attribution de la nationalité belge;c d'un auteur belge, à condition que l'enfant ne possède pas, ou ne conserve pas jusqu'à l'âge de dix-huit ans ou son émancipation avant cet âge, une autre nationalité.La déclaration visée à l'alinéa 1er, 2°, b, est faite, et, sur la base de celle-ci, un acte de nationalité est établi conformément à l'article 22, § 4.La déclaration a effet à compter de l'établissement de l'acte de nationalité.Celui à qui la nationalité belge a été attribuée en vertu du premier alinéa, 2°, c, conserve cette nationalité tant qu'il n'a pas été établi, avant qu'il n'ait atteint l'âge de dix-huit ans ou n'ait été émancipé avant cet âge, qu'il possède une nationalité étrangère.§ 2. Pour l'application du paragraphe 1er, l'auteur doit avoir la nationalité belge au jour de la naissance de l'enfant ou, s'il est mort avant cette naissance, au jour de son décès.§ 3. La filiation établie à l'égard d'un auteur belge après la date du jugement ou de l'arrêt homologuant ou prononçant l'adoption n'attribue la nationalité belge à l'enfant que si cette filiation est établie à l'égard de l'adoptant ou du conjoint de celui-ci.§ 4. La personne à laquelle a été attribuée la nationalité belge de son auteur conserve cette nationalité si la filiation cesse d'être établie après qu'elle a atteint l'âge de dix-huit ans ou été émancipée avant cet âge. Si la filiation cesse d'être établie avant l'âge de dix-huit ans ou l'émancipation antérieure à cet âge, les actes passés avant que la filiation cesse d'être établie et dont la validité est subordonnée à la possession de la nationalité belge ne peuvent être contestés pour le seul motif que l'intéressé n'avait pas cette nationalité. Il en est de même des droits acquis avant la même date.
articleEN: Section 1. The following are Belgian: 1° The child born in Belgium of a Belgian parent; 2° The child born abroad: a. of a Belgian parent born in Belgium or in territories subject to Belgian sovereignty or entrusted to the administration of Belgium; b. of a Belgian parent who has, within five years of the birth, made a declaration claiming, for their child, the attribution of Belgian nationality; c. of a Belgian parent, provided that the child does not possess or does not retain until the age of eighteen or their emancipation before that age, another nationality. The declaration referred to in subparagraph 1, 2°, b, is made, and, based on this, an act of nationality is established in accordance with article 22, § 4. The declaration takes effect from the establishment of the act of nationality. The person to whom Belgian nationality has been granted under the first subparagraph, 2°, c, retains this nationality as long as it has not been established, before they reach the age of eighteen or have been emancipated before that age, that they possess a foreign nationality.
question: Enfant dont au moins un parent est belge. Mon enfant reçoit-il automatiquement la nationalité belge si je suis belge au moment de sa naissance ?
questionEN: Child with at least one Belgian parent. Does my child automatically receive Belgian nationality if I am Belgian at the time of their birth?
answerLLM:
Based on the provided legal article, your child does not automatically receive Belgian nationality at birth if you are Belgian, with the exception of certain circumstances. According to Section 1, there are three ways a child can acquire Belgian nationality at birth if they are born abroad to a Belgian parent:

1. If the Belgian parent was born in Belgium or in territories subject to Belgian sovereignty or entrusted to the administration of Belgium.
2. If the Belgian parent makes a declaration claiming the attribution of Belgian nationality for their child within five years of the child's birth.
3. If the Belgian parent is the only nationality holder, and the child does not possess or does not retain another nationality until the age of eighteen or their emancipation before that age.

In your case, if you are the Belgian parent and none of the above conditions are met, your child will not automatically acquire Belgian nationality at birth. However, you still have the option to make a declaration as stated in the second condition within five years of your child's birth to claim Belgian nationality for them.
goldy: Yes, but only in certain cases. If you are Belgian at the time of your child's birth, your child automatically receives Belgian nationality in 3 cases: your child is born in Belgium; your child is born abroad but you were born in Belgium; your child is born abroad and does not have any other nationality. In this case, there is no need for any specific administrative procedure. Your child receives Belgian nationality and the commune will register them in the population register. However, your child does not automatically receive Belgian nationality if both you and your child were born abroad. In this case, if you want your child to receive Belgian nationality, you can make a declaration of attribution of Belgian nationality before they turn 5. For more information on the declaration of attribution procedure, see our leaflet "What is the procedure for my child to receive Belgian nationality if I am Belgian?"

legal article: Sera puni d'un emprisonnement de huit jours à un an et d'une amende de cinquante à cinq cents eurosou d'une de ces peines seulement, celui qui s'abstient de venir en aide ou de procurer une aide à une personne exposée à un péril grave, soit qu'il ait constaté par lui-même la situation de cette personne, soit que cette situation lui soit décrite par ceux qui sollicitent son intervention.  Le délit requiert que l'abstenant pouvait intervenir sans danger sérieux pour lui-même ou pour autrui. Lorsqu'il n'a pas constaté personnellement le péril auquel se trouvait exposée la personne à assister, l'abstenant ne pourra être puni lorsque les circonstances dans lesquelles il a été invité à intervenir pouvaient lui faire croire au manque de sérieux de l'appel ou à l'existence de risques.La peine prévue à l'alinéa 1er est portée à deux ans lorsque la personne exposée à un péril grave est mineure d'âge ou est une personne dont la situation de vulnérabilité en raison de l'âge, d'un état de grossesse, d'une maladie, d'une infirmité ou d'une déficience physique ou mentale était apparente ou connue de l'auteur des faits.
articleEN: Anyone who refrains from providing assistance or from procuring assistance to a person who is exposed to serious danger, whether they have personally observed the situation of this person or whether it has been described to them by those who request their intervention, shall be punished with imprisonment from eight days to one year and a fine of fifty to five hundred euros, or with one of these penalties only. The offense requires that the person refraining from providing assistance could have intervened without serious danger to themselves or to others. When they have not personally observed the danger to which the person in need of assistance was exposed, the person refraining from providing assistance shall not be punished if the circumstances in which they were invited to intervene could have led them to believe in the lack of seriousness of the call or in the existence of risks. The penalty provided for in the first paragraph is increased to two years when the person exposed to serious danger is a minor or a person whose vulnerability due to age, pregnancy, illness, disability or mental or physical deficiency was apparent or known to the perpetrator of the acts.
question: Je reçois les confidences en tant que professionnel. Peut-on m'accuser de non-assistance à personne en danger si je me tais ?
questionEN: As a professional, can I be accused of not assisting a person in danger if I remain silent?
answerLLM: Yes, as a professional, you can be accused of not assisting a person in danger if you remain silent under the conditions outlined in the legal article. If you are aware that a person is exposed to serious danger, and you could have intervened without serious risk to yourself or others, you have a legal obligation to provide assistance or procure assistance for that person. Failing to do so could result in punishment with imprisonment and a fine. The penalty is increased if the person exposed to danger is a minor or someone who is vulnerable due to age, pregnancy, illness, disability, or mental or physical deficiency. However, you cannot be punished if the circumstances in which you were invited to intervene could have led you to believe in the lack of seriousness of the call or in the existence of risks.
goldy: It is rare, as the conditions are very strict. Many professionals are afraid of being accused of not providing assistance to a person in danger if they do not disclose certain information. However, your duty is to help. And you can help without breaking the professional secrecy, apart from a denunciation. Consider first the alternatives to breaking the professional secrecy: everything you can do to help the person. Even if this help is inadequate or ineffective, it does not matter. If you try to help the person, you cannot be prosecuted for not providing assistance to a person in danger. The conditions for there to be a genuine failure to provide assistance to a person in danger are very strict. It must: there be a serious, current and real danger (a hypothetical, potential and presumed danger is not enough); and that you have not provided assistance or help; and that your intervention does not present a serious danger to you; and that you are aware of the danger and the will not to act. Only conscious and voluntary inaction is punished. Failure to provide assistance to a person in danger only punishes those who have done nothing, nothing has been put in place to help the person. However, as a professional, most of the time you can do something, even if it is to direct the person to a help service, for example. Help does not necessarily have to be provided personally to the person in danger. Keep a record in your files, of what you have done to help the person. Failure to provide assistance to a person in danger does not only apply to professionals. It applies to any person, whether or not they are bound by professional secrecy. To assess whether help has been provided, the courts are stricter towards people whose profession makes them particularly able to provide first aid. For example, a doctor is more qualified to intervene in certain cases than a non-medical graduate citizen. If the conditions for failure to provide assistance to a person in danger are met, you cannot take refuge behind professional secrecy. You must break it, otherwise you will be punished for failure to provide assistance to a person in danger.

legal article: § 1er. Sauf dans le cas où il a été expressément convenu que les frais et charges imposés au preneur sont fixés forfaitairement, ils correspondent à des dépenses réelles.Ces frais et charges sont mentionnés dans un compte distinct.L'ensemble des documents établissant ces dépenses, reprenant les rubriques et les calculs détaillés formules, quotités sont produits.Dans le cas d'immeubles à appartements multiples, dont la gestion est assurée par une même personne, l'obligation est remplie dès lors que le bailleur fait parvenir au preneur un relevé des frais et charges, et que la possibilité est offerte à celui-ci ou à son mandataire spécial, de consulter les documents au domicile de la personne physique ou au siège de la personne morale qui assure la gestion.§ 2. Les dispositions contractuelles contraires au paragraphe 1er sont nulles.
articleEN: Article 1. Except in cases where it has been expressly agreed that costs and charges imposed on the lessee are fixed on a flat-rate basis, they correspond to actual expenses. These costs and charges are mentioned in a separate account. The entirety of documents establishing these expenses, including the categories, detailed calculations, and amounts, are provided. In the case of multi-unit buildings, whose management is ensured by one and the same person, the obligation is met if the landlord sends the lessee a statement of costs and charges, and the lessee or their special mandatary has the opportunity to consult the documents at the domicile of the natural person or the headquarters of the legal person responsible for management.
question: A quoi correspondent les charges en Wallonie ?
questionEN: What do charges correspond to in Wallonia?
answerLLM: Based on the provided legal article, charges in Wallonia for a lessee correspond to the actual expenses incurred in the context of the leased property, unless explicitly agreed upon as a flat-rate. These costs and charges must be mentioned in a separate account, accompanied by the entirety of documents establishing these expenses, including categories, detailed calculations, and amounts. In the case of multi-unit buildings managed by one person, the landlord is required to send the lessee a statement of costs and charges, and the lessee or their special mandatary has the opportunity to consult the documents at the domicile of the responsible natural person or the headquarters of the legal person responsible for management.
goldy: This sheet has been updated more than a year ago. The charges correspond to actual expenses, unless they are fixed flat-rate in the lease agreement or a rider. The amount of charges that is being claimed from you should correspond to reality, that is to say: what you have actually consumed; the actual expenses incurred by the landlord.

legal article: § 1er. Le présent chapitre s'applique aux baux d'habitation que le preneur, avec l'accord exprès ou tacite du bailleur, affecte dès l'entrée en jouissance à sa résidence principale.Est réputée non écrite la clause interdisant l'affectation des lieux loués à la résidence principale du preneur lorsqu'elle n'est pas appuyée par une justification expresse et sérieuse, relative notamment à la destination naturelle des lieux, et n'est pas accompagnée de l'indication de la résidence principale du preneur au cours du bail.Le présent chapitre s'applique également si l'affectation à la résidence principale se fait en cours de bail avec l'accord écrit du bailleur. Dans ce cas, le bail prend cours à la date de cet accord.§ 2. Le présent chapitre s'applique à la sous-location portant sur le bien d'habitation affecté à la résidence principale en exécution alinéas 1er et 3, conclue conformément à l'article 58 du présent chapitre, dans les limites prévues à ce même article.Le présent chapitre s'applique également aux sous-locations conclues par les personnes morales visées à l'article 47, alinéa 3, dans les limites prévues à l'article 60, § 2. Dans ce cas, le bail principal est lui aussi soumis aux dispositions du présent chapitre.§ 3. Le présent chapitre n'est pas applicable lorsque le contrat par lequel le bien d'habitation est accordé au preneur est l'accessoire d'un contrat principal relatif à la fonction ou à l'activité du preneur.§ 4. Le présent chapitre n'est plus applicable dès que prend fin l'affectation du bien loué à la résidence principale.§ 5. Sauf si elles en disposent autrement, les règles du présent chapitre sont impératives.§ 6. Dans le cadre du présent chapitre, les articles 7, 8, 9, 10 et 15 sont impératifs.
articleEN: Section 1. The present chapter applies to residential leases that the tenant, with the express or tacit consent of the landlord, uses for their primary residence from the start of the lease. Any clause prohibiting the use of the leased premises as the tenant's primary residence is deemed unwritten if it is not supported by a specific and serious justification, related to the natural destination of the premises, and is not accompanied by the indication of the tenant's primary residence during the lease. The present chapter also applies if the premises are used for the tenant's primary residence during the lease with the landlord's written consent. In this case, the lease begins on the date of such consent.
question: Mon bail est-il un bail de résidence principale en Wallonie ?
questionEN: Is my lease a primary residence lease in Wallonia?
answerLLM:
Based on the information provided in the legal article, the determination of whether a lease is a primary residence lease in Wallonia depends on the use of the leased premises as the tenant's primary residence with the landlord's consent.

If the tenant uses the leased premises as their primary residence from the start of the lease, with the express or tacit consent of the landlord, then the lease falls under the present chapter and is considered a primary residence lease. Any clause in the lease prohibiting the use of the premises as the tenant's primary residence is unenforceable unless it is supported by a specific and serious justification related to the natural destination of the premises and is accompanied by the indication of the tenant's primary residence during the lease.

Furthermore, even if the premises are not used for the tenant's primary residence at the start of the lease, but the tenant later obtains the landlord's written consent to use the premises as their primary residence during the lease, the present chapter will still apply from the date of such consent.

Therefore, to determine if your lease is a primary residence lease in Wallonia, you should consider whether you are using the leased premises as your primary residence with the landlord's consent, either from the start of the lease or at a later date with written consent.
goldy: Your lease is a lease for primary residence if: 1. The rented housing serves as your primary residence. This is the case if: you live actually in the housing; it is your main residence; it is you who have signed the lease. If this is not the case, you must indicate in the lease that you occupy the housing (you are the occupant), and that you establish your primary residence there. For example, your parents are signing the lease on your behalf. The registration at the building is often sufficient to demonstrate the primary residence. However, this is not necessary. The judge decides based on the concrete and real circumstances. You do not have to be present permanently in the housing. For example, you can go on a business trip or be hospitalized. You keep your "primary residence" at your initial address. 2. The owner has given his express or tacit (implicit) agreement. Your owner must agree that you live in the housing as a primary residence. If the owner has provided a clause in the lease contract to forbid you from installing your primary residence in the housing, this clause is not valid, unless: this clause provides an explicit and serious justification for the prohibition; and the address of your primary residence during the duration of the lease is specified in the contract. Therefore, it is not enough to indicate in the lease that "the rented building cannot be affected as the primary residence of the tenant" or "the building is rented for secondary residence purposes". If the clause is not valid, it is up to the justice of the peace to verify if in practice, the owner has given his tacit agreement or not.

legal article: § 1er.Lorsque les père et mère ne vivent pas ensemble, l'exercice de l'autorité parentale reste conjoint et la présomption prévue à l'article 373, alinéa 2, s'applique. A défaut d'accord sur l'organisation de l'hébergement de l'enfant, sur les décisions importantes concernant sa santé, son éducation, sa formation, ses loisirs et sur l'orientation religieuse ou philosophique ou si cet accord lui paraît contraire à l'intérêt de l'enfant, le tribunal de la famillecompétent peut confier l'exercice exclusif de l'autorité parentale à l'un des père et mère.Il peut aussi fixer les décisions d'éducation qui ne pourront être prises que moyennant le consentement des père et mère.Il fixe les modalités selon lesquelles celui qui n'exerce pas l'autorité parentale maintient des relations personnelles avec l'enfant. Ces relations ne peuvent être refusées que pour des motifs très graves. Celui qui n'exerce pas l'autorité conserve le droit de surveiller l'éducation de l'enfant. Il pourra obtenir, de l'autre parent ou tiers, toutes informations utiles à cet égard et s'adresser au tribunal de la familledans l'intérêt de l'enfant.Dans tous les cas, le juge détermine les modalités d'hébergement de l'enfant et le lieu où il est inscrit à titre principal dans les registres de la population.§ 2. Lorsque les parents ne vivent pas ensemble et qu'ils saisissent le tribunal de la famillede leur litige, l'accord relatif à l'hébergement des enfants est homologué par le tribunal sauf s'il est manifestement contraire à l'intérêt de l'enfant.A défaut d'accord, en cas d'autorité parentale conjointe, le tribunal examine prioritairement, à la demande d'un des parents au moins, la possibilité de fixer l'hébergement de l'enfant de manière égalitaire entre ses parents.Toutefois, si le tribunal estime que l'hébergement égalitaire n'est pas la formule la plus appropriée, il peut décider de fixer un hébergement non-égalitaire.Lorsque les parents ont plusieurs enfants, le tribunal tend vers l'adoption d'un même régime pour tous les frères et soeurs. Le cas échéant, le tribunal précise la manière dont les frères et soeurs entretiennent des relations personnelles entre eux.Le tribunal statue en tout état de cause par un jugement spécialement motivé, en tenant compte des circonstances concrètes de la cause et de l'intérêt des enfants et des parents.
articleEN: Section 1. When the father and mother do not live together, the joint exercise of parental authority remains in effect, and the presumption provided for in Article 373, paragraph 2, applies. In the absence of an agreement regarding the organization of the child's housing, important decisions concerning the child's health, education, training, leisure activities, and religious or philosophical orientation, or if such an agreement appears to be contrary to the child's best interest, the competent family court may grant exclusive parental authority to either the father or the mother. The court may also specify the educational decisions that can only be made with the consent of both parents. The court determines the terms under which the parent not exercising parental authority maintains personal relationships with the child. Such relationships cannot be refused except for serious reasons. The non-exercising parent retains the right to monitor the child's education and may obtain any useful information from the other parent or third parties regarding this matter, and may approach the family court in the child's interest. In all cases, the judge determines the child's housing arrangements and the place where the child is primarily registered in the population records.
question: Puis-je demander de modifier une décision d'hébergement de mes enfants ?
questionEN: Can I request to modify a decision regarding the housing of my children?
answerLLM:
Based on the provided legal article, it appears that the decision regarding the housing of your children is within the jurisdiction of the family court. Therefore, if you wish to modify a decision regarding the housing of your children, you would need to request the family court to do so. The court will determine the terms of the child's housing arrangements based on the child's best interest, even in the absence of an agreement between the parents.

It's important to note that even if the court grants exclusive parental authority to the other parent regarding the child's housing, you still have the right to maintain personal relationships with your child, monitor their education, and approach the family court in your child's interest.

Therefore, if you believe that modifying the decision regarding the housing of your children is necessary for your child's best interest, you may want to consult with a family law attorney to discuss the possibility of filing a request with the family court.
goldy: Yes. If your situation or that of your children changes, you can always: reach an amicable agreement to modify the child custody arrangements (the agreement can be made between you or with the help of a family mediator), or; go before the family court to ask the judge to decide. This applies no matter the reasons: the judge can modify the previous arrangement if it no longer suits you, or if it is no longer possible (for example, if you move, if the children change schools, etc.). As long as your children are minors, you can reapproach the family court with a simple written request or by filing conclusions at the clerk's office. You do not need to file a new request (via a petition), nor pay legal fees. And if one party moves far away? There is no legal rule dictating which parent must bear this change. Each situation is examined on a case-by-case basis. For example, if you move abroad and it is not possible for your child to visit every week, your custody period may be reduced. Be specific, especially regarding the costs generated by this new arrangement. For instance, specify which parent will pay for the transportation costs to the distant country.
