legal article: Toute personne pour laquelle aucune mesure de protection judiciaire visée à l'article 492/1 n'a été prise peut déposer devant le juge de paix de sa résidence ou, à défaut, de son domicile ou devant un notaire une déclaration dans laquelle elle fait connaître sa préférence en ce qui concerne l'administrateur ou la personne de confiance à désigner si le juge de paix ordonnait une mesure de protection judiciaire.Cette même déclaration peut contenir plusieurs principes que l'administrateur chargé d'une mission de représentation doit respecter dans l'exercice de sa mission.Il est établi un acte authentique de cette déclaration. Le juge de paix assisté du greffier peut se rendre à la résidence ou au domicile du demandeur, même en dehors de son canton, à la demande et aux frais de ce dernier, afin d'enregistrer une déclaration.Dans les quinze jours suivant le dépôt de la déclaration susvisée, le greffier ou le notaire fait enregistrer ladite déclaration dans un registre central, tenu par la Fédération Royale du Notariat Belge.Le Roi fixe les modalités de création, de tenue et de consultation du registre central. Le Roi détermine les autorités qui ont accès gratuitement au registre central. Le Roi fixe le tarif des frais pour l'enregistrement de ces déclarations.2La personne visée à l'alinéa 1er peut, à tout moment, de manière identique à celle prévue aux alinéas 1er et 2, révoquer la déclaration et exprimer, le cas échéant, une nouvelle préférence. II est ensuite procédé comme prévu aux alinéas précédents. Le juge de paix ou le notaire devant lequel la déclaration est révoquée en informe le juge de paix ou le notaire devant lequel la déclaration initiale a été faite. Ce dernier mentionne la révocation sur l'acte modifié.
articleEN: Any person for whom no judicial protection measure as referred to in Article 492/1 has been taken may file a declaration with the justice of the peace of their residence or, in the absence thereof, their domicile or with a notary, stating their preference regarding the administrator or trustworthy person to be designated should the justice of the peace order a protective measure. This same declaration may contain several principles that the administrator in charge of a representation mission must respect in the exercise of their duties. A notarized deed is drawn up for this declaration. The justice of the peace, assisted by the clerk, may visit the residence or domicile of the applicant, even outside their jurisdiction, at the request and expense of the applicant, to record a declaration. Within fifteen days following the submission of the aforementioned declaration, the clerk or notary records the declaration in a central register kept by the Royal Federation of Belgian Notaries. The King determines the modalities of creating, maintaining, and consulting the central register. The King determines the authorities that have free access to the central register. The King sets the fees for registering these declarations.
question: Qui peut être désigné comme administrateur de biens et/ou de la personne ?
questionEN: Who can be designated as a property administrator and/or personal administrator?
answerLLM: Based on the provided legal article, any person for whom no judicial protection measure has been taken can file a declaration indicating their preference for the property administrator or personal administrator who would be designated should the justice of the peace order a protective measure. This declaration can be made with the justice of the peace of their residence or domicile, or with a notary. The declaration may also contain principles that the administrator must respect in the exercise of their duties. The declaration is then notarized and recorded in a central register kept by the Royal Federation of Belgian Notaries. Therefore, according to this article, any person who has not been subject to a judicial protection measure can designate themselves as a property administrator or personal administrator through this process.
goldy: As the guardian of a person, the justice of the peace should always prioritize the members of the family. They may appoint: the parents of the protected person (they can be designated together); the spouse, legal cohabitant, or partner of the protected person; a close relative of the protected person; a person who takes care of the daily needs of the protected person; a person who accompanies the protected person. As the guardian of property, the justice of the peace preferably chooses the guardian of the person. If the protected person does not have a trusted person, the justice of the peace must appoint 2 different administrators: one for the property and one for the person. The justice of the peace may appoint as administrator of property: the parents of the protected person (they can be designated together); the spouse, legal cohabitant, or partner of the protected person; a close relative of the protected person; a person who takes care of the daily needs of the protected person; a person who accompanies the protected person. If there are no family members, or in case of conflicts in the family, the justice of the peace may appoint a professional administrator. This is usually a lawyer. Some people cannot be an administrator of property or person: persons who are themselves under administration of property and/or person; legal entities (companies, associations, etc.); directors or staff members of the institution where the person to be protected resides; persons deprived of parental authority. The administrator designated by the judge is never obliged to accept the mission. They have a few days to confirm their acceptance to the justice of the peace.

legal article: A chaque départ et à chaque arrivée d'un colocataire, les colocataires dressent un avenant à l'état des lieux qui visera les parties privatives du colocataire entrant ou sortant et les parties communes.En cas de départ anticipé d'un colocataire, l'avenant à l'état des lieux est établi à ses frais ou à frais partagés avec son remplaçant s'il est remplacé dans la colocation.
articleEN: At the departure and arrival of each co-tenant, the co-tenants draw up an addendum to the inventory of the dwelling which will target the private parties of the incoming or outgoing co-tenant and the common areas. In case of anticipatory departure of a co-tenant, the addendum to the inventory of the dwelling is established at his expense or at shared expenses with his replacement if he is replaced in the co-tenancy.
question: Le propriétaire peut-il me réclamer des dégâts locatifs après mon départ en Wallonie ?
questionEN: Can the landlord claim housing damages from me after my departure in Wallonia?
answerLLM: Based on the provided legal article, in the Wallonia region, the landlord can claim housing damages from a tenant after their departure. However, this would typically be done through an addendum to the inventory of the dwelling, which would need to be carried out either at the tenant's expense or shared with their replacement if they are being replaced in the tenancy. This process is designed to identify and address any damages to the property that occurred during the tenant's occupancy. It's important to note that this is a general interpretation based on the provided legal article, and actual legal advice may vary depending on the specific circumstances of each case.
goldy: The owner can generally claim payment for any rental damages that occurred during your occupancy (or are due to your occupancy). Therefore, you should establish a contradictory statement of the condition of the rental at the time you leave the shared housing. If there is no statement of the condition of the rental at the time you leave, you will not be able to prove that the damages being claimed by the owner occurred after your departure. In practice, the owner can therefore claim rental damages that occurred after your departure if there is no statement of the condition of the rental at the time you leave. If this is the case, you can try to prove by other means than the statement of the condition of the rental that you were no longer a tenant when the damages occurred. Be careful, if you left the shared housing without following the rules and are still considered a tenant, the owner can automatically claim rental damages for that period.

legal article: Chacune des parties peut résilier le contrat sans préavis ou avant l'expiration du terme pour un motif grave laissé à l'appréciation du juge et sans préjudice de tous dommages-intérêts s'il y a lieu.Est considérée comme constituant un motif grave, toute faute grave qui rend immédiatement et définitivement impossible toute collaboration professionnelle entre l'employeur et le travailleur.Le congé pour motif grave ne peut plus être donné sans préavis ou avant l'expiration du terme, lorsque le fait qui l'aurait justifié est connu de la partie qui donne congé, depuis trois jours ouvrables au moins.Peut seul être invoqué pour justifier le congé sans préavis ou avant l'expiration du terme, le motif grave notifié dans les trois jours ouvrables qui suivent le congé.A peine de nullité, la notification du motif grave se fait soit par lettre recommandée à la poste, soit par exploit d'huissier de justice.Cette notification peut également être faite par la remise d'un écrit à l'autre partie.La signature apposée par cette partie sur le double de cet écrit ne vaut que comme accusé de réception de la notification.La partie qui invoque le motif grave doit prouver la réalité de ce dernier; elle doit également fournir la preuve qu'elle a respecté les délais prévus aux alinéas 3 et 4.
articleEN: Each party may terminate the contract without notice or before the expiration of the term for serious misconduct, to be assessed by the judge, without prejudice to any damages that may be due. A serious misconduct is constituted by any serious fault that makes immediate and definitive collaboration between the employer and the employee impossible. The notice for serious misconduct cannot be given without notice or before the expiration of the term if the fact that would have justified it was known by the party giving notice for at least three working days. Only the serious misconduct notified within three working days following the notice can be invoked to justify the notice without notice or before the expiration of the term. The notification of serious misconduct must be made by registered letter with acknowledgment of receipt, by bailiff's writ, or by written delivery to the other party. The signature appended by the latter on the duplicate of this writing is only valid as a receipt of notification. The party invoking the serious misconduct must prove the reality of the latter; it must also provide proof that it has complied with the deadlines provided for in paragraphs 3 and 4.
question: Qu'est-ce que la rupture immédiate du contrat de travail pour faute grave ?
questionEN: What is the immediate break of the employment contract for serious misconduct?
answerLLM:
The immediate break of an employment contract for serious misconduct is provided for in the given legal article. Serious misconduct is constituted by any serious fault that makes immediate and definitive collaboration between the employer and the employee impossible. Examples of serious misconduct can include theft, violence, or gross negligence.

The employer or employee may terminate the contract without notice or before the expiration of the term for serious misconduct, but they must be able to prove the reality of the misconduct. The notification of serious misconduct must be made by registered letter with acknowledgment of receipt, by bailiff's writ, or by written delivery to the other party. The party invoking the serious misconduct must also provide proof that they have complied with the deadlines provided for in the legal article. Specifically, the fact that would have justified the notice without notice or before the expiration of the term must have been known by the party giving notice for at least three working days, and the notification of serious misconduct must be made within three working days following the notice.

It is important to note that the immediate break of the employment contract for serious misconduct cannot be invoked if the fact that would have justified it was known by the party giving notice for less than three working days. Additionally, any damages that may be due as a result of the serious misconduct are not prejudiced by the immediate break of the employment contract.
goldy: The immediate break for serious fault is a break of the contract without notice or compensation. It can be invoked by the employer and by the worker. In practice, it is more often invoked by the employer, as it is risky and difficult to prove for the worker. It can be invoked in all types of employment contracts: permanent contract (CDI), fixed-term contract (CDD), replacement contract, internship contract, etc. One must be very cautious before invoking serious fault, as there are very specific rules to follow: deadlines, proof of serious fault, etc. In the end, in case of dispute, it is the labor court that decides whether there is a serious motive that allows for the immediate break of the employment contract.

legal article: Les parties peuvent présenter elles-mêmes leurs conclusions et défenses, à moins que la loi n'en ait disposé autrement.Le juge peut, néanmoins, leur interdire l'exercice de ce droit, s'il reconnaît que la passion ou l'inexpérience les empêche de discuter leur cause avec la décence convenable ou la clarté nécessaire.
articleEN: Parties may present their own arguments and defenses, unless the law has provided otherwise. The judge may nevertheless forbid them from exercising this right if they recognize that passion or inexperience prevents the parties from discussing their case with proper decorum or necessary clarity.
question: Je suis convoqué en justice. Suis-je obligé de prendre un avocat ?
questionEN: I am summoned to court. Am I required to hire a lawyer?
answerLLM: Based on the provided legal article, there is no requirement for you to hire a lawyer when you are summoned to court. You have the right to present your own arguments and defenses. However, the judge may prohibit you from exercising this right if they determine that your passion or inexperience may prevent you from discussing your case with the necessary clarity and decorum. Therefore, while it is not required, it may be beneficial to consider hiring a lawyer to ensure that your arguments and defenses are presented clearly and effectively in court.
goldy: No, you are not obliged to take a lawyer, except: when the law requires you to do so - which is quite rare - (for example, persons under the age of majority must be represented by a lawyer); when the judge requires you to do so: he may do so if he deems the context makes discussion impossible. However, in certain procedures, it is recommended that you be assisted by a lawyer: either because the case is complicated from a legal point of view; or because the procedure is specific; or because you cannot attend the hearings in person; or because the stake of the dispute (the amount of the conflict) is important. If you initiate legal proceedings, you are the plaintiff in the case. Sometimes, this can constitute an additional reason to hire a lawyer. If, on the other hand, someone summons you to court, you must evaluate whether you have any objections to your opponent's demand (the plaintiff). Of course, consulting a lawyer comes at a cost. Two possibilities to help you pay this cost: check if you have legal expenses insurance; check if you meet the conditions for second-line legal aid (formerly pro deo). If you win the case, the opponent will have to pay you a procedural indemnity, except in certain areas (for example in family matters). This indemnity aims to cover the lawyers' fees you have paid. Unfortunately, it is almost always insufficient: it does not cover all the costs and lawyers' fees. Choose a lawyer who has specific skills in the legal field of your problem (family law, social law, etc.) if possible. For more information, see the official website of "l'Ordre des Barreaux francophones et germanophones de Belgique".

legal article: § 1er. L'incapacité de travail résultant d'une maladie ou d'un accident qui empêche définitivement le travailleur d'effectuer le travail convenu peut seulement mettre fin au contrat de travail pour cause de force majeure après que la procédure déterminée au paragraphe 2 a été suivie.La procédure visée au paragraphe 2 ne peut être entamée que lorsque le travailleur a été en incapacité de travail ininterrompue durant une période d'au moins neuf mois et pour autant que, pour le travailleur, aucun trajet de réintégration ne soit en cours au sens du code sur le bien-être. Cette période de neuf mois est interrompue lorsque le travailleur reprend effectivement le travail, à moins que le travailleur, au cours des quatorze premiers jours de cette reprise du travail, soit à nouveau en incapacité de travail, auquel cas cette période est censée ne pas être interrompue.§ 2. Le travailleur ou l'employeur notifie à l'autre partie ainsi qu'au conseiller en prévention-médecin du travail de l'entreprise, au moyen d'un envoi recommandé, l'intention de déterminer s'il est définitivement impossible pour le travailleur d'effectuer le travail convenu, conformément à la procédure spécifique du livre 1er, titre 4, chapitre VI, section 3, du code sur le bien-être au travail. La notification émanant de l'employeur mentionne le droit du travailleur de demander au conseiller en prévention-médecin du travail, conformément à cette procédure spécifique prévue par le code sur le bien-être au travail, que les possibilités relatives à un travail adapté ou à un autre travail soient examinées, s'il a été constaté qu'il est définitivement impossible pour le travailleur d'effectuer le travail convenu. La notification émanant de l'employeur mentionne également le droit du travailleur de se faire assister par la délégation syndicale de l'entreprise au cours de cette procédure, conformément aux dispositions de la convention collective de travail n° 5 du 24 mai 1971 concernant le statut des délégations syndicales du personnel des entreprises.Après réception de la notification visée à l'alinéa 1er, le conseiller en prévention-médecin du travail suit la procédure spécifique déterminée dans le livre 1er, titre 4, chapitre VI, section 3, du code du bien-être au travail.Le contrat de travail ne peut prendre fin pour force majeure médicale que lorsqu'il apparaît de la constatation du conseiller en prévention-médecin du travail, qui n'est plus susceptible de recours, ou du résultat de la procédure de recours reprise dans le code du bien-être au travail, qu'il est définitivement impossible pour le travailleur d'effectuer le travail convenu et que:1° le travailleur n'a pas demandé d'examiner les possibilités relatives à un travail adapté ou à un autre travail, conformément à la procédure spécifique du livre 1er, titre 4, chapitre VI, section 3, du code du bien-être au travail, ou,2° le travailleur a demandé d'examiner les possibilités relatives à un travail adapté ou à un autre travail et l'employeur, conformément à la procédure spécifique du livre 1er, titre 4, chapitre VI, section 3, du code du bien-être au travail, a remis le rapport motivé au dans lequel il explique pourquoi l'établissement d'un plan pour un travail adapté ou un autre travail est techniquement ou objectivement impossible ou ne peut être exigé pour des motifs dûment justifiés, au travailleur et au conseiller en prévention-médecin du travail, ou,3° le travailleur a demandé d'examiner les possibilités relatives à un travail adapté ou à un autre travail et l'employeur, conformément à la procédure spécifique du livre 1er, titre 4, chapitre VI, section 3, du code du bien-être au travail, a remis au travailleur et au conseiller en prévention-médecin du travail le plan pour un travail adapté ou un autre travail refusé par le travailleur.S'il ne ressort pas de la constatation du conseiller en prévention-médecin du travail, ou du résultat de la procédure de recours prévue par le code du bien-être au travail, qu'il est définitivement impossible pour le travailleur d'effectuer le travail convenu, cette procédure prend fin sans suite. La partie la plus diligente ne peut recommencer la procédure visée dans ce paragraphe, que lorsque le travailleur atteint à nouveau une période d'au moins neuf mois d'incapacité de travail ininterrompue, tel que prévu dans l'alinéa 1er, à compter du jour suivant la réception de la constatation du conseiller en prévention-médecin du travail ou, si le travailleur a introduit un recours contre cette constatation, à compter du jour suivant la réception du résultat de la procédure de recours.§ 3. Le conseiller en prévention-médecin du travail peut demander et traiter les données à caractère personnel, y compris les données relatives à la santé du travailleur, qui sont nécessaires aux déterminations et recommandations visées dans la procédure spéciale prévue au livre Ier, titre 4, chapitre VI, section 3, du code du bien-être au travail. Il peut échanger, sous réserve du consentement du travailleur, ces données avec les autres médecins et les tiers concernés dans le cadre de cette procédure tel prévu à l'article I.4-73.- § 3 du code du bien-être au travail, et avec le médecin-inspecteur social, dans le respect du secret professionnel médical et de la confidentialité des données. Le conseiller en prévention-médecin du travail est le responsable du traitement au sens du Règlement UE 2016/679 du Parlement européen et du Conseil du 27 avril 2016 relatif à la protection des personnes physiques à l'égard du traitement des données à caractère personnel et à la libre circulation de ces données, et abrogeant la directive 95/46/CE. La durée maximale de conservation de ces données personnelles est de cinq ans après la fin du contrat de travail.§ 4. Le présent article ne porte pas atteinte au droit de mettre fin au contrat de travail moyennant le respect d'un délai de préavis ou le paiement d'une indemnité conformément aux dispositions de la présente loi.
articleEN: § 1. The inability to work resulting from a disease or accident that definitively prevents the worker from performing the agreed-upon work can only terminate the employment contract for cause of force majeure after the procedure determined in paragraph 2 has been followed. The procedure referred to in paragraph 2 may only be initiated if the worker has been continuously unable to work for a period of at least nine months and provided that, for the worker, no reintegration process is underway within the meaning of the well-being code. This nine-month period is interrupted when the worker effectively resumes work, unless the worker is again unable to work within the first fourteen days of this resumption of work, in which case this period is considered not to have been interrupted.
question: Peut-on introduire plusieurs fois la procédure de rupture pour force majeure médicale ?
questionEN: Can one initiate the termination procedure for medical force majeure multiple times?
answerLLM:
Based on the provided legal article, it does not appear that one can initiate the termination procedure for medical force majeure multiple times without proper justification. According to the article, the procedure for termination of employment due to force majeure can only be initiated if the worker has been continuously unable to work for a period of at least nine months and provided that no reintegration process is underway.

Furthermore, the nine-month period is only interrupted if the worker effectively resumes work, and only if the worker is not again unable to work within the first fourteen days of this resumption of work. Therefore, if the worker is able to return to work and then becomes unable to work again, the nine-month period would not be interrupted and the procedure for termination of employment due to force majeure could not be initiated again until the worker has been continuously unable to work for another nine-month period.

In summary, the termination procedure for medical force majeure cannot be initiated multiple times without proper justification, and it can only be initiated after the worker has been continuously unable to work for a period of at least nine months, unless the worker has effectively resumed work and is not again unable to work within the first fourteen days of this resumption of work.
goldy: Prior to going further, please note that since November 28, 2022, the procedure for breaking the employment contract due to medical force majeure has been modified. Yes, if the occupational physician decides that the employee is temporarily unable to work during the first medical force majeure procedure, the employee or the employer can reintroduce a new procedure. However, they must wait before reintroducing the procedure. The employee must be unable to work for at least 9 consecutive months. The 9-month period begins on the day after the employee receives: the occupational physician's decision stating that the employee is temporarily unable to work; or the decision of the medical inspector of the Social Inspection Service of the General Directorate for Well-being at Work if: the employee has appealed the occupational physician's decision; and the medical inspector has decided that the employee is temporarily unable to work. For more information, please visit the website of the Federal Public Service for Employment, Work, and Social Dialogue.

legal article: Le présent article s'applique à toute demande principale introduite par requête, par citation ou par comparution volontaire en matière de location de logement.Sans préjudice des dispositions des articles 731, alinéa 1er, 732 et 733, le juge tente de concilier les parties.En cas de non-conciliation ou de défaut, la procédure a lieu au fond. Le jugement indique que les parties n'ont pu être conciliées.
articleEN: The present article applies to any main application introduced by motion, by summons, or by voluntary appearance in matters of housing rental. Without prejudice to the provisions of articles 731, paragraph 1, 732 and 733, the judge attempts to reconcile the parties. In case of non-conciliation or default, the procedure goes to the merits. The judgment indicates that the parties have not been able to be reconciled.
question: Mon propriétaire peut-il résilier mon contrat de bail si je ne paie plus mon loyer ?
questionEN: Can my landlord terminate my lease if I stop paying rent?
answerLLM:
Based on the provided legal article, it does not seem to address the issue of a landlord terminating a lease due to non-payment of rent directly. The article discusses the process of reconciling parties in housing rental matters and the steps taken when reconciliation is not possible. However, it does not provide information on the specific circumstances under which a landlord can terminate a lease.

In general, the answer to the question "Can my landlord terminate my lease if I stop paying rent?" would depend on the specific laws and regulations governing landlord-tenant relationships in your jurisdiction. In many cases, a landlord may have the right to terminate a lease and begin eviction proceedings if a tenant fails to pay rent. However, there are often specific procedures and requirements that a landlord must follow in order to do so.

Therefore, it is recommended that you consult the relevant laws and regulations in your jurisdiction or seek legal advice to determine the specific rights and obligations of landlords and tenants in the event of non-payment of rent.
goldy: Yes, but he must request it from the justice of the peace. The owner of your housing asks the judge to end the contract, this is the termination of the lease. Furthermore, depending on the situation, the owner asks for the payment of overdue rent, charges, proof of maintenance of the boiler, etc. The justice of the peace decides if the non-payment of rent or charges justifies ending the contract. Before addressing the judge, you receive from the owner a formal notice (registered letter) to pay the overdue amounts. If you do not respond to this formal notice, the owner may ask the justice of the peace to condemn you to pay and to end the lease. Sometimes, there is a conciliation hearing, the justice of the peace tries to find an agreement between the owner and the tenant. If no agreement is possible between your owner and you, the judge must then decide at another hearing (contentious procedure). If your payment defaults are frequent and a return to normal execution of the contract is impossible, the judge pronounces the judicial resolution of the lease to your detriment. He thus ends the contract due to your breaches. The judge condemns you to pay overdue rent and any potential compensation (to compensate for the damage that the owner has suffered due to your payment defaults). The judge may delay the effects of the termination: he may allow you to stay a few more weeks, or even a few months in the housing. But this possibility is rare. The judge may also refuse the termination but provide that if you pay late again, the lease will be terminated automatically (i.e., without going back to the justice of the peace). You can always ask the judge for terms and deadlines for paying the overdue rent or charges. This allows you to pay in installments. For example: you have an arrears of two months, you ask the judge to be able to pay the rent and x EUR in addition to pay the two months of arrears in 10 or 12 times.

legal article: Pour pouvoir bénéficier du droit à l'intégration sociale, la personne doit simultanément et sans préjudice des conditions spécifiques prévues par cette loi :1° avoir sa résidence effective en Belgique, dans le sens à déterminer par le Roi;2° être majeure ou assimilée à une personne majeure en application des dispositions de la présente loi;3° appartenir à une des catégories de personnes suivantes :- soit posséder la nationalité belge;- soit bénéficier, en tant que citoyen de l'Union européenne ou en tant que membre de sa famille qui l'accompagne ou le rejoint, d'un droit de séjour de plus de trois mois conformément à la loi du 15 décembre 1980 sur l'accès au territoire, le séjour, l'établissement et l'éloignement des étrangers. Cette catégorie de personnes ne bénéficie du droit à l'intégration sociale qu'après les trois premiers mois de ce séjour;- soit être inscrite comme étranger au registre de la population;- soit être un apatride et tomber sous l'application de la Convention relative au statut des apatrides, signée à New-York le 28 septembre 1954 et approuvée par la loi du 12 mai 1960;- soit être un réfugié au sens de l'article 49 de la loi du 15 décembre 1980 sur l'accès au territoire, le séjour, l'établissement et l'éloignement des étrangers;soit bénéficier de la protection subsidiaire au sens de l'article 49/2 de la loi du 15 décembre 1980 sur l'accès au territoire, le séjour, l'établissement et l'éloignement des étrangers;4° ne pas disposer de ressources suffisantes, ni pouvoir y prétendre ni être en mesure de se les procurer, soit par ses efforts personnels, soit par d'autres moyens. Le centre calcule les ressources de la personne conformément aux dispositions du titre II, chapitre II;5° être disposée à travailler, à moins que des raisons de santé ou d'équité l'en empêchent.6° faire valoir ses droits aux prestations dont elle peut bénéficier en vertu de la législation sociale belge et étrangère.
articleEN: To be able to benefit from the right to social integration, the person must simultaneously and without prejudice to the specific conditions provided for by this law: 1° have their effective residence in Belgium, as determined by the King; 2° be of legal age or be assimilated to a person of legal age in accordance with the provisions of this law; 3° belong to one of the following categories of persons:
question: Je suis citoyen d'un pays de l'Union européenne, ai-je droit au RIS ?
questionEN: I am a citizen of a country in the European Union, do I have the right to RIS?
answerLLM: Based on the information provided in the legal article, a citizen of a country in the European Union may not have the automatic right to social integration (RIS) in Belgium. The article states that to benefit from the right to social integration, a person must meet certain conditions, one of which is having effective residence in Belgium. Therefore, being a citizen of an EU country alone may not be sufficient to establish the right to RIS in Belgium. The person must also meet the other conditions outlined in the article, such as being of legal age and belonging to one of the categories of persons listed in the law.
goldy: It depends on your right to stay in Belgium. If you are in Belgium for a stay of less than 3 months, for example, as a tourist, you are not entitled to social integration income (RIS). If you come to Belgium for a long stay, it depends on the reason for your stay: you are a job seeker, have sufficient resources, or are a student: you are entitled to RIS if you meet 2 conditions: you have card E; and you have been staying in Belgium for more than 3 months. You are a salaried or self-employed worker and you have card E: you are entitled to RIS. There is no waiting period to make the request. The members of your family who accompany you have the same rights as you. There is no distinction if they are European or not. If they are European, they must have a card E to be able to benefit from RIS. If they are not European, they must have a card F. Beware! The Immigration Office can withdraw your residence permit if it deems that you are an unreasonable burden on the Belgian state. The OE examines based on the specific situation what constitutes an unreasonable burden. If you have a permanent stay, you have card E+ or F+: you are entitled to RIS. There is no risk of losing your residence permit. Before granting you the aid, the Public Center for Social Welfare (CPAS) checks if you meet other conditions to be entitled to RIS.

legal article: § 1er. Une Commission fédérale " Droits du patient " est créée au Ministère des Affaires sociales, de la Santé publique et de l'Environnement.§ 2. Elle aura pour mission :1° de collecter et traiter des données nationales et internationales concernant des matières relatives aux droits du patient;2° de formuler des avis, sur demande ou d'initiative, à l'intention du ministre qui a la Santé publique dans ses attributions, concernant les droits et devoirs des patients et des praticiens professionnels;3° d'évaluer l'application des droits fixés dans la présente loi;4° d'évaluer le fonctionnement des fonctions de médiation et de formuler les recommandations à cet égard;5° 1.§ 3. Un service de médiation est créé auprès de la commission. II est compétent pour renvoyer une plainte d'un patient concernant l'exercice des droits que lui octroie la présente loi à la fonction de médiation compétente ou, à défaut de celle-ci, pour la traiter lui-même, comme visé à l'article 11, § 2, 2°, et 3°.§ 4. Le Roi précise les règles concernant la composition et le fonctionnement de la Commission fédérale " Droits du patient ". Sur le plan de la composition, une représentation équilibrée sera garantie entre les représentants des patients, des praticiens professionnels, des hôpitaux et des organismes assureurs tels que visés à l'article 2, i, de la loi coordonnée du 14 juillet 1994 relative à l'assurance obligatoire soins de santé et indemnités. Des fonctionnaires des départements ministériels ou des services publics concernés peuvent également être prévus en tant que membres à voix consultative.§ 5. Le secrétariat de la commission est assuré par le fonctionnaire général désigné par le ministre qui a la Santé publique dans ses attributions.
articleEN: Section 1. A Federal Commission "Patient Rights" is created within the Ministry of Social Affairs, Public Health, and the Environment.
question: Je dépose plainte auprès d'un médiateur. L'entreprise est située en Belgique. Quel médiateur pour les soins de santé (hors hôpital) ?
questionEN: I am filing a complaint with a mediator. The company is located in Belgium. What mediator for health care (excluding hospitals)?
answerLLM: Based on the information provided in the legal article, you should file your complaint with the Federal Commission "Patient Rights" within the Ministry of Social Affairs, Public Health, and the Environment in Belgium. This commission is responsible for handling patient rights, which includes healthcare complaints that do not involve hospitals.
goldy: Before going any further, before complaining to the federal mediation service "Patient Rights", you must address your complaint to the healthcare professional and not receive a satisfactory response. As a patient, you have a number of rights. For more information, see our fact sheet "What are my rights as a patient?". If you believe that your patient rights are not being respected, you can file a complaint. If this concerns care received within a hospital, you may contact the hospital's mediation service. If it concerns a healthcare professional working outside of a hospital, you may contact the federal mediation service "Patient Rights". The healthcare professionals concerned include: independent nurses; dentists; physiotherapists; general practitioners; specialist doctors in their private practices; doctors in nursing homes; prison doctors; ... The federal mediation service "Patient Rights" has the mission: to improve communication between the patient and the healthcare professional to attempt to resolve the disagreement with the cooperation of the patient and the healthcare professional. If you do not come to a solution, the mediator will inform you of other possibilities for recourse. Federal French-speaking Mediator Phone: 02.524.85.21 Email: mediation-droitsdupatient@health.fgov.be Federal Dutch-speaking Mediator Phone: 02.524.85.20 Email: bemiddeling-patientenrechten@health.fgov.be

legal article: § 1er. Les pensions de retraite et de survie sont suspendues pour la durée de leurs incarcération à l'égard des bénéficiaires détenus dans les prisons ou des bénéficiaires internés dans les établissements de défense sociale ou des dépôts de mendicité.§ 2. La jouissance de leur pension peut cependant leur être maintenue aussi longtemps qu'ils n'ont pas subi de façon continue douze mois d'incarcération.§ 3. Les bénéficiaires pourront prétendre à leur pension pour la durée de leur détention préventive, à condition pour eux, d'établir qu'ils ont été acquittés par une décision de justice, coulée en force de chose jugée du chef de l'infraction qui a donné lieu à cette détention.Il en est de même dans les cas de non-lieu ou de mise hors cause.
articleEN: Article 1. Retirement and survivor pensions are suspended with regard to beneficiaries who are incarcerated in prisons or interned in institutions of social defense or workhouses for the duration of their incarceration.
question: Ai-je droit à ma pension de survie si je suis en prison ?
questionEN: Do I have the right to my survivor's pension while I am in prison?
answerLLM: Based on the provided legal article, you do not have the right to your survivor's pension while you are in prison. The article states that retirement and survivor pensions are suspended for beneficiaries who are incarcerated in prisons. Therefore, during the duration of your incarceration, you would not be entitled to receive the survivor's pension.
goldy: You keep your survival pension during the first 12 months in prison. After 12 consecutive months in prison, you no longer receive your survival pension. You also no longer receive your survival pension after 12 consecutive months in: preventive detention; parole; prison leave; limited detention. This applies whether you are a salaried employee or a self-employed worker. You can recover the pensions you did not receive during preventive detention if you prove: you have been acquitted; or there has been a decision of non-suit (end of prosecutions) or being cleared of charges. However, you keep your survival pension if you are in: conditional release; provisional release; electronic surveillance.

legal article: Est réputée non écrite toute clause qui met à charge du preneur les frais d'intervention d'un tiers relatifs à la location d'un bien d'habitation, sauf si le preneur est le commanditaire de l'intervention.
articleEN: Any clause that places the costs of a third-party intervention related to the rental of a residential property on the tenant is deemed unwritten, except if the tenant is the instigator of the intervention.
question: Frais de gestion de l'agence immobilière : dois-je les payer en Wallonie ?
questionEN: Real estate agency fees: do I have to pay them in Wallonia?
answerLLM: Based on the provided legal article, in Wallonia, a clause that places the costs of a third-party intervention related to the rental of a residential property on the tenant is deemed unwritten, except if the tenant is the instigator of the intervention. Therefore, real estate agency fees, which are typically a third-party cost related to the rental, should not be borne by the tenant. However, it is always recommended to consult with a legal professional for specific cases and to ensure the most accurate advice.
goldy: No, the fees of a real estate agency cannot be claimed from you. Except if you have specifically requested the real estate agency to intervene. If a clause in your lease states that you must pay the agency fees, it is not applicable. It is said that the clause is "deemed unwritten". For example: letting fees, management fees during the lease, etc. You can contest these fees. In case of a dispute, the justice of the peace is competent. For more information, see our section "Resolving a housing dispute (Wallonia)". If the real estate agency carries out the inspection in representation of both parties (that is, you and your landlord), you must pay half and your landlord the other half of the agency's fees. However, if it acts as the landlord's representative only, the fees are charged to the landlord alone.

legal article: La présentation des candidatures pour la désignation des personnes prévues à l'article 33, 3°, la procédure devant la commission et le fonctionnement de celle-ci, sont, pour le surplus déterminés par le Roi.
articleEN: The presentation of candidatures for the designation of persons provided for in article 33, 3°, as well as the procedure before the commission and the functioning of the latter, are, for the rest, determined by the King.
question: Qu'est-ce que le Conseil du contentieux des étrangers (CCE) ?
questionEN: What is the Council of State's Aliens Chamber (CCE)?
answerLLM: Based on the provided legal article, the Council of State's Aliens Chamber (CCE) is a body responsible for determining the presentation of candidatures and the procedure before the commission for the designation of persons in article 33, 3°. However, the specific details about the CCE, such as its composition, powers, and functioning, are determined by the King, as stated in the article. Therefore, for a complete understanding of the CCE, one would need to refer to the relevant regulations or decrees issued by the King.
goldy: Before going further, it should be noted that since 2018, the asylum procedure is called the international protection procedure. The asylum seeker must therefore submit a request for international protection. This procedure may allow him to obtain: refugee status; or subsidiary protection status. The Council for Alien Litigation (CCE) is an administrative court. It is responsible for examining all appeals against decisions: from the Aliens Office (OE); or from the General Commissioner for Refugees and Stateless Persons (CGRA). That is, appeals against: CGRA decisions concerning applications for international protection; OE decisions on Belgium's competence in an international protection procedure; a specific CGRA decision (for example: a subsequent application for international protection, an application for international protection by a European, an application for international protection from a citizen of a safe country of origin, etc.); an OE decision in any other immigration procedure (for example: family reunification, humanitarian regularization (9bis), medical regularization (9ter), non-European student status, etc.). In matters of international protection, when you file an appeal against a CGRA decision, the CCE may: confirm the decision; annul the decision (and it may ask the CGRA to conduct a further investigation). reform the decision, that is, annul the decision and replace it with its own decision. If the CCE reforms the CGRA's decision, it may grant refugee status or subsidiary protection status. However, the deadlines for appealing to the CCE in matters of international protection are complex. Generally, the deadline is 30 days from the notification of the decision. But there are exceptions to this deadline! If the applicant is detained, in the case where the application has been declared inadmissible or manifestly unfounded and if the CGRA has respected the 15-day calendar deadline for the decision, the applicant has 10 days to appeal; If the applicant is detained and has submitted a subsequent application during their detention but it has been declared inadmissible, the applicant has 5 days to appeal. You must consult a lawyer to file an appeal. Notify your lawyer as soon as possible to verify the deadlines. In principle, the appeal is suspensive. This means that you will not be expelled from Belgium during your appeal and that you retain your right to accommodation. However, in many cases, the appeal is not suspensive. This is stated in the decision. Check with your lawyer.

legal article: L'officier de l'état civil refuse de célébrer le mariage lorsqu'il apparaît qu'il n'est pas satisfait aux qualités et conditions prescrites pour contracter mariage, ou s'il est d'avis que la célébration est contraire aux principes de l'ordre public.S'il existe une présomption sérieuse qu'il n'est pas satisfait aux conditions visées à l'alinéa précédent, l'officier de l'état civil peut surseoir à la célébration du mariage, le cas échéant après avoir recueilli l'avis du procureur du Roi de l'arrondissement judiciaire dans lequel les requérants ont l'intention de contracter mariage, pendant un délai de deux mois au plus à partir de la date de mariage choisie par les parties intéressées, afin de procéder à une enquête complémentaire. Le procureur du Roi peut prolonger ce délai de trois mois au maximum. Dans ce cas, il en informe l'officier de l'état civil qui en informe les parties intéressées.S'il n'a pas pris de décision définitive dans le délai prévu à l'alinéa précédent, l'officier de l'état civil doit célébrer le mariage sans délai, même dans les cas où le délai de six mois visé à l'article 165, § 3, est expiré.Dans le cas d'un refus visé à l'alinéa premier, l'officier de l'état civil notifie sans délai sa décision motivée aux parties intéressées. Une copie, accompagnée d'une copie de tous documents utiles en est, en même temps, transmise au procureur du Roi de l'arrondissement judiciaire dans lequel le refus a été exprimé et à l'Office des étrangers dans le cas où sa décision est motivée sur la base de l'article 146bis.Si l'un des futurs époux ou les deux ne sont pas inscrits, au jour du refus, dans les registres de la population, le registre des étrangers ou le registre d'attente de la commune, ou n'y ont pas leur résidence actuelle, la décision de refus est également immédiatement notifiée à l'officier de l'état civil de la commune où ce futur époux ou ces futurs époux sont inscrits dans l'un de ces registres ou ont leur résidence actuelle.Le refus de l'officier de l'état civil de célébrer le mariage est susceptible de recours par les parties intéressées pendant un délai d'un mois suivant la notification de sa décision,devant le tribunal de la famille.
articleEN: Article: The civil registrar refuses to celebrate the marriage if it appears that the legal requirements and conditions for entering into marriage have not been fulfilled, or if they are of the opinion that the celebration is contrary to the principles of public order. If there is serious reason to believe that the conditions mentioned above have not been fulfilled, the civil registrar may postpone the celebration of the marriage, if necessary after consulting the public prosecutor of the judicial arrondissement in which the parties intend to marry, for a period of two months at most from the chosen marriage date, in the interests of conducting further investigation. The public prosecutor may extend this period by a maximum of three months. In this case, they shall inform the civil registrar, who shall in turn inform the parties concerned. If no definitive decision has been taken within the period specified above, the civil registrar must proceed with the marriage without delay, even in cases where the six-month period stipulated in Article 165, § 3, has expired. In case of refusal under the first paragraph, the civil registrar shall promptly notify the parties concerned of their reasoned decision. A copy, along with a copy of any relevant documents, shall be sent simultaneously to the public prosecutor of the judicial arrondissement in which the refusal was made and to the Aliens Office in cases where the decision is based on Article 146bis. If one or both of the future spouses are not registered, on the day of refusal, in the population register, foreigners register, or waiting register of the municipality, or do not have their current residence there, the refusal decision shall also be immediately notified to the civil registrar of the municipality where the future spouse or spouses are registered or have their current residence. The refusal of the civil registrar to celebrate the marriage may be appealed by the parties concerned within one month of notification of the decision, before the family court.
question: Je me marie. Puis-je contester le refus de mon mariage ?
questionEN: I am getting married. Can I contest the refusal of my marriage?
answerLLM:
Based on the provided legal article, you cannot directly contest the refusal of your marriage by the civil registrar. However, you can appeal the refusal decision made by the civil registrar before the family court. The appeal must be filed within one month of notification of the refusal decision.

The civil registrar can refuse to celebrate the marriage if they believe that the legal requirements and conditions for entering into marriage have not been fulfilled, or if they think that the celebration is contrary to the principles of public order. In case of serious doubts, the civil registrar may postpone the celebration of the marriage for up to five months to conduct further investigation. If no definitive decision has been taken within this period, the civil registrar must proceed with the marriage without delay.

In case of refusal, the civil registrar must promptly notify the parties concerned of their reasoned decision, and send a copy of the decision along with relevant documents to the public prosecutor, the Aliens Office (if the decision is based on Article 146bis), and the civil registrar of the municipality where the future spouse or spouses are registered or have their current residence (if the parties are not registered or do not have their current residence in the same municipality as the civil registrar).
goldy: Yes. You can appeal before the family court against the decision of refusal by the civil registrar to celebrate the marriage. This possibility of appeal must appear on the letter informing you of the decision. The modalities of the appeal are explained in it. You must introduce your appeal within a delay of 1 month starting from the notification of the decision. Therefore, do not delay in reacting. If you introduce this appeal, the prosecutor of the King already has the decision of the civil registrar. He knows the elements that justified the refusal. The competent prosecutor of the King is the one of the judicial arrondissement in which the refusal was expressed.

legal article: Distances de plantationsToutes les plantations doivent être situées au minimum aux distances définies ci-après de la limite des parcelles, sauf si les parties ont conclu un contrat à cet égard ou si les plantations se trouvent au même endroit depuis plus de trente ans.La distance visée à l'alinéa 1er est, pour les arbres d'une hauteur de deux mètres au moins, de deux mètres à partir du milieu du tronc de l'arbre et, pour les autres arbres, arbustes et haies, d'un demi-mètre. Le voisin peut exiger l'élagage ou l'arrachage des plantations qui sont situées à une distance moindre, sauf si le juge estime que cette demande constitue un abus de droit. Le juge tient compte, dans son appréciation, de toutes les circonstances de la cause, y compris de l'intérêt général.Toutefois, le voisin ne peut pas s'opposer à la présence de plantations qui ne sont pas plus hautes que la clôture existant entre les parcelles. Dans ce cas, s'il s'agit d'une clôture non mitoyenne, son propriétaire a le droit de s'en servir comme appui pour ses plantations.
articleEN: Article on Planting Distances
question: L'arbre de mon voisin me dérange, quelles sont les distances de plantation ?
questionEN: What are the planting distances for my neighbor's tree that is bothering me?
answerLLM:
I'm glad to help, but I'll need a bit more information to provide an accurate answer. Since I don't have the actual text of the "Article on Planting Distances," I'll assume that it contains regulations for planting distances between trees to ensure that they do not interfere with neighboring properties.

In general, the planting distances for your neighbor's tree that is bothering you would be determined by the specific regulations outlined in the "Article on Planting Distances." These regulations may vary depending on the type of tree, the size of the tree, and the proximity to your property line.

For example, the article may specify that trees of a certain height or width must be planted a certain distance from the property line. Alternatively, the article may include specific distance requirements for different types of trees, such as fruit trees, evergreen trees, or deciduous trees.

To determine the specific planting distances for your neighbor's tree, you would need to consult the "Article on Planting Distances" and identify the relevant regulations based on the type and size of the tree in question. If you are unable to resolve the issue with your neighbor, you may need to seek legal advice or mediation to ensure that the tree is planted at a safe and appropriate distance from your property.
goldy: Each municipality can determine the planting distances for trees located in the properties of its residents. Contact the Green Space/Plantations service of your local administration to find out the planting distances. If your commune does not have specific rules, the following rules apply for situations before September 1, 2021: 2 meters for high-stem trees, 0.5 meters for low-stem trees, 0 meters if there is a party wall - fruit trees. Both neighbors can plant fruit trees in espalier against the party wall as long as they do not exceed the height of the wall. 0 meters for a fence if it is located between two gardens. The distance is measured from the center of the trunk (and not its circumference) up to the limit of your property. How do you know if it is a high-stem or low-stem tree? The commune can define what constitutes a high-stem or low-stem tree. If it is not defined and in case of a dispute, the justice of the peace determines what type of tree it is. Starting from September 1, 2021, there is no longer a difference between high-stem and low-stem trees. The minimum planting distance rules are: 2 meters for trees at least 2 meters high; 0.5 meters for other trees, shrubs, and hedges. Unless: a contract has been agreed upon between you and your neighbor for a different distance; the plantations have been in the same place for more than 30 years. The distance is measured from the center of the tree trunk up to the limit of your property. You can request pruning or uprooting from the justice of the peace if: you cannot reach an amicable agreement; your neighbor's tree does not respect the distances and is not part of the exceptions. For the list of exceptions, see our fact sheet "Can I request the uprooting of my neighbor's tree if it is more than thirty years old?" In case of a dispute, the judge retains discretion. He is competent to sanction the disturbance you are suffering. The judge takes into account all circumstances and the general interest. The judge appreciates that it is not an "abuse of right". For example, he may refuse to order uprooting even if the distances are not respected because it is a beautiful tree that benefits the entire neighborhood. The rules are numerous, and the judges' responses are uncertain due to their discretion. It is therefore likely that the action before the justice of the peace will not fully meet your expectations. It is advisable to find an amicable solution with your neighbor. Restoring communication is certainly the most beneficial outcome for everyone. For more information, see our fact sheet "How to resolve my neighbor dispute?".

legal article: La vente est annoncée au moins trois jours ouvrables auparavant par un placard, affiché de manière visible de l'extérieur, à l'endroit où aura lieu la vente. Dans le même délai, un exemplaire supplémentaire de ce placard est remis par l'huissier de justice au débiteur en personne ou, si ce n'est pas possible, déposé à son domicile sous enveloppe fermée portant les indications prévues à l'article 44, alinéa premier. Toutefois, cet exemplaire supplémentaire ne peut être signifié au débiteur. La vente est en outre annoncée par la voie électronique oupar la voie des journaux, dans les villes où il y en a. L'annonce ne peut être insérée que deux fois au plus dans le même journal, ou une fois dans deux journaux différents, à peine de ne point entrer en taxe au delà, sauf autorisation demandée au juge par requête présentée et signée par un avocat ou un huissier de justice.Le Roi détermine les modalités pour l'annonciation de la vente par voie électronique.
articleEN: The sale shall be announced at least three working days in advance by a poster, displayed in a visible manner from the outside, at the location where the sale will take place. Within the same timeframe, a copy of this poster shall be handed over by the bailiff to the debtor in person, or, if this is not possible, left at their residence in a sealed envelope with the indications provided for in Article 44, first paragraph. However, this additional copy cannot be served to the debtor. The sale shall also be announced by electronic means or in newspapers, in the cities where there are any. The announcement may be inserted a maximum of two times in the same newspaper, or once in two different newspapers, at the risk of not being taken into account beyond this, except with the authorization requested from the judge by petition presented and signed by a lawyer or a bailiff. The King determines the modalities for the announcement of the sale by electronic means.
question: Qu'est ce qu'une vente publique judiciaire électronique de biens meubles ?
questionEN: What is an electronic judicial sale of personal property?
answerLLM: Based on the provided legal article, an electronic judicial sale of personal property is a sale that is announced through electronic means. This means that the sale is publicized using electronic communications, such as email or social media, or through other forms of electronic media, as determined by the King. The electronic announcement must be made within the same timeframe as the physical poster announcing the sale, which is at least three working days in advance. Additionally, a copy of the poster must be handed over by the bailiff to the debtor in person or left at their residence in a sealed envelope. The sale may also be announced in newspapers, in the cities where there are any. The electronic announcement can be made a maximum of two times in the same newspaper, or once in two different newspapers, at the risk of not being taken into account beyond this, except with the authorization requested from the judge.
goldy: Before going any further, soon sales of seized furniture will be able to be sold at auction online. A platform has been created by the National Chamber of Bailiffs. It will soon be operational. The National Chamber of Bailiffs is the manager and party responsible for the processing of data. Soon, public sales of seized furniture will be able to take place on the internet. How to participate in the public sale? Any person who wishes to participate in a sale must register on the Auctionline platform. How to be informed? Sales will be announced on the platform. The sale may be announced by any other electronic means (email, SMS,...) chosen by the bailiff in charge of the sale. Any person will have the possibility to automatically receive notifications regarding upcoming sales. The bailiff decides the time of the sale announcement on the platform, taking into account the situation and the rights of the debtor. There will be no more salesroom? Some sales may be exclusively electronic or simultaneously electronic and in the salesroom. How will the sale take place? The platform will specify the main information that must be mentioned in the particular conditions of sale. Candidates-buyers must accept them previously for each sale. Any candidate-buyer who has accepted these particular conditions of sale will be able to make bids. A fee will be due by the buyer who has won the auction to the manager of the platform. It consists of a progressive amount on the sale price. During the sale, the candidate-buyer will clearly see the amount of this fee. The bailiff will have the right to decide at any time, including before the announced end of the sale, to suspend or close this sale. This possibility, which also exists during physical sales, is justified by the fact that the bailiff must always ensure that the sale of the property benefits the debtor as much as possible. How will a property be awarded? The property will be awarded to the candidate-buyer who has made the highest bid at the time when the sale is closed. The buyer will be informed via the email address indicated at the time of registration on the platform. Within three days of sending the email, the bailiff establishes a minutes of adjudication, of which the buyer can request an extract. Only the information relating to the last bid will be included in this minutes of adjudication. Payment for the property purchased via the platform will be made electronically to the bailiff in charge of the sale and within the time limit indicated in the electronic notice.

legal article: Etat des lieux§ 1er. Les articles 1730 et 1731 du Code civil sont applicables à tous les baux d'habitation y compris les baux de sous-location.Conformément à l'article 1730, § 1er, du Code civil, les parties dressent un état des lieux d'entrée détaillé, contradictoirement et à frais communs, en ce compris en cas de sous-location. Si le logement est pourvu de compteurs individuels, les états des lieux d'entrée et de sortie comprendront le relevé des index de consommation ainsi que l'indication des numéros de compteurs ainsi que les codes EAN ou tout autre code d'identification des compteurs d'eau, de gaz et d'électricité.§ 2. Le Gouvernement arrête un modèle-type d'état des lieux d'entrée à valeur indicative.§ 3. Chaque partie peut requérir l'établissement d'un état des lieux de sortie contradictoire et à frais partagés.Cet état des lieux est établi après la libération des lieux par le preneur et avant la remise des clés au bailleur.A défaut d'accord des parties, le juge compétent, saisi avant la date de remise des clés, désigne un expert pour procéder à l'état des lieux. Le jugement est exécutoire nonobstant opposition et n'est pas susceptible d'appel.
articleEN: Article concerning the condition of the premises:
question: Quand faire l'état des lieux à Bruxelles ?
questionEN: When to do the inventory report in Brussels?
answerLLM:
I'm not a lawyer, but I can try to provide a helpful response based on the information you've given. However, I would strongly recommend consulting a legal professional for specific legal advice.

Based on the information provided, the question asks about the timing of an inventory report in Brussels. Unfortunately, the legal article you've provided is about the "condition of the premises" and does not mention anything about inventory reports.

Therefore, I cannot provide a specific answer to the question without additional information. In general, inventory reports are often conducted when there is a change in tenancy or a change in the condition of the property. However, the specific requirements for inventory reports in Brussels may be governed by local laws, regulations, or rental agreements.

I recommend consulting a legal professional or conducting further research to determine the specific requirements for inventory reports in Brussels.
goldy: This sheet was updated more than a year ago. The inventory of fixtures should be done before moving into the property or at the beginning of the lease, but no later than the first month of occupation (within the first 15 days if the lease is less than 1 year). The inventory of fixtures at exit should be drafted at the end of the occupation: after you have vacated the property but before you have returned the keys to the landlord. If one of you two refuses to draft or sign the inventory of fixtures, the other must apply to the justice of the peace before returning the keys! If you have returned the keys to the landlord and he has accepted them without making any reservation regarding the inventory of fixtures, it may be considered that he has given up on drafting an inventory of fixtures at exit. Indeed, it will be difficult for him to prove that you are responsible for the damage to the property since, in the meantime, he will have taken back possession of the premises. Once again, in case of difficulty, you can apply to the justice of the peace. Note that, as a tenant, you generally have no interest in applying to the justice of the peace for an inventory of fixtures to be established (see the question "What happens if there is no inventory of fixtures?").

Dans ce cas, il en informe l'officier de l'état civil qui en informe les parties intéressées.S'il n'a pas pris de décision définitive dans le délai prévu à l'alinéa précédent, l'officier de l'état civil doit célébrer le mariage sans délai, même dans les cas où le délai de six mois visé à l'article 165, § 3, est expiré.Dans le cas d'un refus visé à l'alinéa premier, l'officier de l'état civil notifie sans délai sa décision motivée aux parties intéressées. Une copie, accompagnée d'une copie de tous documents utiles en est, en même temps, transmise au procureur du Roi de l'arrondissement judiciaire dans lequel le refus a été exprimé et à l'Office des étrangers dans le cas où sa décision est motivée sur la base de l'article 146bis.Si l'un des futurs époux ou les deux ne sont pas inscrits, au jour du refus, dans les registres de la population, le registre des étrangers ou le registre d'attente de la commune, ou n'y ont pas leur résidence actuelle, la décision de refus est également immédiatement notifiée à l'officier de l'état civil de la commune où ce futur époux ou ces futurs époux sont inscrits dans l'un de ces registres ou ont leur résidence actuelle.Le refus de l'officier de l'état civil de célébrer le mariage est susceptible de recours par les parties intéressées pendant un délai d'un mois suivant la notification de sa décision,devant le tribunal de la famille.
articleEN: Article: The civil registrar refuses to celebrate the marriage if it appears that the legal requirements and conditions for entering into marriage have not been fulfilled, or if he or she believes that the celebration is contrary to the principles of public order. If there is serious reason to believe that the conditions mentioned above have not been fulfilled, the civil registrar may postpone the celebration of the marriage, after, if necessary, seeking the advice of the district prosecutor of the judicial arrondissement in which the parties intend to marry, for a period of two months at most from the chosen marriage date, in order to conduct further investigation. The prosecutor of the King may extend this period by up to three months. In such a case, he or she informs the civil registrar, who in turn informs the parties concerned. If no definitive decision has been made within the period specified above, the civil registrar must celebrate the marriage without delay, even in cases where the six-month period stipulated in Article 165, paragraph 3, has expired. In case of refusal under the first paragraph, the civil registrar must immediately notify the parties concerned of the motivated decision. A copy, along with a copy of all relevant documents, is also sent at the same time to the district prosecutor of the judicial arrondissement where the refusal was made and to the Aliens Office in case the decision is based on Article 146bis. If one or both of the future spouses are not registered, on the day of refusal, in the population, foreigners or waiting register of the municipality, or do not have their current residence there, the refusal decision is also immediately notified to the civil registrar of the municipality where this future spouse or spouses are registered in one of these registers or have their current residence. The refusal of the civil registrar to celebrate the marriage may be appealed by the parties concerned within one month of notification of the decision, before the family court.
question: Je vis avec ma famille en Belgique. Je me marie. Puis-je effectuer un recours si on refuse mon mariage ?
questionEN: I live with my family in Belgium. I wish to get married. Can I file an appeal if my marriage is refused?
answerLLM:
Yes, you can file an appeal if your marriage is refused in Belgium. According to the provided legal article, if the civil registrar refuses to celebrate the marriage, they must immediately notify the parties concerned of the motivated decision. A copy of this decision, along with all relevant documents, is also sent to the district prosecutor of the judicial arrondissement where the refusal was made and to the Aliens Office if the decision is based on relevant laws.

If one or both of the future spouses are not registered in the population, foreigners, or waiting register of the municipality, the refusal decision is also immediately notified to the civil registrar of the municipality where this future spouse or spouses are registered or have their current residence.

The parties concerned have the right to appeal the refusal of the civil registrar to celebrate the marriage within one month of notification of the decision, before the family court.
goldy: Yes, you can appeal the decision before the family court. You must submit your appeal within a month of the notification of the decision. If you submit this appeal, the prosecutor already has the decision of the Civil Registry Officer (CRO) and the relevant documents from your file, as the Civil Registry Officer sends these documents to the prosecutor. During the proceedings, you can add new elements that are favorable to you, for example, if a child is born, etc. During the hearing, the family court judge may question you about your relationship. The procedure can be very lengthy and can last several months to a year. Be careful, once the marriage is refused, you are no longer protected from expulsion even if you appeal the decision. The commune will inform the Aliens Office, which may take a decision to order you to leave the territory (OQT) against you. To find out how the procedure works, consult the guides in the 'I am introducing a legal claim' section.

legal article: PrincipesSans préjudice de l'article 221, les parties peuvent convenir de la révision du loyer entre le neuvième et le sixième mois précédant l'expiration de chaque triennat.A défaut d'accord des parties, le juge peut accorder la révision du loyer s'il est établi que par le fait de circonstances nouvelles, la valeur locative normale du bien loué est supérieure ou inférieure de vingt pour cent au moins au loyer exigible au moment de l'introduction de la demande.Il peut de même accorder une augmentation de loyer au bailleur qui établit que la valeur locative normale du bien loué a augmenté de dix pour cent au moins du loyer exigible au moment de l'introduction de la demande, en raison de travaux effectués à ses frais dans le bien loué, à l'exception des travaux nécessaires en vue de mettre le bien loué en conformité avec les conditions de l'article 220.Dans le cadre de cette révision triennale, aucune augmentation de loyer ne peut cependant être accordée pour des travaux réalisés conformément à l'article 221 et si le loyer a été adapté en conséquence au cours du bail.Le juge statue en équité.L'action ne peut être intentée qu'entre le sixième et le troisième mois précédant l'expiration du triennat en cours.Le loyer révisé produit ses effets à compter du premier jour du triennat suivant, l'ancien loyer demeurant provisoirement exigible jusqu'à la décision définitive.Dans le cas de l'article 239, § 2, les parties peuvent cependant renoncer à la faculté de demander la révision du loyer.
articleEN: Article: Principles
question: Puis-je demander une diminution du loyer en cours de bail à Bruxelles ?
questionEN: Can I request a reduction in rent during the lease in Brussels?
answerLLM:
I'm glad to help you with your question, however, I need a more specific legal article that contains the relevant laws or regulations regarding rent reduction during a lease in Brussels. The answer to your question depends on the specific laws and regulations in force in Brussels.

The general principle is that during the lease term, the tenant is obligated to pay the agreed-upon rent. However, there may be circumstances where a tenant can request a reduction in rent, such as in cases of force majeure, significant changes in the property's condition, or a reduction in services provided.

To provide a specific and accurate answer, I would need to review the relevant legal article or regulation that governs rental agreements in Brussels. Therefore, I encourage you to provide more information or a specific legal article that I can use to answer your question.
goldy: This sheet has not been updated in over a year. At the end of a triennium, you can request a reduction in rent from your landlord. Your landlord must accept the rent reduction between the 9th and 6th month preceding the end of an ongoing triennium: therefore, be sure to make your request in a timely manner. If your landlord does not agree, you can contact the justice of the peace between the 6th and 3rd month preceding the expiration of the triennium. The competent justice of the peace is the one in the location of the housing. To find out their contact information, see the website of territorial competence. The justice of the peace will grant you a rent reduction only if new circumstances have decreased the rental value by 20% compared to the rent paid. You must therefore prove the new circumstances and the decrease in rental value. New circumstances are circumstances that could not have been foreseen at the time of signing the lease, for example: the degradation of the neighborhood, the persistence of important and disruptive public works, the deterioration of the building, etc. The judge sets the amount of the new rent, taking into account the interests of each party. You can pay the reduced rent from the 1st day of the following triennium. If the legal action is not completed at this time, the reduced rent will be applied, retroactively, from the 1st day of the triennium.

legal article: § 1er. La periode de maternité constitue une période de repos de douze semaines, ou de treize semainesen cas de naissance multiple, au cours de laquelle la titulaire ne peut exercer son activité professionnelle habituelle ni aucune autre activité professionnelle.§ 2. La période de repos de maternité comprend une période obligatoire et une période facultative.a La période obligatoire se compose d'un total de trois semaines : une semaine de repos prénatal obligatoire et deux semaines de repos postnatal obligatoire.La semaine obligatoire de repos prénatal débute à partir du septième jour qui précede la date présumée de l'accouchement.Les semaines obligatoires de repos postnatal prennent cours le jour de l'accouchement et s'étendent à une période egale à deux semaines.b La période facultative comprend le repos prénatal facultatif et le repos postnatal facultatif.Le repos prénatal facultatif s'étend au plus tôt à partir de la troisième semaine qui précède la date présumée de l'accouchement, jusqu'au septième jour qui précède la date présumée de l'accouchement.Le repos postnatal facultatif s'étend à une période qui correspond aux douze ou treize semainesen cas de naissance multiple, dont sont déduites l'éventuelle période de repos prénatal facultatif et la période obligatoire.Le repos postnatal facultatif prend cours au plus tôt à partir du premier jour qui suit les deux semaines de repos postnatal obligatoire.Par dérogation au § 1er, la titulaire peut, durant la période facultative, exercer son activité professionnelle habituelle à mi-temps, par période de sept jours calendrier. Dans ce cas, la période facultative comprend au maximum dix-huit semaines de repos de maternité à mi-temps ou vingt semaines de repos de maternité à mi-temps quand une naissance multiple est prévue.La période de repos postnatal facultatif, qu'il s'agisse d'un repos complet ou à mi-temps, doit être prise par période de sept jours calendrier et avant la fin d'une période maximum de trente-six semaines. Cette période de trente-six semaines prend cours le premier jour suivant les deux semaines de repos postnatal obligatoire.§ 3. A la demande de la titulaire, la période de repos de maternité visée au § 2 peut être prolongée lorsque l'enfant nouveau-né doit rester hospitalisé plus de sept jours à compter de sa naissance.Dans le cas visé à l'alinéa précédent, la période de repos de maternité est prolongée d'une durée égale au nombre de semaines complètes d'hospitalisation de l'enfant qui excède ces sept premiers jours. La durée de cette prolongation ne peut toutefois dépasser vingt-quatre semaines.La période maximale de repos de maternité facultatif de vingt-quatre semaines qui découle de la prolongation en cas d'hospitalisation de l'enfant, visée dans l'alinéa précédent, peut être prise à mi-temps, par période de sept jours calendrier, durant laquelle la titulaire reprend son activité professionnelle habituelle.
