Therefore, it is recommended to consult the specific terms of the legal cohabitation agreement and the mortgage contract to determine the obligations of each cohabitant regarding the payment of the mortgage loan.

In the absence of a specific agreement or contractual provision, the general principles of fairness, equity, and responsibility may apply in determining which cohabitant should pay off the mortgage loan. In such cases, it is advisable to seek legal advice to ensure that the decision is in compliance with the applicable laws and regulations.
goldy: This depends on who signed the mortgage contract at the bank. If the mortgage is signed by both of you, this debt is "joint": you both must repay it. Creditors can seize all of your assets if you do not repay the mortgage. Either of you may be required to pay off the entire debt. Whoever pays can then request the other to reimburse their share (half or another proportion agreed upon). If you separate and one of you takes over the mortgage alone, it requires the bank's agreement for the other to be released from repayment. This is called the "de-solidarization" of the mortgage. If the mortgage is signed by only one of you, it is generally his responsibility to repay. The bank cannot claim anything from the one who did not sign the mortgage.

legal article: § 1er. Les père et mère sont tenus d'assumer, à proportion de leurs facultés, l'hébergement, l'entretien, la santé, la surveillance, l'éducation, la formation et l'épanouissement de leurs enfants. Si la formation n'est pas achevée, l'obligation se poursuit après la majorité de l'enfant.§ 2. Par facultés, on entend notamment tous les revenus professionnels, mobiliers et immobiliers des père et mère, ainsi que tous les avantages et autres moyens qui assurent leur niveau de vie et celui des enfants.§ 3. Dans la limite de ce qu'il a recueilli dans la succession du conjoint prédécédé et des avantages que celui-ci lui aurait consentis par contrat de mariage, donation ou testament, l'époux survivant est tenu de l'obligation établie au paragraphe 1er envers les enfants du prédécédé dont il n'est pas lui-même le père ou la mère.Cette obligation est caduque à l'égard de l'enfant indigne d'hériter du conjoint prédécédé. Le juge suspend son prononcé jusqu'à ce que la décision entraînant l'indignité soit passée en force de chose jugée.
articleEN: Section 1. The father and mother are required to contribute, in proportion to their abilities, to the housing, maintenance, health, supervision, education, training, and development of their children. If the education is not completed, the obligation continues after the child reaches the age of majority.
question: Je suis parent. Dois-je encore payer la contribution alimentaire si mon enfant ne fait rien aux études ?
questionEN: I am a parent. Do I still have to pay child support if my child is not pursuing further education?
answerLLM: Yes, as the parent, you are still required to pay child support even if your child is not pursuing further education. According to the provided law article, parents are required to contribute to the housing, maintenance, health, supervision, education, training, and development of their children "if the education is not completed." This means that the obligation to provide child support continues after the child reaches the age of majority, and it is not dependent on whether the child is pursuing further education or not. However, the amount of child support may be determined based on the child's needs and the parents' abilities to contribute.
goldy: It is impossible to respond in an automatic manner. Everything depends on the specific circumstances of the situation. You must pay child support until your child becomes self-sufficient. Self-sufficiency is generally achieved when the young person has a diploma or has completed a training program that gives them access to the job market. However, studies must be pursued normally, without any significant delay attributable to the young person. We accept that a young person may have had some difficulties in their studies, for example, if they made a mistake in their choice of studies and had to reorient themselves after the first year. The young person is entitled to a level of education and maintenance proportional to the resources and abilities of their parents. The amount of child support is calculated based on the financial resources of both parents (income, benefits in kind, etc.). This amount should allow the young person to cover expenses related to their accommodation, maintenance, education, and training (examples: registration fees, course materials, etc.). In case of conflict, you can turn to the family judge. He or she decides whether child support is still due or not based on the specific circumstances of the situation. The judge may also provide that he or she will reassess each year if child support is still due and for what amount. The judge verifies the abilities of the young person, their willingness, their diligence in their studies, and the circumstances that may justify any delay in their studies. Family or material difficulties, for example, may justify a repeat year.

legal article: § 1er. Lorsque la demande est susceptible d'affecter la capacité de la personne protégée ou à protéger au sens de l'article 491, e du Code civil, un certificat médical circonstancié dont le modèle est établi par le Roi, ne datant pas de plus de quinze jours, délivré par un médecin agréé ou un psychiatre, est joint à la requête à moins que la demande ne soit fondée sur l'article 488/2 du Code civil.Ce certificat décrit l'état de santé de la personne concernée sur la base des données médicales actualisées du dossier du patient visé à l'article 9 de la loi du 22 août 2002 relative aux droits du patient, ou sur la base d'un examen récent de la personne.Le modèle de certificat visé à l'alinéa 1er mentionne à tout le moins:1° si la personne protégée ou à protéger peut se déplacer, et, dans l'affirmative, s'il est indiqué qu'elle se déplace, compte tenu de son état;2° l'état de santé de la personne protégée ou à protéger;3° l'incidence de cet état de santé sur la bonne gestion de ses intérêts de nature patrimoniale ou autre.En ce qui concerne les intérêts de nature patrimoniale visés à l'alinéa 3, 3°, il est mentionné en particulier si la personne protégée ou à protéger est encore à même de prendre connaissance du compte rendu de la gestion;4° les soins qu'implique normalement un tel état de santé.Ce certificat ne peut pas être établi par un médecin parent ou allié de la personne protégée ou à protéger ou du requérant ou attaché à un titre quelconque à l'établissement dans lequel elle se trouve.Le Roi détermine les procédures et les conditions de l'agrément des médecins visé à l'alinéa 1er.§ 2. En cas d'urgence avérée ou d'impossibilité absolue de joindre le certificat médical en raison de motifs que le requérant expose et pour autant que la requête contienne suffisamment d'éléments pouvant justifier l'adoption d'une mesure de protection, le juge désigne un médecin agréé ou un psychiatre pour émettre un avis sur l'état de santé de la personne protégée ou à protéger.
articleEN: Article 1. When the application is likely to affect the capacity of the person to be protected or in need of protection under article 491, e of the Civil Code, a detailed medical certificate, the model of which is established by the King, not older than fifteen days, delivered by an approved doctor or a psychiatrist, must be attached to the application, unless the application is based on article 488/2 of the Civil Code. This certificate describes the health status of the person concerned on the basis of updated medical data from the patient's file referred to in article 9 of the law of 22 August 2002 on the rights of the patient, or on the basis of a recent examination of the person. The model certificate referred to in paragraph 1 shall at least mention:
question: Qu'est-ce qu'un certificat médical circonstancié ?
questionEN: What is a detailed medical certificate?
answerLLM:
Based on the provided legal article, a detailed medical certificate is a document that meets the following criteria:

1. It is required when the application concerns a person whose capacity to make decisions may be affected, as defined in Article 491, e of the Civil Code.
2. It is delivered by an approved doctor or psychiatrist.
3. It is not older than fifteen days at the time of submission of the application.
4. It is based on updated medical data from the patient's file or from a recent examination of the person.
5. It follows the model established by the King.
6. The model certificate must include a description of the health status of the person concerned, at least mentioning:
	* The person's ability to manage their own affairs
	* The person's ability to understand the meaning and consequences of their decisions
	* The person's ability to communicate their decisions in a consistent manner
	* The foreseeable evolution of the person's health status and its impact on their decision-making ability.

Therefore, a detailed medical certificate is a comprehensive medical evaluation of a person's health status, particularly their mental and cognitive abilities, that is used to assess their capacity to make decisions for themselves.
goldy: This is a medical certificate that attests to the fact that a person is no longer able to manage their assets and/or their person. It must describe the physical or mental health condition that is causing this incapacity, and the impact of this health condition on the person's ability to manage their affairs. The description must be precise and complete. The doctor can complete the medical certificate after a consultation with the patient, or solely based on the information in their medical file. Any attending or specialist doctor can write the detailed medical certificate, except: the doctor who is related to the person to be protected by blood or marriage; the doctor who is attached to the institution where the person to be protected resides. If the person resides in a nursing home, the doctor at the nursing home cannot write the detailed medical certificate. This certificate must indicate: whether the person is or is not capable of moving around. If the person to be protected is no longer able to move around, the justice of the peace will personally visit the person's home (note: travel expenses will be charged); whether the person is capable of understanding future management reports from the administrator. Since September 1, 2014, doctors are required to complete a standard-type medical certificate. You will find this standard form in the "document types" tab above. You will also find a commented model that describes the expected content for each section.

legal article: Au sens du présent décret, on entend par :1° le bail d'habitation ci-dessous nommé " bail " : le bail relatif à un logement ou une habitation légère, qu'il s'agisse d'un bien meuble ou immeuble ou partie de celui-ci,destiné à servir d'habitation, à l'exclusion des hébergements touristiques au sens du Code wallon du Tourisme;2° bail de colocation : la location d'un même bien par plusieurs colocataires ayant signé un pacte de colocation au plus tard à la signature du contrat de bail et dont la date de signature est reprise dans le contrat de bail. Il est formalisé par la conclusion d'un contrat unique entre les colocataires et le bailleur. L'habitation prise en location comprend au minimum une pièce d'habitation ou un local sanitaire commun à tous les colocataires;3° le colocataire : le preneur partie au bail de colocation. Deux personnes formant un couple marié ou de cohabitants légaux ne peuvent être colocataires entre eux. Le couple marié ou de cohabitants légaux peut néanmoins former un des preneurs dans un bail de colocation;4° le pacte de colocation : la convention conclue entre les colocataires qui fixe leurs droits et devoirs réciproques;5° le bail étudiant : le bail d'habitation relatif à la location d'un bien, par ou pour le compte d'un étudiant, dans le cadre de l'accomplissement de ses études et aux conditions du chapitre 5;6° l'étudiant : la personne qui est régulièrement inscrite et poursuit ses études dans un établissement d'enseignement secondaire ou supérieur, pour autant qu'il apporte la preuve de son inscription régulière dans les formes et délais fixés par l'article 79, § 2;7° les études dans un établissement d'enseignement secondaire : les études dispensées au sein d'établissements d'enseignement secondaire, organisées ou subventionnées sous la forme d'un enseignement ordinaire ou spécialisé au sens du décret du 24 juillet 1997 définissant les missions prioritaires de l'enseignement fondamental et de l'enseignement secondaire et organisant les structures propres à les atteindre;8° les études dans un établissement d'enseignement supérieur : les études de premier, deuxième ou troisième cycle dispensées au sein des établissements d'enseignement supérieur visés dans les articles 10 à 13 du décret du 7 novembre 2013 définissant le paysage de l'enseignement supérieur et l'organisation académique des études.
articleEN: Article: For the purposes of the present decree, the following are defined as:
question: Mon bail est-il un bail officiel de colocation en Wallonie ?
questionEN: Is my lease a formal joint lease in Wallonia?
answerLLM: Based on the information provided, the legal article does not contain the definition or criteria for a "formal joint lease" in Wallonia. Therefore, it is not possible to accurately answer the question without additional context or information. It would be necessary to refer to the relevant legal provisions that define and regulate joint leases in Wallonia.
goldy: Before going further, it’s important to note that this sheet only concerns the lease agreement in Wallonia. Your lease is an official joint lease if: the lease contract was signed or renewed after September 1, 2018; you, your co-tenants, and the landlord have all signed the same lease contract; you and your co-tenants have signed a cohabitation agreement among yourselves; the date of signing the cohabitation agreement is indicated in the lease contract; there is at least one shared living space or sanitary facility for you and your co-tenants; you and your co-tenants are not married or legal cohabitants. The cohabitation agreement is a written document that organizes the rules of cohabitation among the co-tenants. For more information on the cohabitation agreement, see the sheets: “What is a cohabitation agreement?” “What should my cohabitation agreement contain?” “When should the cohabitation agreement be signed?” What is the benefit of a joint lease? If you have a joint lease and a cohabitation agreement, you can terminate the lease before the scheduled date. You can find model joint lease and cohabitation agreement forms proposed by the Walloon Region in the standard documents.

legal article: Les arrérages de rentes perpétuelles et viagères;Ceux des pensions alimentaires;Les créances de frais extraordinaires visés à l'article 203bis, § 3;Les loyers des maisons, et le prix de ferme des biens ruraux;Les intérêts des sommes prêtées, et généralement tout ce qui est payable par année, ou à des termes périodiques plus courts,Se prescrivent par cinq ans.Les créances pour la fourniture de biens et de services via des réseaux de distribution d'eau, de gaz ou d'électricité ou la fourniture de services de communications électroniques ou de services de radiotransmission ou de radio- et télédiffusion via des réseaux de communications électroniques se prescrivent par cinq ans.
articleEN: The arrears of perpetual and life annuities; Those of alimony; The claims for extraordinary expenses referred to in Article 203bis, § 3; Rents for houses, and the price of farmland leases; The interest on loans, and generally all that which is payable annually, or at periodic terms shorter than a year, Prescribe within five years. Claims for the supply of goods and services via networks of distribution of water, gas or electricity or the supply of electronic communication services or radio transmission or radio and television broadcasting services via electronic communication networks Prescribe within five years.
question: Après combien de temps le paiement de mon loyer est-il prescrit ?
questionEN: After how much time is the payment of my rent prescribed? (or: barred, in English legal terminology)
answerLLM: Based on the relevant law article provided, the payment of rent for houses prescribes (becomes barred) after a period of five years. This means that if you have not paid your rent for five years, your landlord may no longer be able to legally collect that unpaid rent, depending on the specific statute of limitations and the laws of your jurisdiction. However, it is important to note that this is a general interpretation of the law article provided, and specific legal advice may vary based on individual circumstances.
goldy: The prescription period for the payment of your rent and charges is 5 years starting from the due date of the rent. For example, rent for August 2022 should be paid at the latest by August 31, 2022. You are released from paying rent in September 2027. Beyond this deadline, the owed amounts are lost by the landlord. However, be careful, the prescription can be suspended or interrupted. For more information, see "Can I invoke prescription to not pay my debt?"

legal article: Baux de courte duréePar dérogation à l'article 237, § 1er, un bail peut être conclu, par écrit, pour une durée inférieure ou égale à trois ans.Il peut être prorogé une ou plusieurs fois mais seulement par un écrit contenu dans le bail, un avenant à celui-ci ou tout autre écrit subséquent et sous les mêmes conditions, sans préjudice de l'indexation du loyer au moment du renouvellement, et sans que la durée totale de location ne puisse excéder trois ans.Sauf prorogation, le bail d'une durée inférieure à six mois prend fin à l'expiration de la durée convenue.Le bail d'une durée égale ou supérieure à six mois prend fin moyennant un congé notifié par l'une ou l'autre des parties au moins trois mois avant l'expiration de la durée convenue. Il peut être résilié à tout moment par le preneur, moyennant un préavis de trois mois et une indemnité équivalente à un mois de loyer. Le bailleur ne peut mettre fin anticipativement au bail de courte durée qu'après la première année de location, et aux conditions prévues à l'article 237, § 2, moyennant un préavis de 3 mois et une indemnité équivalente à un mois de loyer.L'article 237, §§ 2 et 5, n'est pas applicable à ce bail.Nonobstant toute clause contraire, à défaut d'un congé notifié dans les délais ou si le preneur continue à occuper le bien loué sans opposition du bailleur, et même dans l'hypothèse où un nouveau contrat est conclu entre les mêmes parties, le bail est réputé avoir été conclu pour une période de neuf ans à compter de la date à laquelle le bail initial de courte durée est entré en vigueur et est dès lors régi par l'article 237, §§ 1er à 5. Dans ce cas, le loyer et les autres conditions demeurent inchangés par rapport à ceux convenus dans le bail initial de courte durée, sans préjudice de l'application de l'article 224.
articleEN: Short-term Leases
question: Le bail de courte durée prend-il automatiquement fin à l’échéance à Bruxelles ?
questionEN: Does a short-term lease automatically end at the expiration date in Brussels?
answerLLM:
I am a legal assistant, and my response is based on the information provided. However, I am not an attorney, and my response should not be considered legal advice.

Based on the legal article "Short-term Leases," I can provide the following answer to your question:

In Brussels, a short-term lease does not automatically end at the expiration date. According to the legal article, the lessor must provide notice to the lessee in order to terminate the lease agreement. The notice period varies depending on the duration of the lease. For a lease of up to six months, the notice period is three months, while for a lease between six months and nine years, the notice period is six months. Therefore, if the lessor fails to provide proper notice, the lease will continue on a month-to-month basis until the necessary notice is given.
goldy: Before going any further, signing a short-term lease does not mean you are still in a short-term lease! Before terminating the lease, you must check what type of contract you are in. For more information, see the question "Is my lease a short-term lease?" No. The lease agreement does not automatically end at the specified expiration date, except if it is a lease of less than 6 months. To terminate the lease, you or the landlord must give a 3-month notice before the expiration date. You will find a sample letter of termination of a short-term lease at the end in the template documents. Be careful, if you are still occupying the dwelling, your lease turns into a 9-year lease if: you or your landlord have not terminated the lease; you have not renewed the lease (to keep it as a short-term lease). For more information, see the question "What happens if I remain in the dwelling after the expiration of the short-term lease?"

legal article: Les actions naissant du contrat sont prescrites un an après la cessation de celui-ci ou cinq ans après le fait qui a donné naissance à l'action, sans que ce dernier délai puisse excéder un an après la cessation du contrat.En cas d'application de l'article 39bis, l'action naissant du non-paiement de l'indemnité de congé est prescrite un an après le dernier paiement effectif d'une mensualité par l'employeur.
articleEN: Legal actions arising from a contract become time-barred one year after the termination of the contract or five years after the occurrence of the fact which gave rise to the legal action, whichever period expires first. However, this five-year period may not exceed one year after the termination of the contract. In the event that Article 39bis is applied, the legal action arising from the non-payment of the termination indemnity becomes time-barred one year after the last effective monthly payment made by the employer.
question: A qui m’adresser si mon employeur ne respecte pas ses obligations ?
questionEN: Who should I turn to if my employer is not fulfilling their obligations?
answerLLM:
Based on the provided legal article, if your employer is not fulfilling their obligations, you should turn to the legal system to enforce your rights. However, it is important to note that legal actions become time-barred after a certain period. Specifically, legal actions related to a contract become time-barred one year after the termination of the contract or five years after the occurrence of the fact which gave rise to the legal action, whichever period expires first. This five-year period may not exceed one year after the termination of the contract.

Furthermore, if the employer has failed to pay the termination indemnity, the legal action related to the non-payment becomes time-barred one year after the last effective monthly payment made by the employer, in accordance with Article 39bis.

Therefore, it is recommended that you seek legal advice as soon as possible to ensure that you take action within the time limits set out in the law.
goldy: You have several options. 1. You can report the facts to the social inspection services. Depending on the problem that concerns you, you can contact different services. With the prevention advisor or the confidential person of your company. This informal route sometimes allows problems to be resolved before resorting to denunciation. With the Federal Public Service Employment, Labor and Social Dialogue: The Directorate-General Control of Work Well-being: for example, for work in an unsanitary space, the absence of protective tools, acts of harassment, etc. Coordinates here. The Directorate-General Control of Social Laws: for example, for non-payment of remuneration, non-compliance with working conditions, etc. Coordinates here. With the National Social Security Office (ONSS), for anything concerning the fight against undeclared work and social fraud. For example: a problem with ONSS contributions, annual holidays, work accidents, family allowances, sickness and disability insurance, DIMONA declaration, part-time work, employment of foreign workers, etc. Coordinates here. 2. You can contact the labor auditor The labor auditorate is the public prosecutor's office of the labor court. It represents the interest of society. It can receive your criminal complaint and decide to prosecute or not your employer, investigate, etc. It can also inform you in the context of social security disputes. For example, a conflict with the National Employment Office (ONEM) following a dismissal. 3. You can file an appeal with the labor court. You can ask the labor court to rule on the conflict that opposes you to your employer. The court can make decisions that require the employer to stop their behavior (for example, in cases of harassment), or that condemn them to pay amounts due as remuneration or damages. In principle, the time limit for filing a legal action is: 1 year from the end of the employment contract; or 5 years from the fact at the origin of the request, but a maximum of 1 year from the end of the employment contract. Be careful, if your claim is based on a criminal offense (for example, non-payment of your remuneration), other deadlines may apply.

legal article: Les mandats, accordés par l'Ordre national des Avocats de Belgique dans des commissions et associations créées par la loi, sont maintenus et sont censés être des mandats communs à l'Ordre des Barreaux francophones et germanophone et à l'Orde van Vlaamse Balies jusqu'à ce qu'elles désignent leurs propres représentants, conformément à leurs propres règlements et aux dispositions légales.
articleEN: The mandates, granted by the National Order of Belgian Lawyers in various commissions and associations established by law, are maintained and are deemed to be common mandates for both the French-speaking and German-speaking Bar Association and the Order of Flemish Legal Practitioners, until such time as they designate their own representatives in accordance with their own bylaws and legal provisions.
question: Je suis en séjour illégal en Belgique (sans papiers). Je suis en séjour illégal. Ai-je droit à un avocat ?
questionEN: I am staying illegally in Belgium (without papers). I am staying illegally. Do I have the right to a lawyer?
answerLLM:
Based on the provided legal article, it does not directly address the issue of whether a person staying illegally in Belgium has the right to a lawyer. The article is about the mandates of the National Order of Belgian Lawyers in various commissions and associations, and the designation of representatives for the French-speaking and German-speaking Bar Association and the Order of Flemish Legal Practitioners.

However, in general, every person in Belgium, regardless of their immigration status, has the right to legal assistance and representation. This right is protected by the Belgian Constitution, international human rights treaties, and European Union law. Therefore, it is likely that a person staying illegally in Belgium also has the right to a lawyer.

To get a definitive answer, it is recommended to consult with a legal professional or a relevant authority in Belgium.
goldy: Yes, to have a lawyer, you need to go to the legal aid office (BAJ). You need to request legal aid. If you are in a closed center, you need to go to the social service of the center. You are generally entitled to a state-funded lawyer for procedures related to obtaining a residence title in Belgium, that is: the regularization request and related procedures; the appeal against a order to leave the territory; the request for international protection (asylum) or subsidiary protection; procedures and proceedings before the General Commissioner for Refugees and Stateless Persons (CGRA), the Council for Alien Litigation (CCE), the Council of State (CE), etc. To obtain legal aid for this type of procedure, you must submit to the BAJ a "proof document". This document must prove: that you are a foreigner (for example your residence title); that a procedure related to obtaining a residence title is ongoing or about to begin, for example: the order to leave the territory; the summons before the CGRA, the CCE, the CE, etc.; the regularization request addressed to the burgomaster; etc. The BAJ may however ask you to submit additional documents (which it will specify). Be aware! If your request for legal aid concerns a procedure other than your stay in Belgium (for example a family dispute or a housing problem), you are not automatically entitled to legal aid. The BAJ checks whether you are entitled to it based on your income. If you are staying illegally, it is not easy to provide a household composition, a payslip or any other proof of your resources. Most of the time, other proofs are accepted. The BAJ may prove that you have sufficient "resources" and refuse to grant you legal aid. The term "resources" refers to your income, that of the members of your household, your savings, assistance from third parties, your cars, real estate, etc. If you are in a closed center, request a lawyer quickly because the deadlines for appealing a decision of expulsion are much shorter. To find out the addresses of BAJ, consult our sheet "How to find the addresses and opening hours of legal aid offices?" For more information on access to a lawyer, consult our section "Legal aid".

legal article: En cas d'urgence, le procureur du Roi du lieu où le malade se trouve, ou s'il échet, le procureur du Roi visé à l'article 1er, § 2, alinéa 4,peut décider que celui-ci sera mis en observation dans le service psychiatrique qu'il désigne.Le procureur du Roi se saisit soit d'office, à la suite de l'avis écrit d'un médecin désigné par lui, soit à la demande écrite d'une personne intéressée, demande qui sera accompagnée du rapport visé à l'article 5.L'urgence doit ressortir dudit avis ou rapport.Le procureur du Roi notifie sa décision au directeur de l'établissement. Les modalités d'exécution de la décision du procureur du Roi seront réglées par arrêté royal.Dans les vingt-quatre heures de sa décision, le procureur du Roi en avise le juge de la résidence, ou à défaut, du domicile du malade ou, à défaut encore le juge du lieu où le malade se trouve et lui adresse la requête écrite visée à l'article 5. Dans le même délai, le procureur du Roi donne connaissance de sa décision et de sa requête écrite au malade et, le cas échéant, à son représentant légal, à son conjoint, à son cohabitant légal et à la personne avec laquelle il forme un ménage de fait, à la personne chez qui le malade réside, et, le cas échéant, à la personne intéressée qui a saisi le procureur du Roi. Au cas où le malade détient l'autorité parentale sur la personne d'un enfant, le procureur du Roi donne également connaissance de sa décision et de sa requête écrite à l'autre parent et, le cas échéant, à la personne à laquelle l'enfant mineur a été confié.La procédure prévue aux articles 6, 7 et 8 est applicable.Si le procureur du Roi n'a pas adressé dans les vingt-quatre heures la requête visée au cinquième alinéa du présent article ou si le juge n'a pas pris de décision dans le délai prévu à l'article 8, la mesure prise par le procureur du Roi prend fin.
articleEN: In case of emergency, the King's Prosecutor of the jurisdiction where the patient is located, or, if necessary, the King's Prosecutor designated in article 1, §2, alinéa 4, can decide that the patient will be observed in the psychiatric department they designate. The King's Prosecutor shall take action either ex officio, based on a written opinion from a physician designated by them, or at the written request of an interested person, accompanied by the report provided for in article 5. The urgency must be apparent from said opinion or report. The King's Prosecutor shall notify their decision to the director of the institution. The modalities of implementing the King's Prosecutor's decision shall be determined by royal decree. Within twenty-four hours of their decision, the King's Prosecutor shall inform the judge of the jurisdiction, or, in the absence thereof, the judge of the domicile of the patient, or, in the absence of both, the judge of the location of the patient, and shall submit the written request provided for in article 5. Within the same timeframe, the King's Prosecutor shall notify their decision and written request to the patient and, if applicable, their legal representative, spouse, legal cohabitant, and person with whom they cohabit de facto, the person in whose household the patient resides, and, if applicable, the interested person who contacted the King's Prosecutor. In case the patient holds parental authority over a child, the King's Prosecutor shall also notify their decision and written request to the other parent and, if applicable, to the person to whom the minor child has been entrusted. The procedure provided for in articles 6, 7, and 8 shall apply. If the King's Prosecutor has not submitted the request provided for in the fifth subparagraph of this article within twenty-four hours, or if the judge has not made a decision within the timeframe provided for in article 8, the measure taken by the King's Prosecutor shall expire.
question: Qui peut demander une mesure de mise en observation quand il y a urgence ?
questionEN: Who can request a measure of placement under observation in case of urgency?
answerLLM: Based on the provided legal article, a measure of placement under observation in case of urgency can be requested by the King's Prosecutor of the jurisdiction where the patient is located, or the King's Prosecutor designated in article 1, §2, alinéa 4. The request can be made either ex officio, based on a written opinion from a physician designated by them, or at the written request of an interested person, accompanied by a report as provided for in article 5. The urgency of the situation must be apparent from the opinion or report. The King's Prosecutor's decision must be notified to the director of the institution, the judge of the jurisdiction, the patient and any applicable representatives, and other interested parties as specified in the article. If the King's Prosecutor has not submitted the request to the judge within 24 hours, or if the judge has not made a decision within the timeframe provided for in article 8, the measure taken by the King's Prosecutor will expire.
goldy: In emergency situations, any interested person can approach the prosecutor of the King. He can order a placement in observation. The person must meet the following conditions to be placed in observation: be a mentally ill person; represent a danger to themselves or others; cannot be treated by any other appropriate treatment or refuse all proposed treatments. The urgency must be justified. An immediate placement in observation must be the only possible solution. In practice, this emergency procedure is much more frequent than the "normal" procedure before the justice of the peace. The urgency must be medically justified. The prosecutor of the King cannot make a decision until he has: sought written advice from a doctor he designates, if he has initiated the measure; or consulted a detailed medical report provided by the person who requested his intervention. The prosecutor of the King must then request the justice of the peace to confirm the observation measure. If the prosecutor of the King does not do so within 24 hours of his decision, the measure ends. For a summary of the procedure, see the attached diagram in the "standard documents".

legal article: Pour l'application de la présente loi, est considéré comme accident du travail tout accident qui survient à un travailleur dans le cours et par le fait de l'exécution du contrat de louage de travail et qui produit une lésion.L'accident survenu dans le cours de l'exécution du contrat est présumé, jusqu'à preuve du contraire, survenu par le fait de cette exécution.L'accident causé par le terrorisme, comme défini dans la loi du 1er avril 2007 relative à l'assurance contre les dommages causés par le terrorisme, et survenu pendant l'exécution du contrat de travail, est considéré comme étant survenu par le fait de l'exécution du contrat de travail.Est également considéré comme accident du travail, l'accident subi par le travailleur en dehors du cours de l'exécution du contrat, mais qui est causé par un tiers du fait de l'exécution du contrat.L'accident survenu au télétravailleur est présumé, jusqu'à preuve du contraire, survenu pendant l'exécution du contrat de travail :1° s'il se produit sur le lieu ou les lieux mentionnés par écrit comme lieu d'exécution du travail, dans une convention de télétravail ou dans tout autre écrit autorisant de manière générique ou ponctuelle, collective ou individuelle, le télétravail.A défaut d'une telle mention, la présomption s'appliquera à la résidence ou sur le ou les lieux dans lesquels le télétravailleur effectue habituellement son télétravail;et2° s'il se produit durant la période de la journée mentionnée dans un écrit tel que visé au 1°, comme période pendant laquelle le travail peut être effectué. A défaut d'une telle mention dans la convention écrite, la présomption s'appliquera pendant les heures de travail que le télétravailleur devrait prester s'il était occupé dans les locaux de l'employeur.
articleEN: For the application of the present law, any accident that befalls a worker in the course and by the fact of the execution of the contract of employment and that produces an injury is considered to be a work accident. The accident that occurs in the course of the execution of the contract is presumed, until proof to the contrary, to have occurred by the fact of this execution. The accident caused by terrorism, as defined in the law of April 1, 2007 regarding insurance against damages caused by terrorism, and that occurs during the execution of the employment contract is considered to have occurred by the fact of the execution of the employment contract. An accident is also considered to be a work accident, the accident suffered by the worker outside the course of the execution of the contract, but that is caused by a third party due to the execution of the contract. The accident that occurs to the teleworker is presumed, until proof to the contrary, to have occurred during the execution of the employment contract: 1° if it occurs on the premises or the premises mentioned in writing as the place of execution of the work, in a telework agreement or in any other written authorizing in a generic or occasional, collective or individual manner, telework. In the absence of such mention, the presumption shall apply to the residence or on the premises where the teleworker usually performs his telework; and 2° if it occurs during the period of the day mentioned in a writing such as that referred to in 1°, as the period during which the work can be carried out. In the absence of such mention in the written agreement, the presumption shall apply during the working hours that the teleworker should perform if he was employed in the employer's premises.
question: J’ai un accident pendant une journée de télétravail, est-ce un accident du travail ?
questionEN: I had an accident during a day of teleworking, is it considered a work accident?
answerLLM:
Based on the provided legal article, an accident that occurs during teleworking is considered a work accident if it meets certain conditions. Specifically, the accident is presumed to have occurred during the execution of the employment contract if it happens:

1. On the premises or the location specified in writing as the place of execution of the work in a telework agreement or any other written authorization. In the absence of such mention, the presumption applies to the residence or the location where the teleworker usually performs their telework.
2. During the period of the day mentioned in writing as the period during which the work can be carried out. In the absence of such mention in the written agreement, the presumption applies during the working hours that the teleworker should perform if they were employed in the employer's premises.

Therefore, if you had an accident during a day of teleworking while you were carrying out your duties during the specified working hours and at the designated location, it would be considered a work accident. However, if you were not working or were outside of the designated location and working hours, it may not be considered a work accident. Ultimately, the determination would depend on the specific facts and circumstances of the situation.
goldy: Yes, if the accident meets the conditions of a "classic" work accident. For more information, see our fact sheet "Is any accident during my working hours a work accident?". The accident is presumed to be caused by your work if the following conditions are met. The accident occurs at the location designated for your telework. This location can be designated by the work regulations, by your employment contract, by a text message, an email, an internal letter, etc.: any written authorization for telework, whether general or occasional. If no location is designated in writing, you are presumed to be teleworking at your place of residence, or at your usual telework location. The accident occurs during the designated telework hours. These hours can be designated by the work regulations, by your employment contract, by a text message, by an email, an internal letter, etc.: any written authorization for telework, whether general or occasional. If the hours are not designated in writing, you are presumed to be teleworking during your usual office hours when you are working at the employer's location. A telework accident can therefore be a work accident, regardless of whether you are: a structural teleworker (i.e., pre-planned, at a frequency, locations, and times specified in advance in writing) or an occasional teleworker (i.e., telework agreed upon more freely and occasionally, without being fixed in advance at specific times and places). These rules: have been in effect since January 27, 2019; and apply to both the private and public sectors.

legal article: Le centre est tenu d'entendre le demandeur, si celui-ci le demande, avant de prendre une décision relative à :- l'octroi, le refus ou la révision d'un revenu d'intégration, d'un projet individualisé d'intégration sociale, ou d'une intégration sociale par l'emploi;- les sanctions visées à l'article 30, §§ 1 et 2;- la récupération à charge d'une personne qui a perçu le revenu d'intégration.Le centre est tenu d'informer l'intéressé de ce droit, selon les modalités fixées par le Roi.L'intéressé peut être entendu soit par le conseil, soit par l'organe compétent ayant un pouvoir de décision dans le cas concret.Lors de son audition, l'intéressé peut se faire assister ou représenter par une personne de son choix.
articleEN: Article: The center is required to hear the applicant, if they so request, before making a decision regarding:
question: Puis-je demander au CPAS de revoir sa décision ?
questionEN: Can I request the CPAS to review its decision?
answerLLM: Yes, according to the relevant law article provided, an applicant has the right to request the Center for Public Assistance (CPAS) to review its decision before it is made. This means that the CPAS must provide the applicant with an opportunity to be heard if they make such a request. Therefore, if you disagree with a decision made by the CPAS, you can exercise your right to request a review of that decision and present your case before it is finalized.
goldy: Yes. It can sometimes be interesting, in certain circumstances, to ask the CPAS (Public Center for Social Welfare) to review its decision rather than filing a claim at the labor court. The CPAS can withdraw a decision it has made and replace it with another. You will save time compared to filing a claim before the court. The CPAS must review its decision: when it comes to agreeing, refusing or revising the social integration income (RIS), the individualized social integration project (PIIS), or social integration through employment; if your situation has changed; if the rules have changed; if the CPAS made a mistake; if your statements about your situation were incorrect or incomplete. The CPAS can revise its decision: if it concerns other forms of aid; if the CPAS has refused your request for aid because it deems that you do not meet the conditions. Each CPAS operates differently. Contact your social worker to see how to request a hearing and a review of the decision. Most CPAS accept hearing a person who requests that the decision be reviewed. It is generally necessary to send a written request for a hearing (either to the social worker or to the CPAS president). This request is a simple letter. It is better to explain, at least briefly, the reasons for this request. For the RIS, if the CPAS refuses a hearing after making its decision, it is sufficient to submit a new request. The CPAS is then required to make a new decision, and to hear you if you request it.

legal article: Le tribunal peut, pour des motifs graves, lever la prohibition prévue pour les alliés visés à l'article 161 et la prohibition visée à l'article 163.La procédure est introduite sur requête unilatérale par un des futurs conjoints. Le tribunal statue après avoir convoqué les futurs conjoints et après avoir reccueilli l'avis du procureur du Roi sur le sujet.
articleEN: The court may, for serious reasons, lift the ban provided for allied parties referred to in Article 161 and the ban provided for in Article 163. The procedure is initiated by a unilateral request from one of the future spouses. The court rules after summoning the future spouses and after hearing the advice of the King's Attorney on the subject.
question: Je me marie. Quels documents remettre pour pouvoir me marier ?
questionEN: I am getting married. What documents do I need to provide in order to get married?
answerLLM:
Based on the provided legal article, it seems that the article is discussing the process for lifting certain marriage bans in your jurisdiction. However, it does not provide information about the documents needed to get married.

In general, the specific documents required to get married can vary depending on the jurisdiction and the individual circumstances of the couple. In many places, couples will need to provide identification documents (such as a passport or driver's license), proof of age, and any required documentation related to any previous marriages (such as a divorce decree or death certificate of a former spouse).

To be sure, you should check with the local government office responsible for issuing marriage licenses in your area to determine the specific documents that you will need to provide.
goldy: In order for your marriage declaration to be recorded, you must present the following documents to the commune (to the civil registrar): a full copy of your birth certificate; proof of your identity; proof of your nationality; proof of your celibacy, and if you have been married in the past: proof of divorce or annulment of your previous marriages; proof of your registration in the population registers, the foreigners register or the waiting list, and/or proof of your current residence or, if not applicable, proof of your habitual residence in Belgium for more than 3 months; any other authentic document that can prove that you meet the conditions to marry. For example, when a foreign law needs to be examined to verify that you can marry, the commune may sometimes request a "certificate of custom", which is an attestation that confirms the content of that foreign law; a written and legalized proof of consent from your future spouse to the marriage celebration, if they are absent during the marriage declaration. The commune can access most of these documents through the Civil Registry Acts Database (B.A.E.C.). Please inquire at the commune. You must have all these documents to make your marriage declaration (especially if one or both of the future spouses are in illegal stay in Belgium).

legal article: § 1er. La titulaire qui souhaite prétendre à l'allocation de maternité visée à l'article 94 doit introduire à cet effet, une demande à envoyer par la poste à son organisme assureur, le cachet postal faisant foi, ou lui remettre cette demande contre accusé de réception.§ 2. La demande doit mentionner cumulativement les données suivantes :1° la date présumee de l'accouchement;2° s'il s'agit ou non d'une naissance multiple;3° le nombre de semaines durant lesquelles la titulaire souhaite prendre son repos prénatal facultatif complet et/ou à mi-temps ainsi que la ou les périodes précises de ce repos. Ce repos prénatal facultatif complet et/ou à mi-temps peut débuter au plus tôt à partir de la troisième semaine qui précède la date présumée de l'accouchement. Le repos prénatal facultatif complet et/ou à mi-temps peut être pris seulement par période de sept jours calendrier. Si la titulaire souhaite modifier le nombre de semaines de repos prénatal facultatif complet et/ou à mi-temps après avoir introduit cette demande, elle doit le signaler préalablement à son organisme assureur;4° le nombre de semaines pendant lesquelles la titulaire souhaite prendre son repos postnatal facultatif complet et/ou à mi-temps, endéans la période de trente-six semaines fixée à l'article 93, § 2, b, dernier alinéa, ainsi que la ou les périodes précises de ce repos. Ce repos postnatal facultatif complet et/ou à mi-temps peut débuter au plus tôt le premier jour qui suit les deux semaines de repos postnatal obligatoire. Pour le congé postnatal facultatif complet et/ou à mi-temps, la titulaire doit spécifier clairement quand, endéans les trente-six semaines prévues, elle souhaite prendre ces semaines. Le repos postnatal facultatif complet et/ou à mi-temps peut uniquement être pris par période de sept jours calendrier. Si la titulaire souhaite modifier le nombre de semaines de repos postnatal facultatif complet et/ou à mi-temps, et/ou le moment auquel elle souhaite prendre ces semaines, après avoir introduit cette demande, elle doit le signaler préalablement à son organisme assureur.§ 3. La demande visée au § 2 doit être accompagnée d'un certificat médical attestant la date présumée de l'accouchement et s'il s'agit ou non d'une naissance multiple. La titulaire doit produire par la suite, un extrait de l'acte de naissance ou un certificat médical confirmant l'accouchement.§ 4. La titulaire informe son organisme assureur, dans les deux semaines qui suivent la naissance de l'enfant, du fait qu'elle souhaite bénéficier de la prolongation visée à l'article 93, § 3 et lui communique le nombre de semaines de prolongation. Elle lui remet à cet effet, une attestation de l'établissement hospitalier certifiant que les conditions prévues par l'article 93, § 3 sont remplies et mentionnant la durée de l'hospitalisation du nouveau-né.Si la période réelle d'hospitalisation ne correspond pas à la durée mentionnée dans l'attestation susmentionnée, la titulaire remet à la fin de la prolongation susvisée, une nouvelle attestation de l'établissement hospitalier certifiant que le nouveau-né est resté hospitalisé pendant cette prolongation et mentionnant la durée de l'hospitalisation.La titulaire informe également son organisme assureur du fait qu'elle souhaite reprendre son activité professionnelle habituelle à mi-temps au cours de tout ou partie de cette prolongation. La titulaire communique la ou les périodes précises de cette prolongation prise à mi-temps. Si la titulaire souhaite modifier le nombre de semaines prises à mi-temps et/ou le moment auquel elle souhaite les prendre après avoir introduit cette demande, elle doit le signaler préalablement à son organisme assureur.
articleEN: § 1er. The entitled individual who wishes to claim the maternity allowance provided for in Article 94 must submit an application to this effect, which must be sent by mail to the relevant insurance organization, with the postmark as proof, or delivered in person against receipt.
question: Je suis travailleur indépendant(e). Quelles démarches faire en début de grossesse si je suis travailleuse indépendante ?
questionEN: I am a self-employed worker. What steps should I take at the beginning of my pregnancy if I am a self-employed worker?
answerLLM:
Based on the provided legal article, if you are a self-employed worker who is pregnant, to claim the maternity allowance, you should take the following steps:

1. Prepare and complete the application for maternity allowance.
2. Send the application to the relevant insurance organization by mail, using a dated postmark as proof, or deliver it in person and ensure you receive a receipt.

By following these steps, you will have initiated the process of claiming the maternity allowance available to you under the specified law.
goldy: Before going further, this sheet only contains general information. For any details or additional questions, please contact your health insurance provider. Please be aware of 2 things: The rules are not exactly the same for salaried workers, self-employed workers, and civil servants. The concept of a dependent person is not the same in different social security systems. For example, a dependent person for health and disability insurance is not necessarily a dependent person for unemployment, nor for family allowances. The only procedures you need to worry about concern social security (benefits during maternity leave, family allowances, birth allowance, etc.). These procedures should be done through your health insurance provider and social security office. For the rest, there is no specific procedure to be done at your workplace, except for organizing your absence and finding a potential replacement if necessary. Since you are a self-employed worker, you do not have to report to an employer. Therefore, you have no specific obligations or procedures to follow. For more information, please visit the INASTI website.

legal article: § 1er. Le droit d'entrée est reconnu au citoyen de l'Union sur présentation d'une carte d'identité ou d'un passeport, en cours de validité ou s'il peut faire constater ou prouver d'une autre façon sa qualité de bénéficiaire du droit de circuler ou de séjourner librement.Lorsque le citoyen de l'Union ne dispose pas des documents requis, le ministre ou son délégué lui accorde tous les moyens raisonnables afin de lui permettre d'obtenir ou de se procurer, dans un délai raisonnable, les documents requis ou de faire confirmer ou prouver par d'autres moyens sa qualité de bénéficiaire du droit de circuler et de séjourner librement, avant de procéder à son refoulement.§ 2. Le droit d'entrée est reconnu aux membres de la famille d'un citoyen de l'Union visés à l'article 40bis, § 2, qui ne sont pas citoyens de l'Union sur présentation d'un passeport en cours de validité revêtu, le cas échéant, d'un visa d'entrée en cours de validité, conformément au règlement UE 2018/1806 du Parlement européen et du Conseil du 14 novembre 2018 fixant la liste des pays tiers dont les ressortissants sont soumis à l'obligation de visa pour franchir les frontières extérieures des Etats membres et la liste de ceux dont les ressortissants sont exemptés de cette obligation.Le Roi détermine les modalités de délivrance du visa.La possession d'une carte de séjour de membre de la famille d'un citoyen de l'Union ou d'une carte de séjour permanent de membre de la famille d'un citoyen de l'Union, délivrée sur la base de la Directive 2004/38/CE du Parlement européen et du Conseil du 29 avril 2004 relative au droit des citoyens de l'Union et des membres de leurs familles de circuler et de séjourner librement sur le territoire des Etats membres, dispense le membre de la famille de l'obligation d'obtenir le visa d'entrée visé à l'alinéa 1er.Lorsque le membre de la famille d'un citoyen de l'Union ne dispose pas des documents requis, le ministre ou son délégué lui accorde tous les moyens raisonnables afin de lui permettre d'obtenir ou de se procurer, dans un délai raisonnable, les documents requis ou de faire confirmer ou prouver par d'autres moyens sa qualité de bénéficiaire du droit de circuler et de séjourner librement, avant de procéder à son refoulement.§ 3. Le titulaire d'une carte d'identité ou d'un passeport délivré par les autorités belges, est admis sans formalité sur le territoire du Royaume même si sa nationalité est contestée ou si ce document est périmé.§ 4. Lorsque le citoyen de l'Union n'est pas en possession d'une carte d'identité ou d'un passeport national, en cours de validité, ou lorsque le membre de famille d'un citoyen de l'Union, qui n'est pas citoyen de l'Union, n'est pas en possession d'un passeport national en cours de validité revêtu, le cas échéant, d'un visa d'entrée conformément au règlement UE 2018/1806précité, en cours de validité, le ministre ou son délégué peut lui infliger une amende administrative de 200 euros. Cette amende est perçue conformément à l'article 42octies.
articleEN: Section 1. A citizen of the Union has the right of entry upon presentation of a valid identity card or passport, or if they can demonstrate or prove their quality as a beneficiary of the right to free movement and residence in another manner. If the citizen of the Union does not have the required documents, the Minister or their delegate shall grant them all reasonable means to obtain or procure the required documents or confirm or prove their status as a beneficiary of the right to free movement and residence within a reasonable time, before proceeding to their expulsion.
question: Je suis européen. Va-t-on retirer mon droit de séjour si je demande une aide sociale en tant que citoyen européen ?
questionEN: I am European. Will my right to stay be withdrawn if I apply for social assistance as a European citizen?
answerLLM: Based on the provided legal article, there is no mention of withdrawal of a European citizen's right to stay for applying for social assistance. Therefore, according to this article, your right to stay should not be withdrawn solely for applying for social assistance. However, it is important to note that this answer is based solely on the provided legal article and other factors or laws may also be relevant to your situation. It is always best to consult with a legal professional for advice specific to your circumstances.
goldy: Before going further, the right to social integration and social assistance of Europeans depends on several elements:

legal article: § 1. Il peut être imposé à l'intéressé de faire valoir ses droits à l'égard des personnes qui lui doivent des aliments, ces dernières étant limitées à : son conjoint ou, le cas échéant, son ex-conjoint; les ascendants et descendants du premier degré, l'adoptant et l'adopté.§ 2. Les conventions relatives à une pension alimentaire ne sont pas opposables au centre.§ 3. Le centre peut agir de plein droit au nom et en faveur de l'intéressé afin de faire valoir les droits visés aux articles 3, 6°, et 4, § 1.
articleEN: Section 1. The individual concerned may be required to assert his rights with regard to persons who owe him alimony, such persons being limited to:
question: A quels débiteurs alimentaires le CPAS peut-il m'imposer de demander de l'aide pour le RIS ?
questionEN: Who are the personal creditors to whom the Public Center for Social Welfare (CPAS) can require me to request assistance for Social Integration Income (RIS)?
answerLLM: Based on the provided legal article, the Personal creditors to whom the Public Center for Social Welfare (CPAS) can require an individual to request assistance for Social Integration Income (RIS) are limited to those who owe the individual alimony. Therefore, according to this law article, the CPAS can only require assistance from the individual's personal creditors who have a legal obligation to pay alimony to the individual.
goldy: Only to: your spouse or ex-spouse; your ascendants and descendants of the 1st degree (that is to say, your parents and your children, but not your grandparents nor your grandchildren); your adoptive parent and your adoptive child. Particularity for your ex-spouse: the Public Centre for Social Welfare (CPAS) can only refer you to him/her if he/she still has a legal obligation to provide maintenance for you. Your ex-spouse no longer has an obligation towards you: if the divorce procedure is definitively closed before your request for assistance to the CPAS; and if the divorce judgment does not grant you alimony. The CPAS cannot therefore impose on you to ask him/her for alimony. If you have signed a convention relating to alimony, it is not enforceable against the CPAS. It is not obliged to respect it. If you give up claiming alimony in the context of a divorce procedure, the CPAS cannot reproach you for it. But you must prove for what reasons you have given up. This is often part of a balance between several things (alimony, family allowances, the family home, etc.). For example, you obtain a more important advantage (for example, keeping the house). In principle, the CPAS cannot refuse to grant assistance for the sole reason that you have voluntarily placed yourself in a state of need, due to your negligence. Therefore, the CPAS cannot reproach you for the amount of alimony, nor for giving up asking for alimony, unless it proves that you have acted with fraudulent intent.

legal article: L'administration est une charge personnelle qui ne passe point aux héritiers de l'administrateur.L'administration vise à défendre les intérêts de la personne protégée. Elle accroît, dans la mesure du possible, l'autonomie de la personne protégée.
articleEN: The administration is a personal charge which does not pass on to the heirs of the administrator. The administration aims to defend the interests of the protected person. It increases, to the extent possible, the autonomy of the protected person.
question: Que faire si le montant des frais et honoraires de l'administrateur semble exagéré ?
questionEN: What to do if the amount of the fees and billings of the administrator seems excessive?
answerLLM:
Based on the provided legal article, if the amount of fees and billings of the administrator seems excessive, you may want to challenge the administrator's accounts. As stated in the article, the administration is a personal charge of the administrator and does not pass on to the heirs of the administrator. This means that the administrator is personally responsible for justifying the reasonableness of their fees and billings.

To challenge the administrator's accounts, you can request a formal accounting from the administrator, which should provide a detailed breakdown of all the fees and billings incurred during the administration period. Once you have received the formal accounting, you can review the same and raise any objections to the court if you believe that the fees and billings are excessive or unreasonable.

The court will then review the objections and determine whether the administrator's fees and billings are reasonable and justified. If the court determines that the fees and billings are excessive, it may reduce the same and order the administrator to return any excess amounts to the estate.

Therefore, if you believe that the administrator's fees and billings are excessive, it is important to take action and challenge the administrator's accounts to ensure that the administration is being carried out in the best interests of the protected person and that the administrator is not profiting excessively from the administration.
goldy: 1. You can ask the administrator for a detailed statement of their fees and expenses. The administrator should be able to justify all expenses. Their remuneration should always be validated and authorized by the justice of the peace.

legal article: § 1.  Celui qui remplace un travailleur dont l'exécution du contrat est suspendue pour un motif autre que le manque de travail résultant de causes économiques, d'intempéries, de grève ou de lock-out, peut être engagé dans des conditions qui dérogent aux règles prévues par la présente loi en ce qui concerne la durée du contrat et le délai de préavis.Le motif, l'identité du ou des travailleurs remplacés et les conditions de cet engagement doivent être constatés par écrit pour chaque travailleur individuellement, au plus tard au moment de l'entrée en service de celui-ci.La durée du contrat de remplacement conclu en application des dispositions du présent article ne peut dépasser deux ans.Lorsque les parties ont conclu plusieurs contrats de travail de remplacement successifs, sans qu'il y ait entre eux une interruption attribuable au travailleur, la durée totale de ces contrats successifs ne peut dépasser deux ans.A défaut d'écrit ou en cas de dépassement de la période de deux ans prévue aux alinéas 3 et 4, le contrat est soumis aux mêmes conditions que les contrats conclus pour une durée indéterminée.§ 2. Les dispositions du § 1er peuvent aussi être appliquées pour l'engagement d'un travailleur engagé en remplacement d'une personne dont la situation juridique est réglée unilatéralement par l'autorité et qui n'exerce pas ses fonctions ou ne les exerce qu'à temps partiel. § 3. Les dispositions du paragraphe 1er peuvent aussi être appliquées lorsqu'un travailleur est engagé en vue de remplacer un travailleur en incapacité de travail, qui reprend temporairement, en accord avec l'employeur, un travail adapté ou un autre travail, en application de l'article 31/1 de cette loi, pour ce qui concerne les heures de travail de son régime normal de travail pour lesquelles ce travailleur en incapacité de travail n'effectue pas de prestations de travail.
articleEN: Section 1. A person who replaces a worker whose contract execution is suspended for a reason other than a lack of work resulting from economic causes, bad weather, strike, or lock-out, may be engaged under conditions that deviate from the rules provided by this law with respect to the duration of the contract and the notice period. The reason, the identity of the worker or workers being replaced, and the terms of this engagement must be in writing for each individual worker, no later than the start of their service. The duration of the replacement contract concluded in application of the provisions of this article shall not exceed two years. If the parties have entered into several successive replacement work contracts, without there being an interruption attributable to the worker, the total duration of these successive contracts shall not exceed two years. In the absence of written documentation or in case of exceeding the two-year period provided for in paragraphs 3 and 4, the contract shall be subject to the same conditions as contracts concluded for an indeterminate duration.
question: Puis-je signer plusieurs contrats de remplacement chez le même employeur ?
questionEN: Can I sign several interim contracts with the same employer?
answerLLM:
Based on the provided legal article, it seems that you are asking about employment law. The article discusses the use of replacement work contracts, which can deviate from the usual rules regarding contract duration and notice period. However, these replacement contracts have certain limitations. Specifically, the duration of an individual replacement contract cannot exceed two years, and the total duration of successive replacement contracts with the same worker cannot exceed two years, with no interruption attributable to the worker.

In light of this information, it appears that you could sign several interim contracts with the same employer, but each contract would need to be a replacement contract as defined in the law. Furthermore, the total duration of these successive contracts cannot exceed two years. If the contracts do exceed this limit, they would be subject to the same conditions as contracts concluded for an indeterminate duration.

It is important to note that this answer is based on a strict interpretation of the provided legal article and may not take into account other relevant factors or legal considerations. Therefore, it is always a good idea to consult with a legal professional for advice on specific legal questions.
goldy: Yes, but the total duration of successive replacement contracts cannot exceed 2 years. With a replacement contract, you are in a precarious situation. You do not know when your contract will end because you do not know when the worker you are replacing will return. For example, in case of illness, you do not know when the sick worker will be healed and able to resume work. When the worker you are replacing returns, your contract ends without notice or severance pay, or with reduced notice. However, for this exception to the worker's rights to be valid, the replacement contract must meet several conditions. You must sign a written, individual contract, at the latest when you start working. This contract must specify: the reason for the replacement (for example: maternity leave, time credit, etc.); the identity of the worker you are replacing; and the terms of your engagement (working time, hours, salary, etc.). The reason for the replacement cannot be: partial unemployment for economic reasons or bad weather; nor a strike; nor a lockout. The total duration of the replacement cannot exceed 2 years. You can have one replacement contract, or several successive replacement contracts with the same employer. If one of these conditions is not met, you have an open-ended contract (CDI). For example: if you have not signed a written contract; or if you have been in a replacement contract for more than 2 years. You then benefit from the protective rules for workers, in particular for notice periods and severance pay in the event of termination of the employment contract. It is possible to sign several fixed-term contracts (CDD) and several replacement contracts with the same employer. If the total duration of the contracts exceeds 2 years, it is considered that you have had an open-ended contract (CDI) from the beginning. This rule comes from a judgment of the Constitutional Court of 17 June 2021. The law has not yet been amended in this sense. For more information, see the website of the Federal Public Service Employment, Work and Social Dialogue - replacement contract.

legal article: L'allocation familiale de base visée à l'article 7, b, est majorée d'un supplément d'orphelin. Ce supplément d'orphelin s'élève à :a 50 % du montant de l'allocation familiale de base pour l'enfant dont l'un des parents est décédé ;b 100 % du montant de l'allocation familiale de base pour l'enfant dont les deux parents sont décédés ou pour l'enfant dont le seul parent connu est décédé.La filiation établie par adoption est prise en considération afin de déterminer les droits aux suppléments visés au présent article.La déclaration d'absence, conforme aux dispositions du Code civil, est assimilée au décès afin d'établir les droits aux suppléments d'orphelin. Cette assimilation cesse au moment où l'absent reparaît ou donne de ses nouvelles après la déclaration d'absence.
articleEN: The basic family allowance referred to in Article 7, b, is increased by an orphan's supplement. This orphan's supplement amounts to:
question: Un enfant orphelin a-t-il droit à un supplément d'allocations familiales à Bruxelles ?
questionEN: Does a child who is an orphan have the right to a family allowance supplement in Brussels?
answerLLM: Yes, a child who is an orphan does have the right to a family allowance supplement in Brussels. According to the provided legal article, the basic family allowance is increased by an orphan's supplement, which is a benefit specifically for children who are orphans.
goldy: Yes. Amounts of supplement for orphaned child (Brussels) 1 deceased parent 100 % of the basic family allowance 2 deceased parents 100 % of the basic family allowance If the child has only one known parent, and if this parent dies, they are entitled to the supplement for 2 deceased parents. If a parent is declared missing, they are considered as a deceased parent for family allowances. The child is entitled to the orphan supplement. If the child is adopted, and if one of the adoptive parents dies, the child is entitled to the orphan supplement. There is no need to take any action, as the family allowances fund is automatically informed of the death via the Crossroads Bank for Social Security. Since January 2020, the remarriage or cohabitation of the surviving parent no longer results in the loss of the orphan supplement. For more information, see the Famiris website.

legal article: Lorsque le bail vient à échéance ou prend fin par l'effet d'un congé, le preneur qui justifie de circonstances exceptionnelles peut demander une prorogation.A peine de nullité, cette prorogation est demandée au bailleur par envoi recommandé, au plus tard un mois avant l'expiration du bail.A défaut d'accord entre les parties, le juge peut accorder la prorogation en tenant compte de l'intérêt des deux parties, et, notamment, du grand âge éventuel d'une des parties. Il en fixe la durée, qui doit être déterminée. Il peut également, s'il l'estime équitable, accorder dans ce cas une augmentation de loyer au bailleur qui lui en fait la demande et réduire, ou supprimer, l'indemnité due en application de l'article 55, § 4.Une seule demande de renouvellement de la prorogation peut être introduite, dans les mêmes conditions.A défaut d'accord entre les parties, le juge peut l'accorder, également dans les mêmes conditions.
articleEN: When the lease comes to an end or expires due to notice, the tenant who can prove exceptional circumstances may request an extension. To be valid, this extension must be requested from the landlord by registered mail, at the latest one month before the end of the lease. In the absence of an agreement between the parties, the judge may grant the extension, taking into account the interests of both parties, and in particular, the possible advanced age of one of the parties. The judge sets the duration, which must be determined. The judge may also, if deemed fair, grant an increase in rent to the landlord who requests it, and reduce or eliminate the indemnity due in application of article 55, § 4. Only one request for renewal of the extension may be submitted, under the same conditions. In the absence of an agreement between the parties, the judge may grant it, also under the same conditions.
question: Combien de fois puis-je demander une prorogation pour circonstances exceptionnelles en Wallonie ?
questionEN: How many times can I request an extension for exceptional circumstances in Wallonia?
answerLLM: Based on the provided legal article, a tenant in Wallonia who can prove exceptional circumstances may request an extension of the lease from the landlord. However, such a request can only be made once. The request must be made in writing, via registered mail, at least one month before the end of the lease. If the landlord and tenant do not reach an agreement, the judge may grant the extension, taking into account the interests of both parties. The judge will also determine the duration of the extension and may adjust the rent or indemnity due, if deemed fair. Therefore, you can only request one extension for exceptional circumstances in Wallonia.
goldy: The extension for exceptional circumstances can be requested a maximum of 2 times. For example, your lease is set to end on March 1st, but you fall seriously ill on January 5th, you can request an extension of your lease. An extension of 6 months is granted to you. Your lease will then end on September 1st. If you relapse, you can request another final extension. For more information, see the sheet "Under what conditions can I obtain the extension for exceptional circumstances (Wallonia)?"

legal article: § 1er. Le jeune travailleur qui satisfait aux conditions de stage de l'article 36bis a droit à l'allocation-vacances jeunes visée à l'article 131ter, s'il satisfait simultanément aux conditions suivantes : 1° le travailleur n'a pas déjà satisfait pendant une des années civiles précédentes aux conditions pour bénéficier d'allocation-vacances jeunes ou de vacances supplémentaires en vertu de l'article 5 de l'arrêté royal du 28 juin 1971 adaptant et coordonnant les dispositions légales relatives aux vacances annuelles des travailleurs salariés, tel qu'en vigueur jusqu'au 31 décembre 2000;2° le travailleur a déjà, avant le jour pour lequel l'allocation est demandée, épuisé les jours de vacances rémunérées ordinaires auxquels il a droit conformément au régime de vacances annuelles soit immédiatement après une occupation salariée, soit pendant une période de chômage complet indemnisé;3° l'allocation-vacances jeunes est demandée pour les jours situés dans une période au cours de laquelle le travailleur est lié par un contrat de travail et, à cette date, le travailleur ne bénéficie pas du régime de vacances particulier applicable aux services publics ou d'un régime de rémunération différée comme travailleur occupé dans l'enseignement;4° le travailleur est, pendant les heures de vacances, privé de rémunération au sens de l'article 46 et de revenu de remplacement.L'allocation-vacances jeunes n'est octroyée pour des jours de vacances jeunes qu'à concurrence de quatre semaines, diminuées des jours de vacances rémunérées ordinaires auxquels le jeune travailleur a droit conformément au régime de vacances annuelles des travailleurs salariés et conformément au régime du secteur public, exprimés dans le régime des six jours et au besoin arrondis conformément à la règle prévue à l'article 131ter, dernier alinéa.  Le jeune travailleur ne peut pas bénéficier d'allocations d'insertion ou de chômage comme chômeur temporaire à la suite de la fermeture de l'entreprise pour cause de vacances annuelles aussi longtemps qu'il a droit à des vacances jeunes.Par dérogation à l'article 27, 4°, l'allocation-vacances jeunes n'est pas considérée comme une allocation pour l'application des articles 42, 79, § 4, 92 et 93.L'allocation-vacances jeunes n'est pas considérée comme une allocation de chômage pour le calcul de la durée du chômage requise dans le chef du candidat à un programme d'activation au sens de l'article 7, § 1er, alinéa 3, m, de l'arrêté-loi du 28 décembre 1944 relatif à la sécurité sociale des travailleurs et à une mesure en faveur de l'emploi, sauf si le jour de vacances jeunes est situé dans une occupation qui est assimilée au chômage indemnisé.Pour l'application des dispositions du présent arrêté dans lesquelles il est tenu compte des revenus ou de la rémunération d'un travailleur, l'allocation-vacances jeunes est assimilée à un pécule de vacances. Dans le calcul de l'allocation de garantie de revenus visée à l'article 131bis, il n'est toutefois pas tenu compte du montant de l'allocation-vacances jeunes pour la fixation de la rémunération nette.§ 2. Le travailleur qui est dispensé d'accomplir le stage conformément à l'article 36bis, § 2, a droit à l'allocation-vacances seniors visée à l'article 131ter, s'il satisfait simultanément aux conditions suivantes :1° le travailleur a déjà, avant le jour pour lequel l'allocation est demandée, épuisé les jours de vacances rémunérées ordinaires auxquels il a, le cas échéant, droit conformément au régime
