Au maximum la moitié de la durée du stage peut avoir lieu en dehors de l'entreprise dans un projet de formation ou d'accompagnement accepté par le service concerné de l'entité fédérée compétente;6° la durée prévue du stage de transition est conforme aux dispositions du § 3;7° le stage de transition est réglé par un contrat conclu par le stagiaire, le fournisseur de stage visé au § 2 et le service concerné de l'entité fédérée compétente; ce contrat prévoit un régime inspiré sur celui prévu en cas de formation professionnelle individuelle en entreprise, telle que visée à l'article 27, 6;8° le stagiaire reçoit, en complément de l'allocation de stage visée au § 4, une indemnité mensuelle de 200 euros, à charge du fournisseur de stage visé au § 2;9° le stagiaire introduit mensuellement, par le biais de son organisme de paiement, une attestation de présence au stage de transition dont le modèle a été défini par le comité de gestion.L'allocation de stage ne peut pas être accordée pour les jours au cours desquels le stagiaire est absent sans justification suivant l'attestation visée à l'alinéa 1er, 9°.§ 2. Chaque stagiaire peut effectuer un ou plusieurs stages de transition pendant une période totale de 6 mois maximum.La durée prévue du stage de transition d'un stagiaire est de 3 mois au moins et de 6 mois au plus.Lorsque le stage de transition est arrêté prématurément soit pour des motifs indépendants de la volonté du stagiaire, soit parce que le stagiaire met fin au contrat pour motif grave, soit parce que le stagiaire met fin au contrat en cas de faillite, de reprise ou de fusion de l'entreprise du fournisseur de stage, soit parce que le stagiaire met fin au contrat parce que le fournisseur de stage ne respecte pas le plan de formation, le stagiaire , sous réserve de l'alinéa 5, peut prétendre à un stage de transition suivant si la différence entre le maximum de 6 mois et la durée déjà accomplie de tous les stages de transition précédents mis ensemble est d'au moins 90 jours.La durée prévue de tout autre stage de transition que le premier ne peut être inférieure à la différence visée à l'alinéa précédent.§ 4. Le montant journalier de l'allocation de stage est fixé à 26,82 euros. Le Ministre peut adapter ce montant annuellement sur la base du montant journalier moyen des allocations d'insertion.Conformément à l'article 133, le stagiaire est obligé, d'introduire une demande d'allocations par le biais de son organisme de paiement, au début du stage et d'introduire un dossier qui contient un exemplaire du contrat visé au § 1er, alinéa 1er, 7°. La demande doit parvenir au bureau du chômage dans un délai de quatre mois qui suit le mois dans lequel le stage prend cours.Si le stagiaire a droit aux allocations d'insertion en application de l'article 36 et si le montant journalier de ces allocations d'insertion, fixé conformément à l'article 124, est supérieur au montant défini à l'alinéa 1er, alors, par dérogation à l'alinéa 1er, le stagiaire a droit à une allocation de stage dont le montant journalier est égal à celui de ces allocations d'insertion.L'allocation de stage due pour la partie du stage de transition qui précède le moment où le jeune travailleur satisfait le cas échéant aux conditions pour bénéficier d'une allocation d'insertion conformément à l'article 36, est assimilée à une allocation d'insertion pour l'application du présent arrêté, à l'exception des articles 38, § 1er, alinéa 1er, 1°, 42 et 138, 1° à 3°.L'allocation de stage due pour la partie du stage de transition située à partir du moment où le jeune travailleur satisfait aux conditions pour bénéficier d'une allocation d'insertion conformément à l'article 36, est assimilée à une allocation d'insertion pour l'application du présent arrêté.L'allocation de stage est accordée conformément au régime d'indemnisation prévu à l'article 100.Par dérogation aux articles 44, 45 et 46, 48, 49, 74bis, 109 et 130, une période de travail ou un revenu n'entraîne pas la diminution du nombre d'allocations ou la réduction du montant journalier de l'allocation.§ 5. Sans préjudice de l'alinéa 3, l'indemnité, visée au § 1er, alinéa 1er, 8°, est due uniquement pour les heures que le stagiaire passe effectivement dans l'entreprise, l'organisme, l'organisation ou le service du fournisseur de stage, dans le cadre de son stage de transition.Le ministre peut adapter annuellement le montant de l'indemnité visée au § 1er, alinéa 1er, 8°.Lorsque le stage de transition est arrêté prématurément et que le service compétent pour la formation professionnelle atteste que cet arrêt est insuffisamment justifié et est dû au fournisseur de stage, celui-ci doit payer au stagiaire, sur une base à temps plein, l'indemnité qu'il doit conformément au § 1er, alinéa 1er, 8°, pour la partie restante du stage d'insertion qui n'a pas été exécutée.
articleEN: Section 1. A jobseeker may be admitted to the right to receive internship allowances during the duration of the transition internship referred to in Section 2, if the following conditions are met simultaneously:
question: Qu'est-ce que le contrat d'insertion en Région wallonne ?
questionEN: What is the insertion contract in the Walloon Region?
answerLLM: Based on the provided legal article, there is no specific mention of an "insertion contract" in the Walloon Region. The article only discusses the conditions for a jobseeker to be admitted to the right to receive internship allowances during a transition internship. Therefore, I would not be able to provide an answer to the question using only this legal article. Additional information or legal articles would be needed to provide a detailed explanation of what an insertion contract is in the Walloon Region.
goldy: Before going further, be aware that the internship program known as the "stage d'insertion" in the Walloon Region is abolished as of January 1, 2019. The insertion contract is a form of employment aid for young people (as of July 1, 2017 in the Walloon Region). It is also abolished as of January 1, 2019. However, insertion contracts started before January 1, 2019 will continue. The insertion contract is a full-time employment contract carried out with an employer but paid by the National Employment Office (ONEM) in the form of a work allowance for a maximum of 12 months. To be eligible, one must meet several conditions. It must be a full-time employment contract, with a fixed or indefinite term, but for a minimum of 12 months. The young worker must be under 25 years of age at the start of the contract. The young worker must have been unemployed for at least 18 months prior to starting the insertion contract. The young worker has no professional experience (this contract aims to offer them a first professional experience). The young worker must reside in Belgium. The employer must be in the private sector (such as a non-profit organization, private enterprise, etc., but not the French Community, an educational institution, a public interest organization, etc.). If they meet the conditions, the young worker can apply for the work allowance from the ONEM. They are also entitled to guidance from the Forem. Special rules apply to the suspension of the employment contract or the work allowance, and for cumulating with other employment aids.

legal article: § 1er. La preuve de moyens de subsistance suffisants tels que prévus à l'article 60, § 3, alinéa 1er, 5°, est apportée en produisant un ou plusieurs des documents suivants:1° une attestation émanant soit d'une organisation internationale ou d'une autorité nationale, soit d'une communauté, d'une région, d'une province ou d'une commune, soit d'un établissement d'enseignement supérieur, précisant que le ressortissant d'un pays tiers bénéficie ou bénéficiera prochainement d'une bourse ou d'un prêt;2° un engagement de prise en charge souscrit par une personne physique, qui a la nationalité belge ou qui est un citoyen de l'Union bénéficiant d'un droit de séjour de plus de trois mois sur le territoire du Royaume ou d'un autre Etat membre de l'Union européenne ou qui est un ressortissant d'un pays tiers admis ou autorisé à séjourner sur le territoire du Royaume ou d'un autre Etat membre de l'Union européenne pour une durée illimitée ou qui est un membre de la famille jusqu'au troisième degré inclus, par lequel elle s'engage, vis-à-vis du ressortissant d'un pays tiers, de l'Etat belge et de tout centre public d'aide sociale, pour la durée du séjour projeté, prolongée de douze mois, à supporter les frais des soins de santé, d'hébergement, des études et de rapatriement du ressortissant du pays tiers à charge;3° tout autre moyen de preuve de moyens de subsistance suffisants.Le Roi fixe les conditions auxquelles doivent répondre l'attestation visée à l'alinéa 1er, 1°, l'engagement visé à l'alinéa 1er, 2°, et la personne qui souscrit cet engagement.§ 2. Le Roi détermine le montant minimum des moyens d'existence dont doit disposer le ressortissant d'un pays tiers.Dans le cadre de l'appréciation de ces moyens d'existence, il est notamment tenu compte des ressources provenant d'une subvention, d'une bourse, d'une indemnité ou de l'exercice légal et régulier d'une activité lucrative en dehors du temps qui doit normalement être consacré aux études.§ 3. L'examen visant à vérifier si le ressortissant d'un pays tiers dispose de ressources suffisantes est fondé sur un examen individuel du cas d'espèce .
articleEN: Section 1. Proof of sufficient means of subsistence as referred to in Article 60, Section 3, paragraph 1, 5°, shall be provided by producing one or more of the following documents: 1° a certificate issued by an international organization or a national authority, by a community, a region, a province or a commune, by an institution of higher education, stating that the third-country national is a beneficiary or will soon be a beneficiary of a scholarship or a loan;
question: Je suis étudiant en Belgique. Puis-je rester en Belgique à la fin de mes études ?
questionEN: I am a student in Belgium. May I stay in Belgium at the end of my studies?
answerLLM: Based on the information provided in the legal article, whether you may stay in Belgium at the end of your studies depends on whether you are able to provide proof of sufficient means of subsistence. According to the article, one way to provide this proof is by producing a certificate from an institution of higher education stating that you are a beneficiary or will soon be a beneficiary of a scholarship or a loan. If you are able to provide such a certificate, then you may be able to stay in Belgium after the end of your studies. However, if you are not able to provide such proof, then you may not be permitted to stay in Belgium. It is important to note that this is just one factor that may be considered when determining whether you can stay in Belgium, and there may be other requirements or factors that come into play. You may want to consult with a legal professional or the appropriate authorities in Belgium for more information.
goldy: Before going further, this question only concerns non-European students. At the end of your studies, you can no longer extend your residence permit as a student. If you wish to stay in Belgium, you can obtain a 12-month residence permit to look for a job or to create a business. The conditions to obtain this 1

legal article: Les arrérages de rentes perpétuelles et viagères;Ceux des pensions alimentaires;Les créances de frais extraordinaires visés à l'article 203bis, § 3;Les loyers des maisons, et le prix de ferme des biens ruraux;Les intérêts des sommes prêtées, et généralement tout ce qui est payable par année, ou à des termes périodiques plus courts,Se prescrivent par cinq ans.Les créances pour la fourniture de biens et de services via des réseaux de distribution d'eau, de gaz ou d'électricité ou la fourniture de services de communications électroniques ou de services de radiotransmission ou de radio- et télédiffusion via des réseaux de communications électroniques se prescrivent par cinq ans.
articleEN: The arrears of perpetual and life annuities; Those of maintenance allowances; The claims for extraordinary expenses referred to in Article 203bis, § 3; The rents of houses, and the price of farmland leases; The interests of loans, and generally all that which is payable yearly, or at periodic terms shorter than a year, Prescribe within five years. Claims for the supply of goods and services via networks of distribution of water, gas or electricity or the supply of electronic communication services or radio transmission or radio and television broadcasting services via electronic communication networks Prescribe within five years.
question: Après combien de temps ma facture d'eau est-elle prescrite à Bruxelles ?
questionEN: After how much time is my water bill prescribed in Brussels?
answerLLM: Based on the provided legal article, a water bill in Brussels prescribes, or becomes uncollectible, after a period of five years. This five-year prescription period applies to "the supply of goods and services via networks of distribution of water" as well as "rents of houses" and "the price of farmland leases," among other things. Therefore, if a water bill in Brussels remains unpaid for a period of five years, it will be prescribed, and the debt will no longer be enforceable through legal action.
goldy: Your water debt becomes prescribed after a delay of 5 years. The delay begins to run out at the payment due date indicated on the invoice (generally 5 to 15 days after the previous month's consumption). However, be aware that the prescription may be suspended or interrupted. For more information, see "Can I invoke prescription to not pay my debt?".

legal article: Pour pouvoir bénéficier du droit à l'intégration sociale, la personne doit simultanément et sans préjudice des conditions spécifiques prévues par cette loi :1° avoir sa résidence effective en Belgique, dans le sens à déterminer par le Roi;2° être majeure ou assimilée à une personne majeure en application des dispositions de la présente loi;3° appartenir à une des catégories de personnes suivantes :- soit posséder la nationalité belge;- soit bénéficier, en tant que citoyen de l'Union européenne ou en tant que membre de sa famille qui l'accompagne ou le rejoint, d'un droit de séjour de plus de trois mois conformément à la loi du 15 décembre 1980 sur l'accès au territoire, le séjour, l'établissement et l'éloignement des étrangers. Cette catégorie de personnes ne bénéficie du droit à l'intégration sociale qu'après les trois premiers mois de ce séjour;- soit être inscrite comme étranger au registre de la population;- soit être un apatride et tomber sous l'application de la Convention relative au statut des apatrides, signée à New-York le 28 septembre 1954 et approuvée par la loi du 12 mai 1960;- soit être un réfugié au sens de l'article 49 de la loi du 15 décembre 1980 sur l'accès au territoire, le séjour, l'établissement et l'éloignement des étrangers;soit bénéficier de la protection subsidiaire au sens de l'article 49/2 de la loi du 15 décembre 1980 sur l'accès au territoire, le séjour, l'établissement et l'éloignement des étrangers;4° ne pas disposer de ressources suffisantes, ni pouvoir y prétendre ni être en mesure de se les procurer, soit par ses efforts personnels, soit par d'autres moyens. Le centre calcule les ressources de la personne conformément aux dispositions du titre II, chapitre II;5° être disposée à travailler, à moins que des raisons de santé ou d'équité l'en empêchent.6° faire valoir ses droits aux prestations dont elle peut bénéficier en vertu de la législation sociale belge et étrangère.

question: Je suis réfugié reconnu ou j'ai obtenu le statut de protection subsidiaire, ai-je droit au RIS ?
questionEN: I am a recognized refugee or I have been granted subsidiary protection status, do I have the right to RSA?
answerLLM:
Based on the provided legal article, in order to have the right to social integration (RSA in Belgium is a form of social integration), a person must meet the following conditions:

1. Have effective residence in Belgium, as determined by the King.
2. Be of legal age or be assimilated to a person of legal age in accordance with the provisions of the law.
3. Belong to one of the categories of persons specified by the law.

The law does not explicitly mention refugees or those granted subsidiary protection status as categories of persons who have the right to social integration. Therefore, it is not possible to definitively answer this question without referring to additional laws or regulations that specifically address the rights of refugees and those granted subsidiary protection status in Belgium. It is recommended to consult with a legal expert or authority for a more accurate answer.
goldy: Yes. Recognized refugees and foreigners who have obtained subsidiary protection status have the right to the social integration income (RIS). Attention: applicants for international protection, who are waiting for the recognition of their status do not have the right to the RIS. During the procedure, they can have the right to material aid (organized by Fedasil). For more information, see the Fedasil website. Recognized refugees generally have a registration certificate: card A valid for 5 years. Persons who have obtained international protection status have a card A for 1 year, renewable. For more information, see the "Foreigners and social aid" section.

question: Le CPAS peut-il me demander de trouver du travail pour avoir droit à l'aide sociale ?
questionEN: Can the Public Center for Social Welfare (CPAS) ask me to look for work in order to be entitled to social assistance?
answerLLM: Based on the provided legal article, the Public Center for Social Welfare (CPAS) cannot ask you to look for work in order to be entitled to social assistance. The article only states the general conditions to benefit from the right to social integration, which include having effective residence in Belgium, being of legal age or being assimilated to a person of legal age, and belonging to one of the categories of persons listed in the law. It does not include any requirement to look for work. Therefore, the decision to ask for proof of job search would likely depend on the specific laws and regulations in your jurisdiction. It is recommended to consult with a legal professional for advice tailored to your situation.
goldy: Only if you request financial assistance. For all other types of aid, the Public Center for Social Welfare (CPAS) cannot ask you to prove that you are willing to work. If you request social assistance of a financial nature, the CPAS can therefore ask you to prove that you are actively looking for work (similar to the conditions for social integration income (RIS)). This condition is optional: the CPAS is not obliged to ask you to prove your willingness to work. It can grant you financial assistance without requiring you to prove your willingness to work. Exception: if you are unable to work for health or equity reasons, the CPAS cannot ask you to prove your willingness to work. Examples of health reasons include: a physically demanding job cannot be considered for a woman several months pregnant or with medically proven back problems. Equity reasons are reasons that justify why, in the circumstances in which you find yourself, it would not be "fair" or "just" to ask you to work. For example, a single mother with several young or disabled children, living in a remote rural area far from means of communication for getting to work and a daycare center.

legal article: § 1er. Les allocations visées à l'article 1er sont accordées sur demande.Le Roi détermine comment, par qui, à partir de quand et de quelle manière la demande est introduite, ainsi que la date de prise de cours de la décision.Chaque demande d'allocation de remplacement de revenus vaut comme demande d'allocation d'intégration et inversement.La demande d'allocation d'intégration ou d'allocation de remplacement de revenus introduite par une personne qui a atteint l'âge de 65 ans au moment de l'introduction de la demande, est considérée comme une demande d'allocation pour l'aide aux personnes âgées.Le Roi peut déterminer les cas dans lesquels une demande introduite en vue d'obtenir une prestation sociale du régime de la sécurité sociale ou de l'assistance sociale vaut comme demande d'obtention d'une allocation visée à l'article 1.§ 1erbis. Lorsque la personne résidant en Belgique perd le droit aux allocations familiales majorées pour les enfants présentant une affection parce qu'elle a atteint la limite d'âge prévue par la réglementation, ses droits aux allocations visées à l'article 1er sont examinés d'office avec effet au premier jour du mois qui suit celui au cours duquel cette limite d'âge est atteinte.Le Roi détermine les cas dans lesquels les allocations visées à l'article 1er, sont examinées d'office.Le Roi fixe les modalités d'application de l'alinéa 1er.§ 2. Le Roi détermine dans quels cas une nouvelle demande peut être introduite.Le Roi détermine comment, par qui et de quelle manière la nouvelle demande est introduite, ainsi que la date de prise de cours de la décision.§ 3. Le recours auprès du tribunal compétent contre une décision d'octroi, de révision ou de refus d'une allocation visée à l'article 1er vaut comme nouvelle demande au sens du § 2 s'il est déclaré irrecevable.§ 4. Le Roi détermine dans quels cas une nouvelle décision peut être prise. Il détermine également la date de prise de cours de la nouvelle décision.§ 5. Le Roi détermine dans quels cas une décision peut être rapportée.
articleEN: Article 1: The benefits referred to in Article 1 are granted upon request. The King determines the manner, by whom, from when, and how the request is submitted, as well as the effective date of the decision. Each application for integration allowance is considered as an application for income replacement allowance and vice versa. An application for integration allowance or income replacement allowance submitted by a person who has reached the age of 65 at the time of submission is considered as an application for assistance allowance. The King may determine the cases in which an application submitted to obtain a social benefit from the social security or social assistance scheme is considered as an application for an allowance referred to in Article 1.
question: Où dois-je introduire ma demande d'allocation de remplacement de revenus (ARR) ?
questionEN: Where should I introduce my application for Disability Living Allowance (ARR)?
answerLLM:
Based on the provided legal article, you should introduce your application for Disability Living Allowance (ARR) in the manner determined by the King. The article states that the King determines how requests for benefits, including those for integration allowance, income replacement allowance, and assistance allowance, are submitted. Therefore, it is important to follow the specific procedures and guidelines established for applying for Disability Living Allowance in your jurisdiction.

Additionally, the article notes that an application for integration allowance or income replacement allowance submitted by a person who has reached the age of 65 at the time of submission is considered as an application for assistance allowance. Therefore, if you are over 65 years old and applying for Disability Living Allowance, your application may be treated as an application for a different type of allowance.

Overall, it is important to carefully follow the procedures and requirements for applying for Disability Living Allowance in your jurisdiction, as established by the relevant authorities.
goldy: You must submit your application for Disability Replacement Income (ARR) on the website of the Directorate-general for Disabled Persons (DGPH). You must log in to "My Handicap for citizens" with your identity card and your identity card reader, Itsme, etc. The ARR application is made at the same time as the application for Integration Allowance (AI). You only need to submit one application for these 2 allowances. If you need help with submitting your application, you can contact: your commune; your health insurance fund; your Public Centre for Social Welfare (CPAS); a relative; a social worker from the DGPH by making an appointment. Your social worker from the CPAS, health insurance fund or commune can log in to "My Handicap for professionals" with their identity card and identity card reader to submit your application on your behalf. For more information, see the DGPH website.

legal article: § 1er.Lorsque les père et mère ne vivent pas ensemble, l'exercice de l'autorité parentale reste conjoint et la présomption prévue à l'article 373, alinéa 2, s'applique. A défaut d'accord sur l'organisation de l'hébergement de l'enfant, sur les décisions importantes concernant sa santé, son éducation, sa formation, ses loisirs et sur l'orientation religieuse ou philosophique ou si cet accord lui paraît contraire à l'intérêt de l'enfant, le tribunal de la famillecompétent peut confier l'exercice exclusif de l'autorité parentale à l'un des père et mère.Il peut aussi fixer les décisions d'éducation qui ne pourront être prises que moyennant le consentement des père et mère.Il fixe les modalités selon lesquelles celui qui n'exerce pas l'autorité parentale maintient des relations personnelles avec l'enfant. Ces relations ne peuvent être refusées que pour des motifs très graves. Celui qui n'exerce pas l'autorité conserve le droit de surveiller l'éducation de l'enfant. Il pourra obtenir, de l'autre parent ou tiers, toutes informations utiles à cet égard et s'adresser au tribunal de la familledans l'intérêt de l'enfant.Dans tous les cas, le juge détermine les modalités d'hébergement de l'enfant et le lieu où il est inscrit à titre principal dans les registres de la population.§ 2. Lorsque les parents ne vivent pas ensemble et qu'ils saisissent le tribunal de la famillede leur litige, l'accord relatif à l'hébergement des enfants est homologué par le tribunal sauf s'il est manifestement contraire à l'intérêt de l'enfant.A défaut d'accord, en cas d'autorité parentale conjointe, le tribunal examine prioritairement, à la demande d'un des parents au moins, la possibilité de fixer l'hébergement de l'enfant de manière égalitaire entre ses parents.Toutefois, si le tribunal estime que l'hébergement égalitaire n'est pas la formule la plus appropriée, il peut décider de fixer un hébergement non-égalitaire.Lorsque les parents ont plusieurs enfants, le tribunal tend vers l'adoption d'un même régime pour tous les frères et soeurs. Le cas échéant, le tribunal précise la manière dont les frères et soeurs entretiennent des relations personnelles entre eux.Le tribunal statue en tout état de cause par un jugement spécialement motivé, en tenant compte des circonstances concrètes de la cause et de l'intérêt des enfants et des parents.
articleEN: Section 1. When the father and mother do not live together, the joint exercise of parental authority remains in effect, and the presumption provided for in Article 373, paragraph 2, applies. In the absence of an agreement regarding the organization of the child's housing, important decisions concerning the child's health, education, training, leisure activities, and religious or philosophical orientation, or if such agreement appears to be contrary to the child's best interest, the competent family court may grant exclusive parental authority to either the father or the mother. The court may also set the education decisions that can only be made with the consent of both parents. The court determines the terms under which the parent not exercising parental authority maintains personal relationships with the child. These relationships cannot be refused except for serious reasons. The parent not exercising parental authority retains the right to monitor the child's education. They may obtain any useful information regarding this matter from the other parent or any third party and may approach the family court in the child's best interest. In all cases, the judge determines the child's housing arrangements and the place where the child is primarily registered in the population records.
question: Le juge choisit-il d'office l'hébergement égalitaire ?
questionEN: Does the judge choose equal shared custody automatically?
answerLLM:
Based on the provided legal article, the judge does not choose equal shared custody automatically. When the father and mother do not live together, joint exercise of parental authority remains in effect. However, in the absence of an agreement regarding the organization of the child's housing or if such agreement appears to be contrary to the child's best interest, the family court may grant exclusive parental authority to either the father or the mother.

The court determines the terms under which the parent not exercising parental authority maintains personal relationships with the child, and they retain the right to monitor the child's education. The judge determines the child's housing arrangements and the place where the child is primarily registered in the population records. Therefore, the judge has the authority to decide on the child's custody arrangements, but equal shared custody is not automatically granted.
goldy: No. The judge is not required to choose this type of accommodation in every case. However, if one of the parents requests equal shared custody, the judge must consider this possibility. If the judge decides that equal shared custody is not appropriate, they must explain why. There are many reasons for refusing equal shared custody, such as: a great geographical distance between the parents; the unavailability of one of the two parents (a serious imbalance is required not to penalize a parent who works); the presence of young children (special attention should be paid to infants); the child's opinion expressed during their hearing; proximity between a parent's home and the school; maintaining the sibling group; etc.

legal article: Régime légal de droit communA défaut de conventions particulières, les règles relatives au régime légal, établies au chapitre 3 du présent sous-titre, forment le droit commun.Si les époux n'ont pas choisi de régime matrimonial avant le mariage, le régime légal prend effet, nonobstant toute convention contraire, à la célébration du mariage.
articleEN: In the absence of specific agreements, the rules relating to the legal regime, established in Chapter 3 of this section, form the law of general application. If the spouses have not selected a matrimonial regime before the marriage, the legal regime takes effect, notwithstanding any contrary agreement, at the time of the marriage.
question: Je me marie. Quel type de régime matrimonial choisir ?
questionEN: I am getting married. What type of matrimonial regime to choose?
answerLLM:
Based on the information provided in the legal article, if you are getting married and do not make a specific agreement regarding the matrimonial regime before the marriage, then the legal regime outlined in Chapter 3 of the section will automatically apply to you and your spouse. This is known as the legal regime by default.

It is important to note that the legal regime may not be the best fit for every couple, as it may not take into account their specific needs and circumstances. Therefore, it is recommended that you consider selecting a matrimonial regime that suits your situation before getting married. This can be done through a prenuptial or postnuptial agreement.

In any case, it is advisable to consult with a legal professional to understand the implications of the different matrimonial regimes and to make an informed decision.
goldy: Generally, you have a choice between 2 types of matrimonial regimes: either community of property or separation of property. If you do not make a marriage contract, the community of property regime applies automatically. The choice of one or the other regime has different consequences, particularly in the event of divorce or the death of one of you. If you choose the community of property regime, your property and your spouse's property are distinguished into your personal property and your joint property. There are 3 separate estates. 1. Your personal property (or personal property): It includes, among other things, the property you own before marriage, property with a personal nature (personal memories, property intended for the exercise of your profession, etc.), property received or inherited before or during marriage, certain property acquired during marriage but with funds that belonged exclusively to you. 2. Your spouse's personal property: It includes, among other things, the property owned by your spouse before marriage, property with a personal nature, property received or inherited before or during marriage, certain property acquired during marriage but with funds that belonged exclusively to your spouse. 3. Your joint property: It belongs to both of you. It includes, among other things, your professional or rental income, property acquired together during marriage, property brought by one of you to the community (for example, the land that belonged to you on which you build a house together), all property for which neither of you can prove that it belongs to one or the other (presumption of community). Creditors of your common debts can, in principle, have themselves paid by using the assets of these 3 estates. Creditors of a personal debt, on the other hand, only have recourse against the personal property of the spouse who incurred the debt, and the income of that spouse (income that is nevertheless part of the common estate). If you choose the separation of property regime, your assets and your debts are separate. Each spouse thus remains solely the owner of the property acquired before or during the marriage, of their professional income, savings, etc. There are only 2 separate estates: yours and that of your spouse. But, you can acquire property together, as co-owners: you are then co-owners. Be careful, you are required to primarily allocate your income to the needs of the household. Debts are generally the responsibility of the spouse who incurred them. But debts are common if they were incurred by one of the spouses for the needs of the household, or for the education of the children. Except if they are excessive (for example, buying a small luxury car instead of a family car). For these 2 types of regimes, it is possible to specify certain rules in the marriage contract. There is no good or bad solution. Everything depends on your situation and the way you want to manage your estate. Do not hesitate to ask your notary for explanations.

legal article: § 1er. Si, indépendamment des sûretés prévues à l'article 20 du présent décret, le preneur donne pour assurer le respect de ses obligations, une des formes de garanties prévues à l'alinéa suivant, celle-ci ne peut excéder un montant équivalent à 2 ou 3 mois de loyer, selon la forme de la garantie locative.Les garanties mentionnées à l'alinéa précédent peuvent prendre au choix du preneur, trois formes : soit un compte individualisé ouvert au nom du preneur auprès d'une institution financière, soit une garantie bancaire qui permet au preneur de constituer progressivement la garantie, soit une garantie bancaire résultant d'un contrat-type entre un CPAS et une institution financière.Lorsque le preneur opte pour un compte individualisé, la garantie locative ne peut excéder un montant équivalent à 2 mois de loyer. Les intérêts produits sont capitalisés au profit du preneur et le bailleur acquiert un privilège sur l'actif du compte pour toute créance résultant de l'inexécution totale ou partielle des obligations du preneur.Lorsque le preneur opte pour une garantie bancaire qu'il s'engage à reconstituer totalement par mensualités constantes pendant la durée du contrat, avec un maximum de trois ans, celle-ci est d'un montant équivalent à trois mois de loyer maximum. L'institution financière devra être celle auprès de laquelle le preneur dispose, le cas échéant, du compte bancaire sur lequel sont versés ses revenus professionnels ou de remplacement. Si le preneur met fin au versement de ses revenus professionnels ou de remplacement dans l'institution en question, celle-ci est en droit de réclamer la reconstitution intégrale et immédiate de la garantie, sans préjudice de la possibilité de transférer celle-ci à une autre institution financière. Nonobstant la loi du 25 avril 2014 'relative au statut et au contrôle des établissements de crédit et des sociétés de bourse, une institution financière ne peut pas refuser cette garantie pour des raisons liées à l'état de solvabilité du locataire. Le livre VII, titre IV, chapitre Ier, du Code de droit économique n'est pas d'application. Le Gouvernement peut modaliser l'obligation de l'institution financière de constituer une garantie bancaire dans le cas où le candidat locataire est tenu, au moment de sa demande, par plus d'une autre obligation de reconstitution pour des garanties bancaires locatives octroyées antérieurement. Après une évaluation faite un an après l'entrée en vigueur de ce système, le Gouvernement pourra organiser une garantie publique pour couvrir les garanties octroyées par les institutions financières à certaines catégories de locataires qu'Il définit, selon les modalités de financement qu'Il définit. Le preneur ne devra aucun intérêt débiteur à l'institution financière, qui lui accordera des intérêts dès le jour de la constitution totale de la garantie. L'institution financière dispose des privilèges de droit commun vis-à-vis du preneur en cas de non-exécution de son obligation de constituer progressivement la garantie.Lorsque le preneur opte pour une garantie bancaire, d'un montant équivalent à trois mois de loyer maximum, résultant d'un contrat-type entre un CPAS et une institution financière, c'est le CPAS qui effectue la demande auprès de l'institution financière qui l'accorde au profit du bailleur.Le Gouvernement fixe le formulaire par lequel les institutions financières attesteront, vis-à-vis des bailleurs, que la garantie locative est octroyée, peu importe la manière dont cette garantie est constituée.§ 2. Lorsque le bailleur est en possession de la garantie et s'abstient de la placer de la manière prévue au paragraphe 1er, alinéa 3, il est tenu de payer au preneur des intérêts au taux moyen du marché financier sur le montant de la garantie, à partir de la remise de celle-ci.Ces intérêts sont capitalisés. Toutefois, à dater du jour où le preneur met en demeure le bailleur de satisfaire à l'obligation qui lui est imposée par le paragraphe 1er, alinéa 3, les intérêts dus sont les intérêts légaux sur le montant de la garantie.§ 3. Il ne peut être disposé du compte bancaire, tant en principal qu'en intérêts, ni de la garantie bancaire ni du compte sur lequel la reconstitution de la garantie s'est effectuée, qu'au profit de l'une ou l'autre des parties, moyennant production soit d'un accord écrit, établi au plus tôt à la fin du contrat de bail, soit d'une copie d'une décision judiciaire. Cette décision est exécutoire par provision, nonobstant opposition ou appel, et sans caution ni cantonnement.
articleEN: Article 1. In addition to the guarantees provided for in Article 20 of the present decree, if the tenant gives, to ensure the performance of his obligations, one of the forms of guarantees provided for in the following paragraph, such guarantee shall not exceed an amount equivalent to 2 or 3 months' rent, depending on the form of the rental guarantee. The guarantees mentioned in the preceding paragraph may take, at the tenant's choice, three forms: either an individualized account opened in the tenant's name with a signatory institution, or a bank guarantee that allows the tenant to progressively establish the guarantee, or a bank guarantee resulting from a standard contract between a public center for social welfare (CPAS) and a financial institution.
question: Y-a-t-il un montant maximum pour la garantie locative en Wallonie ?
questionEN: Is there a maximum amount for the rental guarantee in Wallonia?
answerLLM: Yes, there is a maximum amount for the rental guarantee in Wallonia. According to the provided legal article, the rental guarantee in Wallonia cannot exceed an amount equivalent to 2 or 3 months' rent, depending on the form of the rental guarantee. The three forms of rental guarantees that are allowed include an individualized account opened in the tenant's name with a signatory institution, a bank guarantee that allows the tenant to progressively establish the guarantee, or a bank guarantee resulting from a standard contract between a public center for social welfare (CPAS) and a financial institution.
goldy: The entirety depends on whether your lease is a primary residence lease or not. Hypothesis 1: your lease is a primary residence lease

legal article: Réparations et entretien§ 1er. Le preneur est tenu des réparations locatives, à l'exception de celles qui sont occasionnées par la vétusté ou la force majeure, et des travaux de menu entretien.Les réparations locatives et de menu entretien sont celles désignées comme telles par l'usage des lieux.§ 2. Le bailleur est tenu de toutes les autres réparations qui peuvent devenir nécessaires.§ 3. Le Gouvernement établit une liste non limitative des réparations et travaux d'entretien impérativement à charge du preneur ou impérativement à charge du bailleur.
articleEN: Article on Repairs and Maintenance:
question: Qui doit payer les réparations des dégâts causés par un vol avec effraction à Bruxelles ?
questionEN: Who is responsible for paying for the repairs of damages caused by a burglary in Brussels?
answerLLM: I'm glad to help! However, I need the actual text of the "Article on Repairs and Maintenance" to provide an accurate answer to your question. Without the specific content of the article, I can't refer to any relevant law or regulation that addresses the responsibility for paying for repairs of damages caused by a burglary in Brussels. Therefore, I would kindly ask you to provide the relevant law article for me to answer your question.
goldy: This fact sheet has not been updated in over a year. As a tenant, you are generally responsible for repairing any damages to the rented property. However, this will not be the case if you can prove that the damages were caused by a force majeure. A burglary or attempted burglary constitutes a force majeure. This has been decided by judges on several occasions. Therefore, damages to the building caused by a burglary are not the responsibility of the tenant, but rather the responsibility of the landlord. Exception: the tenant is responsible for paying for repairs due to a burglary if they have committed a fault/negligence, for example, if they did not properly lock the entrance door. In order for the repairs to be the responsibility of the landlord, you must prove that: the damages were the result of a break-in or attempted break-in; and you have committed no fault or negligence. You can prove that there was a burglary by any means, but ideally by a report established by the police. If you do not file a complaint, it will be more difficult for you to prove that the damages were caused by a burglary. It could also be argued that you have not allowed the landlord to take action against the responsible party and obtain reimbursement for the repairs.

legal article: L'action des prestataires de soins pour les prestations, biens et services médicaux qu'ils ont fournis, y compris l'action pour frais supplémentaires, se prescrit vis-à-vis du patient par deux ans à compter de la fin du moi au cours duquel ils ont été fournis.Il en va de même en ce qui concerne les prestations, services et biens médicaux et les frais supplémentaires qui ont été fournis ou facturés par l'établissement de soins ou par des tiers.
articleEN: The action by healthcare providers for reimbursement of medical services, goods, and products provided, including for additional fees, expires vis-à-vis the patient two years after the end of the month in which they were provided. The same applies to medical services, goods, and products, as well as additional fees, provided or billed by the healthcare facility or by third parties.
question: Après combien de temps ma facture d'hôpital est-elle prescrite ?
questionEN: After how much time is my hospital bill prescribed?
answerLLM: Based on the provided legal article, a hospital bill for medical services, goods, or products provided by a healthcare facility is prescribed (or no longer collectible) after two years have passed from the end of the month in which the services were provided. This means that the hospital would have two years and one month from the date the services were provided to take action for reimbursement before the bill is prescribed.
goldy: For the payment of health care costs (including ambulance transport fees), the prescription period is very short: 2 years starting from the end of the month in which the health care was provided. After 2 years, the health care creditor can no longer demand payment. It is said that the prescription is extinguishing, which means that you are released from payment by the mere lapse of time. However, be careful, the prescription can be suspended or interrupted. For more information, see "When can I invoke prescription not to pay my debt?"

legal article: Les mandats, accordés par l'Ordre national des Avocats de Belgique dans des commissions et associations créées par la loi, sont maintenus et sont censés être des mandats communs à l'Ordre des Barreaux francophones et germanophone et à l'Orde van Vlaamse Balies jusqu'à ce qu'elles désignent leurs propres représentants, conformément à leurs propres règlements et aux dispositions légales.
articleEN: The mandates, granted by the National Order of Belgian Lawyers in various commissions and associations established by law, are maintained and are deemed to be common mandates for both the French-speaking and German-speaking Bar Association and the Order of Flemish Legal Practitioners until they designate their own representatives, in accordance with their own regulations and legal provisions.
question: J'ai droit à l'aide juridique, dois-je payer des frais de justice ?
questionEN: I am entitled to legal aid, do I have to pay court fees?
answerLLM: Based on the provided legal article, there is no information regarding legal aid or court fees. Therefore, it is not possible to accurately answer the question using only this article. You would need to refer to the specific laws or regulations related to legal aid and court fees in Belgium.
goldy: In principle, yes. However, you can request legal aid. Legal aid: If you are eligible for legal aid (help with attorney's fees), you generally meet the conditions for legal aid (help with court fees). In fact, the conditions are the same. If you are eligible for partially free legal aid, you generally qualify for partial legal aid. This means that you must pay a certain percentage of the court fees, which can represent a significant amount. Legal aid allows you to be exempted: from the costs of a legal procedure; or an extrajudicial procedure, such as mediation. To find out the costs covered by legal aid, see the question "Can I get help paying for legal costs?". To obtain legal aid, you must request it from the competent judge to rule on your dispute (usually, you must file a request with the court clerk). Be careful, the request for legal aid must be made before incurring the costs. You cannot incur the cost (for example, hire a bailiff) and then request reimbursement! Contribution to the legal aid fund: Each person who initiates a procedure must pay a flat fee of 24 EUR which goes to the legal aid fund. However, there are exceptions. If you benefit from legal aid, you do not have to pay this 24 EUR fee.

legal article: Si l'un des époux manque gravement à ses devoirs, le tribunal de la famille ordonne, à la demande du conjoint, les mesures urgentes conformément aux articles 1253ter/4 à 1253ter/6du Code judiciaire.Il en est de même à la demande d'un des époux, si l'entente entre eux est sérieusement perturbée.
articleEN: If one of the spouses seriously fails in their duties, the family court shall, at the request of the spouse, order urgent measures in accordance with articles 1253ter/4 to 1253ter/6 of the Judicial Code. The same applies at the request of one of the spouses if their relationship is seriously disrupted.
question: Je me sépare. Puis-je demander au tribunal de la famille la garde des enfants avant que le divorce soit prononcé ?
questionEN: I am separating. Can I ask the family court for child custody before the divorce is pronounced?
answerLLM: Based on the provided legal article, it seems that in order to request child custody before a divorce is pronounced, you would need to demonstrate to the family court that the circumstances meet the conditions for urgency as outlined in articles 1253ter/4 to 1253ter/6 of the Judicial Code. This might include situations where one spouse has seriously failed in their duties or where the spousal relationship is seriously disrupted. However, the specific requirements and procedures for seeking child custody in this context are not specified in the article you provided. Therefore, it would be best to consult with a legal professional who is familiar with family law in your jurisdiction to get advice tailored to your specific situation.
goldy: Yes. You can ask the family court judge to make all decisions regarding the children. The judge can, for example, make orders concerning: The children's living arrangements: for example, alternating living arrangements or primary residence with one of you, and the frequency of contact with the other parent. You can always propose a living arrangement solution to the judge. Parental authority of the children: for example, if you wish to make decisions regarding your children alone, or certain decisions, because you believe your spouse is unable to make them. Child support: financial contribution towards the children's upbringing and education expenses. Depending on each parent's income, the judge may require one spouse to pay child support to the other. You can request it when you initiate the proceedings. Note, at this stage, the family court judge's decision is a provisional one. The situation can be changed in the divorce judgment or in the divorce by mutual consent agreements.

legal article: La requête contient les nom, prénom 1et domicile des époux.La requête écrite est signée par le demandeur ou son avocat. Les articles 1034bis à 1034sexies sont applicables à la requête écrite.
articleEN: The application contains the name, first name, and address of the spouses. The written application is signed by the applicant or their attorney. Articles 1034bis to 1034sexies are applicable to the written application.
question: La situation a changé depuis le jugement, comment obtenir une nouvelle décision du juge de la famille ?
questionEN: How can one obtain a new decision from the family judge given that the situation has changed since the judgment?
answerLLM: Based on the information provided, in order to obtain a new decision from the family judge due to a change in situation since the judgment, one would need to file a new application with the court. According to the legal article, the application should include the names, first names, and addresses of both spouses, and be signed by the applicant or their attorney. Articles 1034bis to 1034sexies would also be applicable to this written application. It is important to note that the specific grounds and procedures for modifying a family court judgment may vary depending on the jurisdiction and the nature of the case, so it may be necessary to consult with a legal professional or research the relevant laws and regulations in your area.
goldy: If circumstances change, you can always go back in front of the family judge so that they can make a new decision. For the following matters, you can simply send a letter to the court clerk to reopen the case: separate residences, parental authority and housing of minor children, alimony obligations (contributions or alimony payments), and provisional measures. You must explain why the new circumstance modifies your situation or that of the child. For example, a loss of employment, a child starting higher education, a move, etc. You will be heard by the same judge. There is no specific document that needs to be attached to the request.

legal article: Le bourgmestre statue sur le rapport d'enquête dans les trois mois de sa réception, si l'enquête a été effectuée par un fonctionnaire ou un agent de l'administration, ou de sa réalisation, si l'enquête a été effectuée par un agent communal.Sauf urgence impérieuse, le bourgmestre est tenu d'entendre, lorsqu'ils ont été identifiés et s'ils le souhaitent, tout titulaire de droits réels sur l'habitation concernéepar le rapport d'enquête et, lorsque celle-ci est donnéeen location, le bailleur de l'habitation, ainsi que l'occupant éventuel. La procédure d'audition est fixée par le Gouvernement.Sans préjudice de l'article 201, le bourgmestre prend des mesures conservatoires, ordonne des travaux de réhabilitation, de restructuration, de démolition ou prononce l'interdiction d'occuper. S'il prononce l'interdiction d'occuper en vertu du présent Code ou de l'article 135, § 2, de la nouvelle loi communale et procède à l'expulsion de l'occupant, une proposition de relogement doit être offerte à ce dernier, lorsque le délai entre la décision d'interdiction d'occupation et la date prévue de l'expulsion ne permet pas aux occupants de retrouver une habitation, au plus tard au moment de l'expulsion, selon la procédure et dans les limites fixées à l'article 7bis.Par dérogation à l'alinéa précédent, en cas de situation d'urgence liée directement à la santé ou la sécurité des occupants, le bourgmestre peut s'écarter de la procédure visée à l'article 7bis.En cas d'inexécution des travaux par le titulaire de droits réels sur l'habitation, le bourgmestre procède à leur exécution. Tout titulaire de droits réels sur l'habitationet, lorsque celle-ci est donnéeen location, le bailleur est alors tenu au remboursement des frais exposés.Le bourgmestre informe le Gouvernement des mesures qu'il a prises.A défaut pour le bourgmestre de prendre sa décision dans le délai visé à l'alinéa 1er ou si les mesures imposées par lui paraissent insuffisantes, le Gouvernement peut se substituer au bourgmestre pour interdire l'accès ou l'occupation des habitationsfaisant l'objet de l'enquête.Si le Gouvernement prononce l'interdiction d'occuper et que le bourgmestre procède à l'expulsion de l'occupant, une proposition de relogement doit être offerte à ce dernier, lorsque le délai entre la décision d'interdiction d'occupation et la date prévue de l'expulsion ne permet pas aux occupants de retrouver une habitation, au plus tard au moment de l'expulsion, selon la procédure et dans les limites fixées à l'article 7bis.Il fixe les délais à respecter dans l'exécution de cette mesure.
articleEN: Article: The mayor makes a decision based on the investigation report within three months of receiving it, if the investigation was carried out by a civil servant or an administration agent, or from its completion if the investigation was carried out by a municipal agent. Unless there is an overriding urgency, the mayor must, if they have been identified and wish to be heard, hear any holder of real rights over the dwelling concerned by the investigation report, as well as the landlord of the dwelling and any occupant. The hearing procedure is set by the Government. Without prejudice to Article 201, the mayor takes provisional measures, orders rehabilitation, restructuring, demolition works, or orders the prohibition of occupation. If the mayor pronounces the prohibition of occupation under this Code or Article 135, § 2, of the new municipal law and proceeds with the eviction of the occupant, a relocation proposal must be offered to the latter if the delay between the prohibition of occupation decision and the scheduled eviction date does not allow the occupants to find alternative housing, no later than the time of eviction, according to the procedure and within the limits set out in Article 7bis. However, in case of an emergency related directly to the health or safety of the occupants, the mayor may deviate from the procedure provided in Article 7bis. If the owner fails to carry out the works, the mayor proceeds with their execution. The owner and, if the dwelling is leased, the landlord must then reimburse the expenses incurred. The mayor informs the Government of the measures taken. If the mayor fails to make a decision within the time limit set out in the first paragraph or if the measures imposed by them appear insufficient, the Government may replace the mayor to prohibit access to or occupation of the dwellings subject to the investigation. If the Government orders the prohibition of occupation and the mayor proceeds with the eviction of the occupant, a relocation proposal must be offered to the latter if the delay between the prohibition of occupation decision and the scheduled eviction date does not allow the occupants to find alternative housing, no later than the time of eviction, according to the procedure and within the limits set out in Article 7bis. The Government sets the deadlines for the execution of this measure.
question: Je pense que mon logement est insalubre. Je m'adresse au bourgmestre. Quelle est la mission du bourgmestre en matière d'insalubrité en Wallonie ?
questionEN: I think my housing is insalubrious. I am addressing the burgomaster. What is the mission of the burgomaster in terms of insalubrity in Wallonia?
answerLLM:
In Wallonia, the burgomaster (mayor) plays a crucial role in addressing insalubrious housing. Upon receiving an investigation report regarding insalubrity, the burgomaster is responsible for making a decision within three months. They must consider the input of any relevant parties, including holders of real rights, the landlord, and occupants, if they wish to be heard.

The burgomaster has the authority to take several measures to address insalubrity, such as ordering rehabilitation, restructuring, or demolition works. In cases where occupation poses a risk to the health or safety of the occupants, the burgomaster can prohibit occupation and, if necessary, proceed with eviction.

If an eviction is carried out, the burgomaster must offer a relocation proposal to the occupants if they do not have sufficient time to find alternative housing. This relocation proposal applies unless there is an emergency directly related to the health or safety of the occupants.

If the owner fails to carry out the necessary works, the burgomaster can execute the work and demand reimbursement from the owner and, if applicable, the landlord. The burgomaster must inform the Government of the measures taken.

If the burgomaster fails to make a decision within the specified time limit or if the measures taken are deemed insufficient, the Government can intervene and replace the burgomaster to prohibit access to or occupation of the dwellings in question. The Government will then follow the same procedure, including offering a relocation proposal if necessary. The Government sets the deadlines for the execution of these measures.
goldy: This sheet has been updated more than a year ago. 1) If the municipality is competent to establish a salubrity investigation (Walloon Region rules): Check the section "I am addressing the Walloon Region or the competent municipality to have a salubrity and overcrowding investigation carried out" To know the list of competent municipalities, see the Walloon Region's website. 2) If the municipality is not competent to establish a salubrity investigation The municipality's action is limited to housing problems related to hygiene, safety (for example, a ruined building) or public health in general. In this context, the concept of unhealthy housing concerns any house that seriously threatens to trigger contagious diseases and endangers not only the health of certain occupants, but public health in general. The mayor can, for example, issue an order against a housing infested by rats or dry rot. The mayor can therefore be directly contacted when a problem of this type arises. The law does not specify what types of measures he can take. He therefore has a wide margin of appreciation. One of the measures could be the realization of work by the municipality at the expense of the person responsible for the insalubrity, but other decisions such as eviction and demolition could also be taken.

legal article: L'administration et l'AWIPH transmettent, pour le 30 avril au plus tard, au secrétariat du Conseil wallon de l'Action sociale et de la Santé, des Commissions permanentes et de la Commission d'avis sur les recours les rapports relatifs aux plaintes de l'année civile précédente.Chaque commission permanente remet un avis en ce qui concerne les plaintes relevant de ses compétences.Le Conseil wallon de l'Action sociale et de la Santé analyse l'ensemble des avis des commissions permanentes et remet un avis global sur les plaintes traitées durant l'année civile précédente.
articleEN: The administration and the AWIPH (Walloon Agency for the Disabled) transmit, no later than April 30, to the secretariat of the Walloon Council for Social Action and Health, the Permanent Commissions and the Advisory Commission on Appeals, the reports relating to complaints of the previous civil year. Each Permanent Commission submits an opinion regarding the complaints falling within its competence. The Walloon Council for Social Action and Health analyzes all the opinions of the Permanent Commissions and submits a global opinion on the complaints dealt with during the previous civil year.
question: Comment le médecin évalue-t-il mon handicap pour l’allocation pour l’aide aux personnes âgées en Wallonie ?
questionEN: How does the doctor evaluate my disability for the allowance for aid to the elderly in Wallonia?
answerLLM:
Based on the provided legal article, it does not directly address how a doctor evaluates a disability for the allowance for aid to the elderly in Wallonia. The article discusses the reporting and review process for complaints related to the previous civil year by the administration, the Walloon Agency for the Disabled (AWIPH), and the Permanent Commissions.

However, in the context of the allowance for aid to the elderly, the evaluation of disability typically involves a medical assessment by a qualified healthcare professional, such as a doctor. The doctor would evaluate the individual's functional limitations and diagnose any medical conditions that contribute to the disability. The specific criteria and procedures for evaluating disability may vary and are likely outlined in separate regulations or guidelines.

Therefore, to answer your question, the evaluation of disability for the allowance for aid to the elderly in Wallonia is typically carried out by a doctor or other qualified healthcare professional, using medical expertise and assessment tools to determine the individual's functional limitations and eligibility for the allowance. It is recommended to consult the relevant regulations or guidelines for more detailed information on the evaluation process.
goldy: Your disability is evaluated by a doctor from your health insurance fund. The doctor evaluates your disability based on several elements. These include the reduced autonomy evaluation form you completed when you applied for the APA (Allowance for the Help of Elderly People), the medical questionnaire completed by your treating physician, and the medical examination. The doctor of your health insurance fund may call you for a medical examination and will ask you questions during the examination. It is important to be well prepared for the medical examination. You can find a list of questions in the sample documents provided to help you prepare for your medical examination. You can also find information on the AVIQ website in the FAQ section. Sometimes, the doctor may not call you for a medical examination and will make a decision based on your file. You can request a medical examination. The doctor of your health insurance fund evaluates your reduced autonomy based on your difficulties with: moving around; eating and preparing meals; taking a bath and getting dressed; maintaining your home and doing household chores; assessing and avoiding dangers (living without supervision); communicating and interacting with others. For each criterion, the doctor will assign a certain number of points: 0 points: no loss of autonomy, you can do it alone; 1 point: slight loss of autonomy; 2 points: significant loss of autonomy; 3 points: total loss of autonomy, impossible to do without the help of another person. The total number of points obtained for the 6 criteria must be at least 7 points to be eligible for the disability allowance. Depending on the number of points you have obtained, you will be classified in one of 5 categories. If you have: 7-8 points, you are in category 1; 9-11 points, you are in category 2; 12-14 points, you are in category 3; 15-16 points, you are in category 4; 17-18 points, you are in category 5. For more information, please visit the AVIQ website.

question: Dois-je avertir le service APA de ma mutuelle si ma situation financière ou familiale change en Wallonie ?
questionEN: Should I notify the APA service of my mutual insurance company if my financial or family situation changes in Wallonia?
answerLLM:
Based on the provided legal article, it does not appear to directly address the issue of notifying the APA service of a mutual insurance company regarding changes in one's financial or family situation in Wallonia.

However, it is generally a good practice to notify one's insurance company of any changes in one's financial or family situation that may affect their insurance coverage. This is because such changes could potentially impact the individual's eligibility for certain benefits or services, or result in a need to adjust their insurance coverage.

Therefore, while the legal article does not specifically require notification of the APA service of a mutual insurance company in the event of changes in one's financial or family situation, it is still recommended to do so in order to ensure that one's insurance coverage remains appropriate and up-to-date.
goldy: Yes. You must notify the APA service of your health insurance of any changes that could modify the amount of your aid to elderly persons (APA). For example: your income increases; your income decreases; the nature of your income changes: you were receiving employment income and now you are receiving replacement income; a new person comes to live with you; etc. Depending on the change, you must notify the APA service of your health insurance in different ways. Your income or that of your spouse decreases. You can submit a new application for APA through the Walloon social security platform (Wal-protect). Your income or that of your spouse increases. If your income or that of your spouse increases by at least 10%, you must notify the APA service of your health insurance. You must notify it no later than 3 months after the change. You must: log in to the Walloon social security platform (Wal-protect); click on the "report a change" button. Your family situation changes. If your family situation changes, you must notify the APA service of your health insurance. You must notify it no later than 3 months after the change. What changes do you need to report? You enter or leave prison or an institution of social defense. You stay in an establishment (for example, nursing home, service flats, protected housing, etc.) or leave this establishment. You no longer receive family allowances for the child living with you. You no longer pay or receive child support for the child living with you. You leave Belgium. You must: log in to the Walloon social security platform (Wal-protect); click on the "report a change" button. If you have already notified your commune, you do not need to notify the APA service of your health insurance in case of change of: name; first name; place and date of birth; sex; nationality; main residence; place and date of death; marital status (marriage, divorce, etc.); household composition. The APA service of your health insurance is informed automatically. For more information, see the FAQ on the AVIQ website.

legal article: § 1er. Le preneur répond de l'incendie, à moins qu'il ne prouve que celui-ci s'est déclaré sans sa faute.§ 2. La responsabilité du preneur visée au paragraphe 1er est couverte par une assurance.Sauf si les parties en conviennent autrement, le preneur contracte cette assurance préalablement à l'entrée dans les lieux. Il apporte la preuve du paiement des primes annuellement. Si le preneur reste en défaut d'apporter la preuve du paiement des primes dans le mois suivant l'entrée dans les lieux ou, ultérieurement, dans le mois suivant la date anniversaire de l'entrée dans les lieux, le bailleur peut solliciter auprès de son organisme assureur assurant l'habitation d'ajouter, au profit du preneur, une clause d'abandon de recours à son contrat d'assurance " habitation ". Dans ce cas, il peut en répercuter le coût au preneur. La franchise peut être laissée à charge du preneur si sa responsabilité est engagée.
articleEN: Section 1. The tenant is liable for any fire, unless they can prove that it started without their fault.
question: Je suis propriétaire. Mon assurance peut-elle couvrir mes locataires en Wallonie ?
questionEN: I am a property owner. Can my insurance cover my tenants in Wallonia?
answerLLM: Based on the information provided in the legal article, it does not appear that a property owner's insurance in Wallonia would typically cover the tenants. The article states that the tenant is liable for any fire, unless they can prove that it started without their fault. This suggests that the tenant is responsible for their own insurance coverage for damages caused by fire. It would be best for the tenant to have their own insurance policy to cover their personal belongings and any liability they may have for damages to the property. It is always a good idea to consult with a legal professional or insurance expert for specific advice regarding your situation.
goldy: Yes. For leases signed before September 1, 2018, you could agree with your tenant that: the tenant would be responsible for taking out a fire insurance policy to cover their liability, or; you included an "waiver of recourse" clause in your insurance contract and lease. For leases signed on or after September 1, 2018, tenants must take out a fire insurance policy for the rental unit. However, there is an exception: if you and your tenant agree otherwise in the lease. You can agree that you waive the right to pursue the tenant in case of a fire in the rental unit. You must then include an "abandon of recourse" clause in your insurance contract. Be careful, if the lease provides that you waive pursuing the tenant in case of fire, you must actually do so. However, the tenant's furniture and liability towards third parties are not covered. If they wish to insure the contents of the rental unit and their liability towards third parties, they must take out a policy. If you decide to include an "abandon of recourse" clause in your insurance policy, it may require you to pay an additional fee. You can therefore include in the lease that this additional fee will be paid by the tenant. As a landlord, you may be interested in including an "abandon of recourse" clause when: the tenant has low income or is not very solvent; the tenant does not take out fire insurance.

legal article: § 1er. Sans préjudice des articles 34, § 4, et 36 du décret du 28 novembre 2013 relatif à la performance énergétique des bâtiments et des sanctions qui sont attachées à la violation de ces dispositions, toute communication publique ou officielle de mise en location contient à tout le moins :1° le montant du loyer hors charges;2° le caractère forfaitaire ou provisionnel des charges privatives et communes éventuelles;3° le montant et la nature des charges communes éventuelles;4° le montant et la nature des charges privatives si celles-ci ont un caractère forfaitaire.§ 2. Tout non-respect par le bailleur ou son mandataire des obligations visées au paragraphe 1er peut entraîner le paiement d'une amende administrative fixée entre 50 euros et 200 euros.Les communes, en tant qu'autorité décentralisée, peuvent constater, poursuivre et sanctionner les manquements aux obligations du présent article. La commune compétente est celle où le bien est situé. Ces manquements sont constatés, poursuivis et sanctionnés selon les formes, délais et procédures visés aux articles 6, 7, 20, 21, § § 1er et 3, 25, 26, § § 1er et 3, 27 alinéas 1er et 4, 30, 31, 33 alinéa 1er, 43 et 44 de la loi du 24 juin 2013 relative aux sanctions administratives communales.
articleEN: Article 1. Without prejudice to the provisions of Articles 34, § 4, and 36 of the Decree of November 28, 2013, relating to the energy performance of buildings and the sanctions attached to the violation of these provisions, any public or official communication relating to the rental of a property must contain at least the following information:
question: Je mets un appartement ou une maison en location (bail de résidence principale). Dois-je indiquer le montant du loyer dans l'annonce en Wallonie ?
questionEN: When putting an apartment or house up for rent (main residence lease), should I indicate the rent amount in the advertisement in Wallonia?
answerLLM: Based on the provided legal article, there is no explicit mention of whether the rent amount should be indicated in the advertisement for a main residence lease in Wallonia. The article only states that the advertisement must contain certain information, such as energy performance details, but it does not include the rent amount. However, it is always a good practice to include all relevant information, including the rent amount, in the advertisement to avoid any confusion or misunderstandings with potential tenants. It is also recommended to consult with a local legal expert or authority to ensure compliance with all relevant laws and regulations.
goldy: Yes. In principle, any owner who puts a housing property up for rent is required to include in all public or official communications (newspapers, website, poster, etc.): The amount of rent excluding charges; The nature of private and communal charges (as a flat rate or advance payments); The amount of any communal charges; The amount of private charges if they are a flat rate; Certain indicators from the energy performance certificate such as: the unique identification code (PEB certificate number); the total annual primary energy consumption in kWh; the specific primary energy consumption, in kWh per m2/year and the energy class or label (for more information, see the energy plus website). However, it is up to the communes to define the scope of this obligation. If you do not comply with this obligation, you could have to pay an administrative fine of 50 to 200€. The communes have the power to detect, pursue and penalize non-compliance with this provision. Unfortunately, in practice, communes rarely pursue these offenses. Some have not even adopted a regulation on this matter. Therefore, in the absence of a municipal regulation, you will not be penalized if you do not fulfill your obligation. Make sure to inquire with your commune to find out what the applicable sanctions are in your commune. Furthermore, in the landlord-tenant relationship, this provision aims to protect the tenant against discrimination. You are therefore required to respect the announced amounts and cannot modify them if the candidate is not to your liking. If you do not respect this, the tenant can request compensation for any prejudice suffered before the justice of the peace. The center for equality of opportunities and the fight against racism can also be contacted on this matter.

legal article: § 1er. Le juge vérifie la demande.§ 2. Il convoque d'office le requérant lorsqu'il fait la demande d'être entendu.Il ne peut ordonner une mesure affectant la capacité de la personne protégée ou à protéger au sens de l'article 491, e, du Code civil, sans l'avoir convoquée au préalable, à moins qu'elle soit dans l'impossibilité de se déplacer.Il peut, en outre, convoquer les personnes visées aux alinéas 1er et 2, le mandataire, le ou les administrateurs, la personne de confiance et les personnes mentionnées à l'article 1240, § 1er, 4°, même si elles ne vivent pas avec la personne protégée ou à protéger, chaque fois qu'il l'estime utile. Ces personnes peuvent également comparaître volontairement à l'audience.Les convocations sont notifiées par le greffier. Une copie de la requête ainsi que, le cas échéant, une copie de la déclaration visée à l'article 496 du Code civil sont jointes aux convocations.Les personnes convoquées et celles qui ont comparu volontairement conformément à l'alinéa 3 deviennent des parties à la cause sauf si elles s'y opposent à l'audience. Elles en sont avisées dans la convocation ou, à défaut, à l'audience.
articleEN: Section 1. The judge verifies the application.
question: Qui peut être entendu par le juge de paix lors de la procédure de mise sous administration de biens et/ou de la personne ?
questionEN: Who can be heard by the justice of the peace during the procedure of administration of assets and/or of the person?
answerLLM: Based on the provided legal article, Section 1 regarding the verification of the application by the judge, it is not explicitly specified in this section who can be heard by the justice of the peace during the procedure of administration of assets and/or of the person. The section primarily focuses on the judge's role in verifying the application. Therefore, to answer this question fully, additional information or sections from the legal text or other relevant sources would be required. It is recommended to consult the complete legal document or seek advice from a legal professional to get a more accurate and comprehensive answer.
goldy: After the filing of a petition for the placement under administration of goods and/or of the person, the justice of the peace always summons: the person to be protected; the person who filed the petition (the petitioner). He also summons, if they live with the person to be protected: the father and mother of the person to be protected; the spouse/legal cohabitant/partner of the person to be protected; the adult children of the person to be protected. Other family members may request to be heard. They can also write to the justice of the peace to express their observations. The person to be protected may request to be heard individually by the justice of the peace before the day of the hearing. In order to pronounce the most appropriate measure of protection for the situation of the person to be protected, the justice of the peace may also summon any person whom he deems able to inform him. He may, for example, summon the persons in charge of daily care, or who accompany the person to be protected. A nurse, a social worker, a close neighbor, or a family assistant could be heard by the justice of the peace as part of this procedure.
