You should contact a social assistant from the DGPH for more information. See the DGPH's website for more details.

legal article: § 1er. Les allocations familiales sont accordées en faveur de l'enfant jusqu'au 31 août de l'année civile au cours de laquelle il atteint l'âge de 18 ans.§ 2. Au-delà de la date fixée par le paragraphe 1er, les allocations familiales sont accordées, aux conditions fixées par le Collège réuni, jusqu'à l'âge de 25 ans en faveur :a de l'apprenti. Le Collège réuni peut également déterminer les périodes et les conditions d'octroi du droit aux allocations familiales en faveur de l'enfant, lorsque le contrat ou l'engagement d'apprentissage est rompu ou fait l'objet d'un refus ou d'un retrait d'agréation ;b de l'enfant qui suit des cours, effectue un stage pour pouvoir être nommé à une charge ou est engagé dans une formation pour laquelle des crédits sont octroyés dans le système " bachelier-master " et pour laquelle aucun cours ne doit être suivi. Le Collège réuni détermine les formations à prendre en considération ;c de l'enfant âgé de moins de 25 ans qui prépare régulièrement un mémoire de fin d'études supérieures ;d de l'enfant n'étant plus soumis à l'obligation scolaire, inscrit comme demandeur d'emploi et qui a terminé des études ou un apprentissage.Le Collège réuni détermine, parmi les conditions qu'il fixe, les activités lucratives qui font obstacle au droit, sous réserve de ce que :a le volontariat au sens de la loi du 3 juillet 2005 relative aux droits des volontaires n'est pas considéré comme une activité lucrative. Les indemnités au sens de l'article 10 de la loi précitée ne sont pas considérées comme un revenu, un bénéfice, une rémunération brute ou une prestation sociale, pour autant que le volontariat ne perde pas son caractère non rémunéré conformément au même article de la même loi ;b l'exercice d'un service volontaire d'utilité collective au sens de la loi du 11 avril 2003 instituant un service volontaire d'utilité collective n'est pas considéré comme une activité lucrative. La solde au sens de l'article 5, § 3, de la loi précitée n'est pas considérée comme un revenu, un bénéfice, une rémunération brute ou une prestation sociale ;c l'exercice d'un engagement volontaire militaire au sens de la loi du 10 janvier 2010 instituant l'engagement volontaire militaire et modifiant diverses lois applicables au personnel militaire, jusqu'au premier jour de la huitième semaine calendrier qui suit la semaine au cours de laquelle le militaire souscrit l'engagement visé à l'article 21, alinéa 2, de la loi précitée, n'est pas considéré comme une activité lucrative. Les avantages visés à l'article 50, alinéa 2, de la loi précitée ne sont pas considérés comme un revenu, un bénéfice, une rémunération brute ou une prestation sociale.§ 3. Le droit aux allocations familiales est prolongé en faveur de l'enfant disparu, conformément aux dispositions suivantes :1° par enfant disparu, il y a lieu d'entendre l'enfant qui a involontairement cessé d'être présent au lieu de sa résidence, dont on est sans nouvelles, sauf s'il apparaît que cet enfant est, selon toutes probabilités, décédé dans des circonstances telles que des accidents ou catastrophes, même si son corps n'a pas été retrouvé. La disparition peut être établie par toute voie de droit. N'est toutefois pas considéré comme disparu l'enfant enlevé par l'un de ses parents ;2° au moment de sa disparition, l'enfant doit avoir la qualité de bénéficiaire ;3° les allocations familiales sont accordées pendant cinq ans au maximum à partir du premier jour du mois qui suit le mois de la disparition de l'enfant aussi longtemps que celui-ci n'a pas atteint l'âge de 25 ans ou de 21 ans, s'il était bénéficiaire en vertu de l'article 26 ;4° le droit aux allocations familiales de l'enfant disparu s'éteint à la fin du mois au cours duquel il est retrouvé, à moins qu'il soit satisfait aux conditions des paragraphes 1er ou 2 ou de l'article 26.
articleEN: § 1. Family allowances are granted on behalf of the child until August 31 of the civil year during which he/she reaches the age of 18.
question: Mon enfant abandonne l'école. Vais-je perdre les allocations familiales à Bruxelles ?
questionEN: Is you child abandoning school causing the loss of family allowances in Brussels?
answerLLM:
Based on the provided legal article, family allowances in Brussels are granted until the end of the civil year in which a child reaches the age of 18. Therefore, if a child is abandoning school and losing family allowances before the child turns 18, it would not be due to the child's age or the provisions outlined in the given article.

However, it is possible that there are other laws or regulations in Brussels that govern the loss of family allowances due to a child abandoning school. Without further information, it is not possible to give a definitive answer to the question. It would be best to consult with a legal professional or the relevant government authorities for more specific guidance.
goldy: This depends on your child's age. 1. Your child is less than 18 years old If your child drops out of school, they will keep their family allowances until August 31 of the year they turn 18. Family allowances are owed without conditions until August 31 of the year your child turns 18. 2. Your child is between 18 and 25 years old If your child drops out of school, they will lose their family allowances starting the month following the end of their classes. However, they will keep their family allowances during the duration of their professional insertion training. This usually lasts 12 months. You must notify your family allowance fund that your child has registered as a job seeker. They must meet conditions to be entitled to family allowances during their professional insertion training. For more information, see our factsheet "Am I entitled to family allowances after my studies? (Brussels)". 3. Your child is over 25 years old Your child is no longer entitled to family allowances. For more information, see our section "Family allowances between 18 and 25 years old (Brussels)"; the Famiris website.

legal article: Le preneur :1° use de la chose louée en bon père de famille, et suivant la destination qui lui a été donnée par le bail, ou suivant celle présumée d'après les circonstances, à défaut de convention;2° paye le prix du bail aux termes et délais convenus.
articleEN: The tenant: 1° shall use the leased property in the manner of a good father of the family, and in accordance with the purpose for which it was leased to him by the lease, or in accordance with that which is presumed based on the circumstances, in the absence of an agreement to the contrary;
question: Mon propriétaire peut-il me réclamer des intérêts de retard en Wallonie ?
questionEN: Can my landlord claim late interest in Wallonia?
answerLLM: Based on the provided legal article, there is no mention of late interest for tenants in Wallonia. The article only states that the tenant shall use the leased property in a responsible manner and in accordance with the purpose for which it was leased. Therefore, it is unlikely that a landlord can claim late interest based solely on this article. However, it is possible that there may be other laws or provisions in the lease agreement that allow for the charging of late interest. It is recommended to consult the specific lease agreement or seek legal advice for a more accurate answer.
goldy: This fact sheet was last updated more than a year ago. 1/ If the lease agreement provides for late interest: Generally, late interest is owed automatically (that is, without a formal notice) and at a higher rate than the legal interest rate (see "The legal interest rate" in "Key Figures"). This clause is valid. However, the judge may consider it an abusive clause. This is the case when the interest rate is exorbitant (for example: 15 %). To verify the calculation of interest, visit the calculator of the Observatory of Credit and Over-indebtedness. In principle, interest should compensate for the loss suffered by the landlord. They cannot provide a benefit greater than the normal payment of rent. Jurisprudence often grants a reduction in the interest rate (up to the legal interest rate). 2/ If the lease agreement does not provide for late interest: Your landlord can claim it if they have sent you a formal notice and you have not responded. They can calculate the interest at the legal interest rate from the date of the formal notice.

legal article: § 1. Il peut être imposé à l'intéressé de faire valoir ses droits à l'égard des personnes qui lui doivent des aliments, ces dernières étant limitées à : son conjoint ou, le cas échéant, son ex-conjoint; les ascendants et descendants du premier degré, l'adoptant et l'adopté.§ 2. Les conventions relatives à une pension alimentaire ne sont pas opposables au centre.§ 3. Le centre peut agir de plein droit au nom et en faveur de l'intéressé afin de faire valoir les droits visés aux articles 3, 6°, et 4, § 1.
articleEN: Section 1. The person concerned may be required to assert his rights with regard to those who owe him alimony, such persons being limited to:
question: Puis-je demander au CPAS de ne pas faire appel à mes débiteurs alimentaires pour le RIS ?
questionEN: Can I ask the Public Center for Social Welfare (CPAS) not to contact my maintenance creditors for the Social Integration Income (RIS)?
answerLLM: Based on the information provided in the legal article, it does not appear that you can ask the Public Center for Social Welfare (CPAS) not to contact your maintenance creditors for the Social Integration Income (RIS). In fact, section 1 of the legal article suggests that the person concerned may be required to assert his rights with regard to those who owe him alimony, such as maintenance creditors. Therefore, it is possible that CPAS may need to contact your maintenance creditors as part of the process of determining your eligibility for RIS. However, for a more definitive answer, you may want to consult with a legal professional who is familiar with the specific laws and regulations applicable in your jurisdiction.
goldy: Yes. You can ask the Public Center for Social Welfare (CPAS) not to require you to request help from your maintenance creditors. The CPAS must verify if the recourse to your maintenance creditors is: materially possible, and appropriate given your family situation. The CPAS can therefore renounce the recourse to maintenance creditors in 2 cases. If the recourse to maintenance creditors is materially impossible, for example because they do not have the necessary resources to pay alimony. During the social investigation, the social worker examines the financial capacities of your maintenance creditors. They analyze their income and their charges. They must provide information about their income and generally also a copy of their last tax roll notice. If your maintenance creditors do not respond to this investigation, the social worker can consult the Crossroads Bank for Social Security. They will obtain useful information about the financial situation of your maintenance creditors through this means. If the recourse to maintenance creditors is unreasonable or inopportune, for example because it risks exacerbating a conflict, or breaking already very fragile family relationships. The CPAS evaluates each situation. They must provide the most appropriate help to individuals and families. They cannot therefore impose a recourse to maintenance creditors if it is a disproportionate encroachment on already very difficult family relationships.

legal article: Pour pouvoir bénéficier du droit à l'intégration sociale, la personne doit simultanément et sans préjudice des conditions spécifiques prévues par cette loi :1° avoir sa résidence effective en Belgique, dans le sens à déterminer par le Roi;2° être majeure ou assimilée à une personne majeure en application des dispositions de la présente loi;3° appartenir à une des catégories de personnes suivantes :- soit posséder la nationalité belge;- soit bénéficier, en tant que citoyen de l'Union européenne ou en tant que membre de sa famille qui l'accompagne ou le rejoint, d'un droit de séjour de plus de trois mois conformément à la loi du 15 décembre 1980 sur l'accès au territoire, le séjour, l'établissement et l'éloignement des étrangers. Cette catégorie de personnes ne bénéficie du droit à l'intégration sociale qu'après les trois premiers mois de ce séjour;- soit être inscrite comme étranger au registre de la population;- soit être un apatride et tomber sous l'application de la Convention relative au statut des apatrides, signée à New-York le 28 septembre 1954 et approuvée par la loi du 12 mai 1960;- soit être un réfugié au sens de l'article 49 de la loi du 15 décembre 1980 sur l'accès au territoire, le séjour, l'établissement et l'éloignement des étrangers;soit bénéficier de la protection subsidiaire au sens de l'article 49/2 de la loi du 15 décembre 1980 sur l'accès au territoire, le séjour, l'établissement et l'éloignement des étrangers;4° ne pas disposer de ressources suffisantes, ni pouvoir y prétendre ni être en mesure de se les procurer, soit par ses efforts personnels, soit par d'autres moyens. Le centre calcule les ressources de la personne conformément aux dispositions du titre II, chapitre II;5° être disposée à travailler, à moins que des raisons de santé ou d'équité l'en empêchent.6° faire valoir ses droits aux prestations dont elle peut bénéficier en vertu de la législation sociale belge et étrangère.
articleEN: To be able to benefit from the right to social integration, the person must simultaneously and without prejudice to the specific conditions provided for by this law: 1° have their effective residence in Belgium, as determined by the King; 2° be of legal age or be assimilated to a person of legal age in accordance with the provisions of this law; 3° belong to one of the following categories of persons:
question: Jusqu'à quel âge ai-je droit au RIS ?
questionEN: Up to what age do I have the right to RIS?
answerLLM: Based on the provided legal article, the right to social integration (which I assume is what you mean by "RIS") is available to persons who are of legal age or are assimilated to a person of legal age. However, the article does not provide a specific age limit for when this right is no longer available. Therefore, I would recommend checking the specific conditions and provisions of the law, as they may provide more information on the age at which this right ends. Additionally, it may be helpful to consult with a legal professional who is familiar with Belgian law for a more precise answer.
goldy: There is no age limit to be eligible for the social integration income (RIS). However, once you reach the age of 65, you may be eligible for Grapa (guaranteed income for elderly people) and/or a pension. You should prioritize applying for this pension or Grapa. The Public Center for Social Welfare (CPAS) will only grant you a RIS (or social assistance) if the amount of your Grapa or pension is insufficient. For more information, see our "Revenues for elderly people" section.

legal article: § 1. Il peut être imposé à l'intéressé de faire valoir ses droits à l'égard des personnes qui lui doivent des aliments, ces dernières étant limitées à : son conjoint ou, le cas échéant, son ex-conjoint; les ascendants et descendants du premier degré, l'adoptant et l'adopté.§ 2. Les conventions relatives à une pension alimentaire ne sont pas opposables au centre.§ 3. Le centre peut agir de plein droit au nom et en faveur de l'intéressé afin de faire valoir les droits visés aux articles 3, 6°, et 4, § 1.
articleEN: Section 1. The person concerned may be required to assert his rights with regard to those who owe him alimony, such persons being limited to:
question: Je désire quitter mes parents pour m'installer seul, le CPAS va-t-il m'aider (aide sociale) ?
questionEN: I want to leave my parents to live on my own, will the Public Center for Social Welfare help me (social aid)?
answerLLM: Based on the information provided in the legal article, it does not appear that the Public Center for Social Welfare is obligated to provide social aid to help you move out of your parents' home. The legal article only mentions that the person concerned may be required to assert his rights with regard to those who owe him alimony. Therefore, it is not clear from this article how the Public Center for Social Welfare would be involved in your situation. It is recommended that you consult with a legal professional or contact the Public Center for Social Welfare directly to inquire about your options for social aid.
goldy: This depends on your situation... and on the CPAS (Public Centers for Social Welfare). If the CPAS estimates that your desire for autonomy is not a genuine necessity but rather a "whim", and if your parents are still willing to accommodate you, the CPAS can legitimately consider that you are voluntarily putting yourself in a state of need. They can then rightfully refuse to help you, or at least ask you to address your maintenance creditors (in this case, your parents). If, however, the CPAS estimates that you have been truly forced to leave your parents' home, they must help you. For example, if you left your parents' home due to a major crisis situation, or because your parents can no longer host you in acceptable material conditions. These elements are often difficult to assess. Some CPAS help the young person if they have explained their situation before leaving their parents' home, and if this quest for autonomy is necessary. Make sure to inquire at your CPAS before leaving your parents' home. They can give you a preliminary agreement and commit to helping you if you leave your parents' home.

legal article: § 1er. La personne protégée ou à protéger, toute personne intéressée ou le procureur du Roi peuvent introduire une demande de mesure de protection fondée sur les articles 488/1 à 502 du Code civil ou les dispositions du présent chapitre.§ 2. Par dérogation au paragraphe 1er, le juge de paix peut prendre une mesure de protection d'office:1° si une demande visée aux articles 5, § 1er, et 23 de la loi du 26 juin 1990 relative à la protection de la personne des malades mentaux a été déposée ou si un rapport circonstancié visé aux articles 13, 14 et 25 de la même loi lui est transmis;2° si l'internement d'une personne a été ordonnée;3° dans les autres cas expressément prévus par la loi, notamment dans les cas prévus aux articles 490/1, § 2, et 490/2, § 2, alinéa 1er, du Code civil; ou4° s'il a été saisi conformément au paragraphe 1er et s'il l'estime utile, pour autant que les parties n'ont pas introduit de demande à cette fin.Dans le cas visé à l'alinéa 1er, 1°, la mesure de protection est ordonnée par ordonnance distincte.Le ministère public communique immédiatement la décision d'internement au juge de paix compétent.
articleEN: § 1. The protected person or the person to be protected, any interested person or the King's Prosecutor may submit a request for a protective measure based on articles 488/1 to 502 of the Civil Code or the provisions of this chapter.
question: Une personne mise en observation est-elle incapable de gérer ses biens ?
questionEN: Is a person under observation incapable of managing their assets?
answerLLM: Based on the provided legal article, it does not explicitly state that a person under observation is incapable of managing their assets. The article only mentions that a protective measure can be requested for a person based on articles 488/1 to 502 of the Civil Code or the provisions of this chapter. The specific criteria for incapacity to manage assets are not provided in the article. Therefore, additional information or context is needed to determine if a person under observation is incapable of managing their assets.
goldy: No. The decision of guardianship does not affect the protected person's legal capacity. The purpose of the measure is to treat a pathology. The protected person remains legally capable. They can, for example, pay bills, get married, exercise parental authority over their minor children, sign a contract, etc. It is only if a measure of administration of goods and/or of the person is pronounced that they lose their legal capacity. It is always the justice of the peace who pronounces this measure. The justice of the peace then designates an administrator of goods and/or of the person who will be in charge of managing the goods in place of the person under observation. There are bridges between these two regimes: the justice of the peace can receive at the same time a request for guardianship and a request for administration of goods and/or of the person; the justice of the peace who receives a request for guardianship can appoint an administrator of goods and/or of the person on their own initiative. For more information on the measure of administration of goods and/or of the person, please visit the "Administration of goods and/or of the person" fact sheets in our database.

legal article: On est responsable non seulement du dommage que l'on cause par son propre fait, mais encore de celui qui est causé par le fait des personnes dont on doit répondre, ou des choses que l'on a sous sa garde.Le père et la mère sont responsables du dommage causé par leurs enfants mineurs.Les maîtres et les commettants, du dommage causé par leurs domestiques et préposés dans les fonctions auxquelles ils les ont employés.Les instituteurs et les artisans, du dommage cause par leurs élèves et apprentis pendant le temps qu'ils sont sous leur surveillance.La responsabilité ci-dessus a lieu, à moins que les père et mère, instituteurs et artisans, ne prouvent qu'ils n'ont pu empêcher le fait qui donne lieu à cette responsabilité.
articleEN: A person is responsible not only for the damage he causes by his own actions, but also for that which is caused by the actions of the people for whom he is responsible, or of things which are in his care. The father and mother are responsible for the damage caused by their minor children. Masters and employers are responsible for the damage caused by their servants and agents in the functions they have assigned to them. Teachers and craftsmen are responsible for the damage caused by their students and apprentices during the time they are under their supervision. The aforementioned liability arises, unless the father and mother, teachers and craftsmen, prove that they could not prevent the act that gives rise to this liability.
question: Qui est couvert par l'assurance RC familiale ?
questionEN: Who is covered by the liability insurance for the family?
answerLLM:
Based on the provided legal article, the liability insurance for the family would cover individuals who are considered responsible for the actions of others. This includes:

1. Parents (father and mother) for the actions of their minor children.
2. Masters and employers for the actions of their servants and agents while performing their assigned functions.
3. Teachers and craftsmen for the actions of their students and apprentices during the time they are under their supervision.

These parties are responsible for the damage caused by the aforementioned individuals, unless they can prove that they could not prevent the act that led to the liability. Therefore, the liability insurance for the family would provide coverage for damages or injuries caused by the actions of these dependent individuals.
goldy: The "private liability" insurance is commonly called "RC familiale" (family civil liability insurance). Generally, it covers your civil liability in all aspects of your private life (that is, outside of your professional activities) with the exception of your contractual liability (for example, for your lease contract). To put it simply, the family civil liability insurance comes into play to compensate for the damages caused: by your fault; by the children who are part of your household; by your pets; or by your main residence. The "RC familiale" insurance contract covers the following individuals: the person who signed the insurance contract; their cohabiting partner (married or not); their children, if they are still part of the household; any person living with the signatory; domestic staff and family aides during their service; non-professional childminders; and pets. For these individuals, a single contract is sufficient. For instance, if you live as a couple, you do not need to take out separate private liability insurance policies. This applies regardless of whether you are married (under a legal cohabitation agreement or in a de facto relationship). However, it is important to note that the protections offered by different insurance policies may vary. Therefore, you should always check the content of your private liability insurance contract.

legal article: Ils sont  tenus de constater par écrit leur convention visant : 1° 32° l'autorité sur la personne et l'administration des biens des enfants et le droit aux relations personnelles visé à l'article 374, § 1er, alinéa 4, du Code civil en ce qui concerne les enfants mineurs non mariés et non émancipés communs aux deux époux, les enfants qu'ils ont adoptés et les enfants de l'un d'eux que l'autre a adoptés, tant durant la procédurequ'après le divorce;  3° la contribution de chacun des époux à l'entretien, à l'éducation et à la formation adéquate desdits enfants, sans préjudice des droits qui leur sont reconnus par le Chapitre V, Titre V, Livre premier, du Code civil; 4° le montant de ou la renonciation àl'éventuelle pension à payer par l'un des époux à l'autre durant la procédureet après le divorce, la formule de son éventuelle adaptation au coût de la vie, les circonstances dans lesquelles et les modalités selon lesquelles ce montant pourra être révisé après le divorce. Lorsque des circonstances nouvelles et indépendantes de la volonté des parties modifient sensiblement leur situation ou celle des enfants, les dispositions visées aux 2° et 3° de l'alinéa précédent peuvent être révisées après le divorce, par le juge compétent.  Sauf si les parties ont convenu expressément le contraire, le juge compétent peut, ultérieurement, à la demande d'une des parties, augmenter, réduire ou supprimer la pension visée à l'alinéa 1er, 4°, si, à la suite de circonstances nouvelles et indépendantes de la volonté des parties, son montant n'est plus adapté.En cas de conventions visées à l'article 1288, alinéa 1er, 2° ou 3°, l'affaire reste inscrite au rôle après le prononcé du divorce. Les parties peuvent ramener la cause devant le tribunal qui a prononcé le divorce dans les quinze jours par demande écrite déposée ou adressée au greffe en cas de circonstances nouvelles et indépendantes de la volonté des parties visées aux alinéas 2 et 3. Ces circonstances sont décrites dans les conclusions ou dans la demande écrite, à peine de nullité.
articleEN: They are required to put in writing their agreement concerning: 1° 32° authority over the person and administration of the property of children and the right to personal relationships pursuant to Article 374, § 1, paragraph 4, of the Civil Code with respect to minor unmarried and unemancipated children common to both spouses, children they have both adopted, and children of one of them that the other has adopted, both during the proceedings and after the divorce; 3° the contribution of each spouse to the maintenance, education, and adequate training of said children, without prejudice to the rights recognized to them by Chapter V, Title V, Book I, of the Civil Code; 4° the amount of or waiver of any potential alimony to be paid by one spouse to the other during the proceedings and after the divorce, the formula for its potential adaptation to the cost of living, the circumstances under which and the methods by which this amount may be revised after the divorce. When new circumstances and independent of the will of the parties significantly modify the situation of the parties or that of the children, the provisions concerning points 2° and 3° above may be revised after the divorce by the competent judge. Unless the parties have expressly agreed otherwise, the competent judge may, at a later date, at the request of one of the parties, increase, reduce, or suppress the alimony provided for in paragraph 1, 4°, if, due to new circumstances and independent of the will of the parties, its amount is no longer appropriate. In the event of agreements referred to in Article 1288, paragraph 1, 2° or 3°, the case remains registered after the pronouncement of the divorce. The parties may bring the case before the court that issued the divorce within fifteen days by written request filed or sent to the clerk's office in the event of new circumstances and independent of the will of the parties referred to in paragraphs 2 and 3. These circumstances are described in the conclusions or in the written request, failing which the request will be null.
question: Je souhaite divorcer par consentement mutuel. Puis-je demander une pension alimentaire à mon mari/ma femme ?
questionEN: I wish to divorce by mutual consent. Can I request spousal support from my husband/wife?
answerLLM: Based on the provided legal article, it appears that during a divorce by mutual consent, spouses are required to address and agree on certain matters, including the amount of or waiver of any potential alimony (spousal support) to be paid by one spouse to the other during the proceedings and after the divorce. Therefore, it is possible for one spouse to request spousal support from the other as part of the divorce agreement. However, the final amount of any spousal support will depend on the negotiations and agreement between the spouses. It is also worth noting that the amount of spousal support may be subject to revision in the future if new circumstances and independent of the will of the parties significantly modify the situation of the parties or that of the children.
goldy: Yes, but you must plan for it in your divorce conventions. A divorce by mutual consent means that both of you agree to divorce and that you settle yourselves, in conventions, all the questions related to the end of your marriage. These conventions are called "preliminary agreements to mutual consent divorce". In your conventions, you can consider that one of the two pays alimony to the other. You will have to plan its amount, its duration, if it is indexable, reviewable, removable, etc. In case of conflict, you will have to consider a divorce procedure for irreconcilable differences and have the question settled by the judge. He will then decide whether alimony is due or not and for what amount.

articleEN: Section 1. The following are exempt from the waiting period for the right to incapacity benefits:
question: Ai-je droit à des indemnités de la mutuelle quand je sors de prison (travailleur salarié) ?
questionEN: Do I have a right to mutual insurance benefits when I am released from prison (as a salaried worker)?
answerLLM:
Based on the information provided, the legal article discusses the exemptions to the waiting period for incapacity benefits, but it does not directly mention insurance benefits for individuals released from prison. Therefore, it is not possible to definitively answer your question without additional information or laws that specifically address insurance benefits for individuals released from prison.

However, I can provide some general guidance. In many jurisdictions, an individual's eligibility for insurance benefits, including mutual insurance benefits, may be governed by the terms of their insurance policy, as well as any applicable state or federal laws. If you have a specific insurance policy, you should review its terms and conditions to determine whether you are eligible for benefits upon release from prison.

Additionally, some jurisdictions may have laws or regulations that specifically address insurance benefits for individuals with criminal records. For example, some states have laws that prohibit insurers from denying coverage or charging higher premiums based solely on an individual's criminal history. If you are concerned about your eligibility for insurance benefits, you may want to consult with a legal professional or your state's insurance regulatory agency for further guidance.
goldy: Yes, if you meet the conditions. After the detention, you do not have to do an internship (waiver of internship) if: you become a titleholder again within 30 days after the preventive detention or the deprivation of liberty. You are a titleholder if you pay your own contributions to the health insurance fund; and you fulfilled the conditions to be a titleholder at the beginning of the preventive detention or the deprivation of liberty. For more information, see our Incapacity for Work section.

legal article: Une cause peut être rayée du rôle général avec l'accord des parties.Toute cause rayée du rôle général ne peut y être ramenée que par une citation nouvelle, sauf le droit des parties de comparaître volontairement.§ 2. a Dans les trois mois qui suivent chaque date anniversaire de l'inscription au rôle général des causes pour lesquelles aucune audience n'est fixée depuis dix-huit mois, le greffier notifie aux parties qu'à défaut d'une demande de maintien, leur cause sera omise d'office du rôle général. Cette notification se passe, sans préjudice de l'article 32ter, par pli judiciaire, et contient le texte du présent paragraphe.Les parties disposent d'un délai de deux mois à dater de cette notification pour communiquer ou déposer au greffe une demande de maintien de la cause au rôle général. Lorsque le délai expire durant les vacances judiciaires, il est prorogé jusqu'au quinzième jour de l'année judiciaire suivante. Lorsque le délai prend cours durant les vacances judiciaires, et expirerait avant le quinzième jour de l'année judiciaire suivante, il est prorogé jusqu'à ce jour.Toutes les causes dont le maintien n'est pas demandé par au moins une partie sont omises d'office du rôle général.Toute cause omise du rôle général peut être réinscrite à la demande de la partie la plus diligente.Le présent paragraphe n'est pas d'application à la procédure écrite visée à l'article 755.b Si l'instruction d'une affaire révèle un retard anormal, la cause peut être omise d'office du rôle des audiences ou du rôle général.Toute cause omise du rôle d'audience ou du rôle généralpeut y être ramenée par la partie la plus diligente sans autres formalités qu'une demande adressée au président de la chambre.En ce cas néanmoins il ne peut être statué par défaut à l'égard d'une partie si elle n'a été avertie par le greffier des jour et heure de l'audience où le défaut sera requis. Cet avertissement est donné par pli judiciaire, quinze jours au moins avant l'audience. S'il est justifié que par suite d'une circonstance non imputable à la partie, l'avertissement ne lui est pas parvenu, le juge peut ordonner qu'elle sera citée par huissier de justice.§ 3. L'omission d'une cause n'éteint ni le droit ni l'instance. La radiation éteint l'instance.NOTE : modifié par L2006-07-10/39, art. 15, 078;En vigueur :01-01-2017 voir L2014-12-19/24, art. 20, abrogé lui-même par l'art. 176, 9° de L2016-12-25/14;En vigueur :31-12-2016
articleEN: Article: A case may be struck off the general roll with the agreement of the parties. Any case struck off the general roll can only be restored to it by a new citation, except for the right of the parties to appear voluntarily. § 2. a In the three months following each anniversary of the registration of causes for which no hearing has been set for eighteen months, the clerk notifies the parties that, in the absence of a request for maintenance, their case will be automatically struck off the general roll. This notification is made, without prejudice to article 32ter, by registered mail, and contains the text of the present subsection. The parties have a period of two months from the date of this notification to communicate or deposit at the registry a request for the maintenance of the case on the general roll. When the deadline expires during the judicial vacations, it is extended until the fifteenth day of the following judicial year. When the deadline begins during the judicial vacations, and would expire before the fifteenth day of the following judicial year, it is extended until that day. All cases for which maintenance is not requested by at least one party are automatically struck off the general roll. Any case struck off the general roll may be re-registered at the request of the most diligent party. This subsection does not apply to written procedure referred to in article 755. b If the investigation of a case reveals an abnormal delay, the case may be automatically struck off the list of hearings or the general roll. Any case struck off the list of hearings or the general roll may be restored by the most diligent party without any other formality than a request addressed to the president of the chamber. However, no default judgment may be rendered against a party if they have not been notified by the registry of the date and time of the hearing at which the default will be requested. This notification is given by registered mail, at least fifteen days before the hearing. If it is proven that the notification has not been received by the party due to a circumstance beyond their control, the judge may order that they be cited by a bailiff. § 3. The striking off of a case does not extinguish the right or the action. The radiation extinguishes the action.
question: Comment introduire une demande devant la chambre de règlement amiable (CRA) ?
questionEN: How to introduce a request before the Chamber of Amicable Resolution (CRA)?
answerLLM:
To introduce a request before the Chamber of Amicable Resolution (CRA), you should be aware of the procedures related to the general roll of cases. According to the provided article, if no hearing has been set for a case within eighteen months of its registration, the parties will be notified that the case will be automatically struck off the general roll if no request for maintenance is received within two months of the notification. This notification is sent by registered mail and contains the text of the subsection.

To prevent your case from being automatically struck off the general roll, you or the other party should communicate or deposit a request for the maintenance of the case at the registry within the two-month period. If the two-month deadline falls during the judicial vacations, it will be extended until the fifteenth day of the following judicial year. If maintenance is not requested by at least one party, the case will be automatically struck off the general roll.

If your case has been struck off the general roll, you can still request its re-registration as the most diligent party. However, this does not apply to cases under written procedure referred to in article 755.

In summary, to introduce a request before the CRA, ensure that your case is still on the general roll or request its re-registration if it has been struck off. Monitor the progress of your case and respond to any notifications from the clerk to maintain your case on the general roll. If you need to request the maintenance of your case or its re-registration, do so within the specified timeframes to keep your case active before the CRA.
goldy: You must submit a request to the court clerk's office of the family court. You can either sign it together, or one of you can sign it. This request is free of charge. This is one of the main advantages of this procedure. You explain the points you wish to address, and any agreements you may have already reached. If a legal procedure is currently ongoing at the family court, you can at any time request the judge to suspend the procedure in order to attempt conciliation before the Dispute Resolution Chamber (DRC). If the judge determines that a reconciliation is possible, they may also impose it. There is no risk in attempting conciliation before the Dispute Resolution Chamber. If it fails, anything that was said remains confidential and you can return to the regular judge to rule on the dispute. The regular judge is never the same as the one who attempted to conciliate you. You can find a request template in the sample documents attached to this sheet.

legal article: La majorité est fixée à dix-huit ans accomplis; à cet âge, on est capable de tous les actes de la vie civile.
articleEN: Majority is set at eighteen years old; at that age, one is capable of all acts of civilian life.
question: Puis-je être mis sous administration de biens si je gère mal mon argent ?
questionEN: Can I be placed under guardianship of property if I mismanage my money?
answerLLM:
Based on the information provided in the legal article, there is no specific mention of guardianship of property due to mismanagement of money. The article states that majority is reached at eighteen years old, which implies that at that age, a person is considered capable of managing their own civilian life, including their financial affairs. However, it's important to note that this article may be incomplete or outdated, and other laws or circumstances could potentially lead to the appointment of a guardian of property in cases of mismanagement.

In general, the appointment of a guardian of property is a legal process that requires a court to determine that an individual is unable to manage their own financial affairs due to incapacity or disability. Mismanaging money alone may not be sufficient grounds for a guardianship of property. If you have concerns about your own financial management or that of someone else, it's recommended that you consult with a legal professional who can provide advice based on the specific circumstances and relevant laws in your jurisdiction.
goldy: Yes. If the judge estimates that you are in a state of prodigality, they can order a protective measure. This measure can only be assistance in managing your assets (not representation, and not assistance to the person). The law does not define the state of prodigality. The definition from common language is used. It refers to a person who spends their money in an excessive manner, thereby jeopardizing their finances. In this case, you need protection, not because of your state of health but only because of your state of prodigality. Therefore, it is not necessary to attach a medical certificate to the request. You should present to the judge the evidence of poor management (bank statements, existence of a debt situation, number of credits in progress, clearly unbalanced budget, etc.). The judge will assess based on the specific circumstances of your situation if a protective measure is necessary or not.

legal article: § 1er. Sans préjudice de l'article 50, les parties peuvent convenir de la révision du loyer entre le neuvième et le sixième mois précédant l'expiration de chaque triennat.A défaut d'accord des parties, le juge peut accorder la révision du loyer s'il est établi que par le fait de circonstances nouvelles, la valeur locative normale du bien loué est supérieure ou inférieure de vingt pour cent au moins au loyer exigible au moment de l'introduction de la demande.Il peut de même accorder une augmentation de loyer au bailleur qui établit que la valeur locative normale du bien loué a augmenté de dix pour cent au moins du loyer exigible au moment de l'introduction de la demande, en raison de travaux effectués à ses frais dans le bien loué à l'exception des travaux nécessaires en vue de mettre le bien loué en conformité avec les conditions de l'article 9, alinéa 1er.Si cette révision a pour effet d'augmenter le montant du loyer, elle n'est due que si le bail a été conclu par écrit et, pour un bail portant sur un bien immeuble, que si le bail écrit a été enregistré.Le juge statue en équité.L'action ne peut être intentée qu'entre le sixième et le troisième mois précédant l'expiration du triennat en cours.Le loyer révisé produit ses effets à compter du premier jour du triennat suivant, l'ancien loyer demeurant provisoirement exigible jusqu'à la décision définitive.Dans le cas de l'article 55, § 8, les parties peuvent cependant renoncer à la faculté de demander la révision du loyer.§ 2. Si un bien fait l'objet de baux successifs, conclus avec des preneurs différents pour une durée inférieure ou égale à trois ans, auxquels il est mis fin moyennant un congé donné par le bailleur, le loyer de base ne peut, pendant neuf années successives, pas être supérieur au loyer exigible au début de cette période, proportionnellement adapté au coût de la vie, sauf si la valeur locative normale du bien loué a augmenté de vingt pour cent au moins par le fait de circonstances nouvelles ou de dix pour cent au moins en raison de travaux effectués dans le bien loué.Nonobstant toute clause ou toute convention contraire, le juge réduit le loyer au loyer exigible en vertu du précédent bail, proportionnellement adapté au coût de la vie, si le bailleur ne prouve pas que le loyer a été fixé conformément aux dispositions de l'alinéa 1er.Le loyer proportionnellement adapté est calculé comme suit : loyer de base au début de la période de neuf années, multiplié par l'indice du mois précédant le mois de la conclusion du nouveau bail et divisé par l'indice du mois précédant le mois de la conclusion du bail au début de la période de neuf années.§ 3. A tout moment, chacune des parties peut demander au juge de paix la révision des frais et charges forfaitaires ou leur conversion en frais et charges réels.Le juge statue notamment sur la base de l'évolution des dépenses réelles.Il décide la conversion si elle est possible.
articleEN: Article 1: Without prejudice to article 50, the parties may agree to a revision of the rent between the ninth and the sixth month preceding the expiration of each three-year period. In the absence of an agreement between the parties, the judge may order a revision of the rent if it is established that, due to new circumstances, the normal value of the leased property is at least twenty percent higher or lower than the due rent at the time of filing the application. The judge may also grant an increase in rent to the landlord who establishes that the normal value of the leased property has increased by at least ten percent due to works carried out at their expense, with the exception of works necessary to bring the leased property into compliance with the conditions of article 9, paragraph 1. If this revision results in an increase in the rent, it is only due if the lease was concluded in writing and, for a lease of real estate, if the written lease has been registered. The judge rules in fairness. The action may only be brought between the sixth and the third month preceding the expiration of the current three-year period. The revised rent takes effect from the first day of the following three-year period, with the provisional continued payment of the old rent until the final decision. However, in the case of article 55, § 8, the parties may waive the right to request a revision of the rent.
question: Mon propriétaire peut-il augmenter mon loyer en cours de bail en Wallonie ?
questionEN: Can my landlord increase my rent during the lease in Wallonia?
answerLLM: Based on the provided legal article in Wallonia, the landlord cannot increase the rent during the lease except under certain conditions. The parties may agree to a revision of the rent between the ninth and the sixth month preceding the expiration of each three-year period. In the absence of an agreement, the judge may order a revision of the rent if there are new circumstances that justify an increase or decrease of at least 20% of the normal value of the leased property. Furthermore, the judge may grant an increase in rent to the landlord if they can prove that the normal value of the leased property has increased by at least 10% due to works carried out at their expense. However, these revisions can only take effect from the first day of the following three-year period, and the tenant must continue to pay the old rent until the final decision. Therefore, the landlord cannot increase the rent during the lease outside of these specific conditions and timeframes.
goldy: In principle, no. The landlord can only request a rent increase in certain cases (during a revision). If this revision results in an increase in the rent amount, it is only due if the lease: is written; and registered in the case of a lease for a real estate property. The landlord can only request a rent revision between the 9th and 6th months preceding the end of a triennium in progress. For example: If the end of a triennium in progress is December 31, the rent revision can be requested between April 1 and June 30. If the end of a triennium in progress is January 31, the rent revision can be requested between May 1 and July 31, and so on. If you agree to the revision amount within this time frame, the new rent will be due on the first day of the following triennium. If you do not agree, your landlord can address the matter to the justice of the peace between the 6th and 3rd months preceding the expiration of the triennium. For example: If the end of a triennium is December 31, the request to the justice of the peace must be between July 1 and September 30. If the end of a triennium is January 31, the request to the justice of the peace must be between August 1 and October 31. The competent justice of the peace is the one located where the housing is situated. To know their contact information, see the website of territorial competence. The revision is granted by the justice of the peace in two cases: New circumstances increase the rental value by 20% compared to the rent paid at the time of the request. The landlord must prove the new circumstances and the increase in rental value. The evolution of the real estate market does not constitute a "new circumstance". For example, the improvement of access routes or the opening of a school in the vicinity are new circumstances. The landlord has carried out work that has increased the rental value by at least 10% compared to the rent paid at the time of the request. They must provide proof. The work must have been paid for by the landlord (and not by the tenant). The work must be different from the work they are required to perform as a landlord. For example, work done to ensure the housing complies with safety and health requirements will not allow for an increase in rent. If the judge finds that the conditions for a rent revision request are met, they can grant the revision. In this case, they set the amount of the new rent, taking into account the interests of both parties. The revised rent is due on the first day of the following triennium. It should be noted that, if legal action is not completed by this time, the revised rent will be applied retroactively from the first day of the following triennium.

legal article: § 1er. Les père et mère sont tenus d'assumer, à proportion de leurs facultés, l'hébergement, l'entretien, la santé, la surveillance, l'éducation, la formation et l'épanouissement de leurs enfants. Si la formation n'est pas achevée, l'obligation se poursuit après la majorité de l'enfant.§ 2. Par facultés, on entend notamment tous les revenus professionnels, mobiliers et immobiliers des père et mère, ainsi que tous les avantages et autres moyens qui assurent leur niveau de vie et celui des enfants.§ 3. Dans la limite de ce qu'il a recueilli dans la succession du conjoint prédécédé et des avantages que celui-ci lui aurait consentis par contrat de mariage, donation ou testament, l'époux survivant est tenu de l'obligation établie au paragraphe 1er envers les enfants du prédécédé dont il n'est pas lui-même le père ou la mère.Cette obligation est caduque à l'égard de l'enfant indigne d'hériter du conjoint prédécédé. Le juge suspend son prononcé jusqu'à ce que la décision entraînant l'indignité soit passée en force de chose jugée.
articleEN: Section 1. The father and mother are required to contribute, in proportion to their abilities, to the housing, maintenance, health, supervision, education, training, and development of their children. If the education is not completed, the obligation continues after the child reaches the age of majority.
question: Je suis parent. Qu'est-ce que l'obligation alimentaire des parents envers leur enfant ?
questionEN: I am a parent. What is the parents' obligation of support towards their child?
answerLLM: Based on the provided legal article, the parents' obligation of support towards their child includes contributing in proportion to their abilities to the child's housing, maintenance, health, supervision, education, training, and development. This obligation continues even after the child reaches the age of majority if their education has not been completed. Therefore, as a parent, you are required to provide support to your child in these areas in accordance with your abilities.
goldy: Parents have the obligation to ensure the education, training, maintenance, housing, health and well-being of their children in the age of formation (minor or adult). This derives from the fact of being a parent. Once the filial link exists, the parent has this obligation towards their child. Parents cannot renounce this obligation. This obligation must be carried out in accordance with the financial means of the parents. By financial means of parents, we mean notably: all income (e.g. salary, revenue from shares, rent, etc.); all benefits and other means that ensure their standard of living (e.g. company car, bonuses, etc.). This obligation must allow the child to benefit from the same standard of living as their parents. Therefore, the obligation of parents does not stop at the bare minimum. This obligation is first carried out spontaneously and in-kind, i.e. parents must provide housing to the child, feed them, clothe them, take care of their health, etc. If in-kind execution is not possible, for example because the parents are separated or because the young person has left the family home, the obligation of maintenance is carried out by the payment of a sum of money. This sum is called the contribution alimentaire.

legal article: § 1er. L'étranger qui séjourne en Belgique qui démontre son identité conformément au § 2 et qui souffre d'une maladie telle qu'elle entraîne un risque réel pour sa vie ou son intégrité physique ou un risque réel de traitement inhumain ou dégradant lorsqu'il n'existe aucun traitement adéquat dans son pays d'origine ou dans le pays où il séjourne, peut demander l'autorisation de séjourner dans le Royaume auprès du ministre ou son délégué.La demande doit être introduite par pli recommandé auprès du ministre ou son délégué et contient l'adresse de la résidence effective de l'étranger en Belgique.L'étranger transmet avec la demande tous les renseignements utiles et récentsconcernant sa maladie et les possibilités et l'accessibilité de traitement adéquat dans son pays d'origine ou dans le pays où il séjourne.Il transmet un certificat médical type prévu par le Roi, par arrêté délibéré en Conseil des Ministres. Ce certificat médical datant de moins de trois mois précédant le dépôt de la demandeindique la maladie, son degré de gravité et le traitement estimé nécessaire.L'appréciation du risque visé à l'alinéa 1er, des possibilités de traitement, leur accessibilité dans son pays d'origine ou dans le pays où il séjourne et de la maladie, son degré de gravité et le traitement estimé nécessaire indiqués dans le certificat médical, est effectuée par un fonctionnaire médecin ou un médecin désigné par le ministre ou son délégué qui rend un avis à ce sujet. Ce médecin peut, s'il l'estime nécessaire, examiner l'étranger et demander l'avis complémentaire d'experts.§ 1er/1. L'obtention d'une autorisation de séjour dans le Royaume visée au présent article peut être refusée à l'étranger qui ne se présente pas à la date fixée dans la convocation par le fonctionnaire médecin, ou le médecin désigné par le ministre ou son délégué, ou l'expert désigné par le ministre ou son délégué, et qui ne donne pas, au plus tard dans les quinze jours suivant cette date, de motif valable à ce sujet.§ 2. Avec la demande, l'étranger démontre son identité visée au § 1er, alinéa 1er, par un document d'identité ou un élément de preuve qui répond aux conditions suivantes :1° il contient le nom complet, le lieu et la date de naissance et la nationalité de l'intéressé;2° il est délivré par l'autorité compétente conformément à la loi du 16 juillet 2004 portant le Code de droit international privé ou les conventions internationales relatives à la même matière;3° il permet un constat d'un lien physique entre le titulaire et l'intéressé;4° il n'a pas été rédigé sur la base de simples déclarations de l'intéressé.L'étranger peut également démontrer son identité par plusieurs éléments de preuve qui, pris ensemble, réunissent les éléments constitutifs de l'identité prévus par l'alinéa 1er, 1°, à condition que chaque élément de preuve réponde au moins aux conditions visées à l'alinéa 1er, 2° et 4°, et qu'au moins un des éléments réponde à la condition visée à l'alinéa 1er, 3°.L'obligation de démontrer son identité n'est pas d'application au demandeur d'asile dont la demande d'asile n'a pas fait l'objet d'une décision définitive ou qui a introduit un recours en cassation administrative déclaré admissible conformément à l'article 20 des lois sur le Conseil d'Etat, coordonnées le 12 janvier 1973, et ce jusqu'au moment où un arrêt de rejet du recours admis est prononcé. L'étranger qui jouit de cette dispense la démontre expressément dans sa demande.§ 3. Le délégué du ministre déclare la demande irrecevable :1° lorsque l'étranger n'introduit pas sa demande par pli recommandé auprès du ministre ou son délégué ou lorsque la demande ne contient pas l'adresse de la résidence effective en Belgique;2° lorsque, dans la demande, l'étranger ne démontre pas son identité selon les modalités visées au § 2 ou lorsque la demande ne contient pas la preuve prévue au § 2, alinéa 3;3° lorsque le certificat médical type n'est pas produit avec la demande ou lorsque le certificat médical type ne répond pas aux conditions prévues au § 1er, alinéa 4;4° lorsque le fonctionnaire médecin ou le médecin désigné par le ministre ou son délégué, visé au § 1er, alinéa 5, constate dans un avis que la maladie ne répond manifestement pas à une maladie visée au § 1er, alinéa 1er, qui peut donner lieu à l'obtention d'une autorisation de séjour dans le Royaume;5°dans les cas visés à l'article 9bis, § 2, 1° à 3°, ou si des éléments invoqués à l'appui de la demande d'autorisation de séjour dans le Royaume ont déjà été invoqués dans le cadre d'une demande précédente d'autorisation de séjour dans le Royaume sur la base de la présente disposition à l'exception des éléments invoqués dans le cadre d'une demande jugée irrecevable sur la base de l'article 9ter, § 3, 1°, 2° ou 3°, et à l'exception des éléments invoqués dans les demandes précédentes qui ont fait l'objet d'un désistement.§ 4. L'étranger est exclu du bénéfice de la présente disposition lorsque le ministre ou son délégué considère qu'il y a de motifs sérieux de considérer qu'il a commis des actes visés à l'article 55/4.§ 5. Les experts visés au § 1er, alinéa 5,sont désignés par le Roi, par arrêté délibéré en Conseil des Ministres.Le Roi fixe les règles de procédure par arrêté délibéré en Conseil des ministres et détermine également le mode de rémunération des experts visés à l'alinéa 1er.§ 6. L'article 458 du Code pénal est applicable au délégué du ministre et aux membres de son service, en ce qui concerne les données médicales dont ils ont connaissance dans l'exercice de leurs fonctions.§ 7. La demande d'autorisation de séjour dans le Royaume visée au présent article, faite par un étranger qui a été admis ou autorisé au séjour pour une durée illimitée, est déclarée d'office sans objet lorsqu'elle est encore examinée par l'Office des Etrangers, à moins que l'étranger demande dans un délai de soixante jours à partir de l'entrée en vigueur de la présente disposition ou à partir du moment de la remise du titre qui fait preuve du séjour illimité, la poursuite de son examen par lettre recommandée adressée à l'Office des Etrangers.§ 8. La demande d'autorisation de séjour dans le Royaume est examinée uniquement sur la base de la dernière demande introduite transmise par envoi recommandé au ministre ou à son délégué. L'étranger qui introduit une nouvelle demande est réputé se désister des demandes pendantes introduites antérieurement.
articleEN: Article 1. Any foreigner staying in Belgium who demonstrates their identity in accordance with Article 2 and who is suffering from a disease such that it presents a real risk to their life or physical integrity, or a real risk of inhumane or degrading treatment for which no adequate treatment is available in their country of origin or in the country where they are staying, may request authorization to stay in the Kingdom from the Minister or their delegate. The request must be submitted by registered mail to the Minister or their delegate and must include the address of the foreigner's actual residence in Belgium. The foreigner shall include with the request all useful and up-to-date information regarding their disease and the possibilities and accessibility of adequate treatment in their country of origin or in the country where they are staying. They shall include a medical certificate of the type determined by the King, by decree deliberated in the Council of Ministers. This medical certificate, which must be dated less than three months prior to the submission of the request, shall indicate the disease, its severity, and the estimated necessary treatment. The assessment of the risk referred to in paragraph 1, the treatment possibilities, their accessibility in the country of origin or in the country where they are staying, and the disease, its severity, and the estimated necessary treatment indicated in the medical certificate, shall be carried out by a civil servant physician or a physician designated by the Minister or their delegate, who shall issue an opinion on the matter. This physician may, if necessary, examine the foreigner and seek the advice of experts.
question: J'ai introduit une demande de régularisation médicale (9ter). J’ai introduit une demande 9ter. Ai-je droit à l’aide du CPAS ?
questionEN: I have submitted an application for regularization on medical grounds (9ter). Do I have a right to the assistance of the Public Center for Social Welfare (CPAS)?
answerLLM: Based on the provided legal article, there is no explicit mention of a right to the assistance of the Public Center for Social Welfare (CPAS) for foreigners who have submitted an application for regularization on medical grounds (9ter). The article focuses on the conditions and procedures for requesting authorization to stay in Belgium due to a medical condition. Therefore, I cannot affirm that such a right exists based on this article alone. It is recommended to consult the relevant legislation or seek legal advice regarding the rights to CPAS assistance for this specific situation.
goldy: This depends on the stage of your procedure. The procedure for a regularization request on medical grounds (9 ter) takes place in two phases: a recevability phase, where the Office of Foreigners (OE) checks if your file is complete (medical certificate, address, etc.); and a phase on the merits, where once your file is admissible, the OE checks the severity of your illness and if the treatment is available in your home country. During the recevability phase, you are entitled in principle only to emergency medical aid, subject to certain conditions (social investigation, urgent care, existence of health insurance or a guarantor, etc.). For more information, see the sheet "Under what conditions am I entitled to emergency medical aid?". During the phase on the merits, you are entitled to social aid. If your request has been declared admissible, you will in principle receive an attestation of registration (orange card). This card is valid for 3 months and is renewable on a monthly basis, as long as a decision on the merits has not been taken by the OE. If you receive a negative decision, the right to social aid ends at the expiration of the 30-day period indicated on the order to leave the territory. At that time, you are only entitled to emergency medical aid, subject to certain conditions (social investigation, urgent care, existence of health insurance or a guarantor, etc.). Social welfare centers generally refuse access to any other form of social aid. If you have lodged an appeal with the Aliens Litigation Council (CCE), you are entitled in principle only to emergency medical aid, subject to certain conditions. BUT! Case law Abdida provides that the social welfare center cannot refuse social aid (for reasons related to the right of residence): in case of appeal to the CCE: until the decision of refusal of the CCE or of refusal of the OE following a re-examination; if no appeal is lodged: until the expiration of the 30-day period provided for lodging an appeal with the CCE. To invoke this case law, the refusal of social aid by the social welfare center must be the subject of an appeal before the labor court. Talk to your lawyer about it.

legal article: La personne à protéger ou protégée a le droit d'être soutenue, pendant toute la durée de l'administration, par une personne de confiance qu'elle a désignée personnellement.L'homologation de la désignation de la personne de confiance s'effectue, sur requête écrite ou verbale adressée au juge de paix, par la personne protégée ou à protéger, par un tiers dans l'intérêt de celle-ci, ou par le procureur du Roi, au début ou au cours de l'administration. Le juge de paix s'assure au préalable de son acceptation et statue par une ordonnance spécialement motivée.Si la personne désignée conformément aux articles 496 et 496/1 accepte la fonction de personne de confiance, le juge de paix homologue la désignation, à moins que des raisons graves tenant à l'intérêt de la personne protégée et précisées dans les motifs de l'ordonnance n'interdisent de suivre ce choix.Si la personne protégée n'a pas désigné personnellement de personne de confiance, le juge de paix peut examiner la possibilité d'homologuer néanmoins la désignation d'une personne de confiance, conformément aux alinéas 2 et 3, ou peut désigner d'office une personne de confiance.2Ne peuvent être désignés comme personne de confiance :1° l'administrateur de la personne protégée;2° les personnes à l'égard desquelles a été prise une mesure de protection judiciaire ou extrajudiciaire;3° les personnes morales;4° les personnes qui, conformément à l'article 32 de la loi du 8 avril 1965 relative à la protection de la jeunesse, à la prise en charge des mineurs ayant commis un fait qualifié infraction et à la réparation du dommage causé par ce fait, sont totalement déchues de l'autorité parentale;5° si l'administration est exercée par les deux parents ou par l'un des deux, un parent de la personne protégée jusqu'au deuxième degré.Toutefois, dans des circonstances exceptionnelles, le juge de paix peut déroger, par une ordonnance spécialement motivée, à l'alinéa 6, 5°, s'il constate que cela sert l'intérêt de la personne protégée.Le juge de paix peut refuser la désignation de la personne de confiance sur la base de son extrait de casier judiciaire.Il peut, dans l'intérêt de la personne protégée, désigner plusieurs personnes de confiance.Le cas échéant, il précise les compétences des différentes personnes de confiance ainsi que les modalités d'exercice de leur compétence.
articleEN: Article: The person to be protected or protected has the right to be assisted, throughout the duration of the administration, by a trusted person whom they have personally designated. The approval of the designation of the trusted person is carried out, at the request of the protected or to-be-protected person, by a written or verbal request addressed to the justice of the peace, by a third party in the interest of the latter, or by the king's prosecutor, at the beginning or during the administration. The justice of the peace ensures its acceptance in advance and rules by a special motivated decree. If the person designated in accordance with articles 496 and 496/1 accepts the function of trusted person, the justice of the peace approves the designation, unless serious reasons relating to the interest of the protected person and specified in the reasons for the decree prohibit following this choice. If the protected person has not personally designated a trusted person, the justice of the peace may consider the possibility of approving the designation of a trusted person, in accordance with subparagraphs 2 and 3, or may appoint a trusted person ex officio. (1) No one who is an administrator of the protected person, (2) persons against whom a judicial or extrajudicial protective measure has been taken, (3) legal entities, (4) persons who, in accordance with article 32 of the law of April 8, 1965 on the protection of youth, the care of minors who have committed an act considered an offense and the repair of damage caused by this act, are totally deprived of parental authority, (5) if the administration is exercised by one or both parents, a parent of the protected person up to the second degree, can be designated as a trusted person. However, in exceptional circumstances, the justice of the peace may, by a special motivated decree, depart from subparagraph 6, 5th, if he or she finds that this serves the interest of the protected person. The justice of the peace may refuse the designation of the trusted person based on their criminal record. He or she may, in the interest of the protected person, designate several trusted persons. If necessary, he or she specifies the competences of the different trusted persons and the modalities of the exercise of their competence.
question: Puis-je changer de personne de confiance ou mettre fin à sa mission ?
questionEN: Can I change my nominated confident or end their assignment?
answerLLM:
Based on the provided legal article, it is possible for a protected person to change their designated confident or end their assignment. The article states that the protected person has the right to be assisted by a trusted person whom they have personally designated, and the designation can be approved by a justice of the peace. If the protected person wishes to change their designated confident, they can make a written or verbal request to the justice of the peace, who will then approve the new designation unless there are serious reasons relating to the interest of the protected person.

However, there are certain restrictions on who can be designated as a trusted person, such as administrators of the protected person, persons against whom a protective measure has been taken, legal entities, and persons who are totally deprived of parental authority. The justice of the peace may also refuse the designation of a trusted person based on their criminal record.

It is important to note that the specific procedures and requirements for changing a designated confident may vary depending on the jurisdiction and the specific circumstances of the case. Therefore, it is recommended to consult with a legal professional for advice on how to proceed with changing a designated confident in a specific situation.
goldy: Before going any further, be careful as several laws use the term "trusted person" (for example, the patient's rights law, the euthanasia law, the law on the protection of mental patients), but this term does not always have the same meaning. The mission of the trusted person is different according to the law in which they intervene. Here, we are talking about the trusted person in the context of the measure of administration of property and/or the person. Yes, you can change your trusted person, or end their mission, at any time. You, the protected person, can renounce the assistance of the trusted person or request the designation of someone else. You can do this at any time, throughout the judicial protection measure. To do so, you must: send a letter to the justice of the peace and the administrator; or request it online via the Central Register of Protection of Persons; or request it orally during a hearing. 2. The justice of the peace can also, in your interest, decide at any time to end the mission of the trusted person. 3. If a close person notices that the trusted person is not acting in your interest, they can inform the justice of the peace or the administrator at any time. These different requests can be made by a simple letter to the justice of the peace.

legal article: L'article 595 du Code civil, relatif aux baux consentis par l'usufruitier, est applicable aux baux des biens des mineurs.
articleEN: Article 595 of the Civil Code, relating to leases granted by the usufructuary, is applicable to leases of the property of minors.
question: Comment mettre fin au bail de commun accord en Wallonie ?
questionEN: How to mutually terminate a lease in Wallonia?
answerLLM:
Based on the information you have provided, I can tell you that Article 595 of the Walloon Civil Code governs the termination of leases related to the property of minors. However, this article does not specifically address the process for mutually terminating a lease.

In general, to mutually terminate a lease in Wallonia, both the landlord and tenant must agree to end the lease agreement. This can be done through a written agreement signed by both parties, which should specify the date on which the lease will end and any other relevant terms.

If the lease involves the property of a minor, it is important to ensure that any agreement to terminate the lease is in the best interests of the minor. This may require the involvement of a legal guardian or other representative.

It is always a good idea to consult with a legal professional or the relevant authorities in Wallonia to ensure that you are following the proper procedures for terminating a lease.
goldy: You can always terminate your lease by mutual agreement. Put the agreement in a signed and dated written document by you and your landlord. Each of you should keep a signed copy of this agreement. This way, neither of you will be able to change your mind later. Be sure to specify in this writing: the exact date of returning the keys (= end of contract); the date of the move-out inspection and the fate of the security deposit; whether there is or is not a break fee. Make sure to indicate that "the parties are discharged and free from all obligations to each other" at the time of signing your agreement, if: both parties have fulfilled all their obligations; and the building is in good condition.

legal article: La durée des vacances légales est fixée au prorata du nombre de journées de travail effectif normal que comporte l'exercice de vacances et de journées d'interruption de travail assimilées à des journées de travail effectif de cet exercice. Par exercice de vacances, il faut entendre l'année civile qui précède celle au cours de laquelle les vacances doivent être accordées. En ce qui concerne l'application des articles relatifs au report des vacances, le report des vacances n'a pas d'incidence sur les définitions des termes " année de service de vacances " et " année de vacances ".
articleEN: The duration of legal vacations is set according to the proportion of normal working days, including equivalent days of interruption of work, that make up the vacation exercise and vacation year. By vacation exercise, it is meant the civil year preceding the year in which vacations are to be granted. As for the application of articles relating to the carryover of vacations, the carryover of vacations does not affect the definitions of the terms "vacation service year" and "vacation year".
question: A combien de jours de congés ai-je droit ?
questionEN: What number of days of vacation am I entitled to?
answerLLM: Based on the provided legal article, the number of days of vacation you are entitled to is determined by the proportion of normal working days in the "vacation exercise" and "vacation year." The "vacation exercise" is defined as the civil year preceding the year in which vacations are to be granted. However, the article does not provide specific details on how to calculate the exact number of vacation days. Therefore, it is not possible to give a specific numerical answer to your question without additional information. It is recommended to consult with a legal professional or your employer to determine your specific entitlement to vacation days.
goldy: Before going further, be aware that this sheet only concerns the vacations of salaried workers. The rules are not the same for public sector workers (civil servants), nor for self-employed workers. There are also differences between employees and workers. Furthermore, this sheet explains the general rules provided by law, but special rules exist for certain sectors of activity or for certain companies. Consult your human resources department, or the National Office for Annual Vacations (ONVA). In principle, you are entitled to a maximum of 20 legal days off per year, if you work 5 days a week. However, the number of days of leave to which you are entitled during a year (known as the "vacation year") depends on the number of days of work you have performed in the previous year (known as the "vacation exercise"). For example, if you worked for 6 months in 2021, you are entitled to only 10 legal days off in 2022. If you worked part-time in 2021, your days off in 2022 are proportional to the number of days of work performed. However, you are then entitled to additional vacations to reach 20 days per year. Be aware that certain days are considered as days of work, for example: sick days (during the first 12 months); maternity leave; etc. For more information, see the website of the National Office for Annual Vacations (ONVA). If you work 6 days a week, you are entitled to 24 legal days off per year. Be aware that if you are a worker, your vacation sheet indicates your days off in a 6-day week regime. Consult the attached table to your sheet to know how many days you are entitled to. Certain sectors of activity or certain companies grant extra-legal days off, or additional leave. These are days off granted in addition to the 20 legal days off, for example, due to seniority, or the function performed, etc. Extra-legal days off are not defined by law. They are provided for in: a collective bargaining agreement (CBA); your work regulations; or your employment contract. Consult your employer or the human resources department of your company.

legal article: § 1er. La répétition des allocations versées indûment se prescrit par trois ans à compter de la date du paiement.Le délai prévu à l'alinéa 1er est ramené à un an lorsque le paiement résulte uniquement de l'erreur d'un service administratif ou organisme, et dont l'intéressé ne peut normalement se rendre compte.Le délai prévu à l'alinéa 1er est porté à cinq ans lorsque les sommes indues ont été perçues suite à des manoeuvres frauduleuses ou à des déclarations fausses ou sciemment incomplètes.
